She works hard with her husband to be able to raise her children and she needs the loan to add to her savings to pay the school costs. Her dreams include seeing her family get ahead.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar Meléndez  es el propietario del  almacén de ropa X Treme Wear, él es casado y tiene dos hijos en las edades de  4 y 6 años; inició vendiendo ropa por encargo entre sus amigos y familiares, después de quedar sin empleo, hace tres años, desde ese momento su negocio ha cambiado su vida porque le generó mayor autonomía y mejores ingresos para el bienestar familiar. Su sueño es convertirlo en un gran almacén, pero en su propio local y bien ubicado en el centro de Barranquilla, pero su gran desafío es el recurso financiero para ello. Este es el propósito de su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará prendas de vestir para caballeros, entre suéteres y jeans, porque su experiencia le dice que es lo que mas salida tienen la temporada de Diciembre y Enero.  Los indicadores financieros del negocio son los siguientes: Margen de utilidad 46%, margen de contribución 54% y utilidad operativa 25%. Cesar es un hombre muy trabajador que toda la comunidad del barrio la Paz y por eso ha logrado posicionar su negocio, él es además un excelente miembro de familia, que tiene como propósito mejorar diariamente sus ingresos, mediante el trabajo constante, para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Cesar Meléndez owns the clothing store X Treme Wear, he is married with two children aged 4 and 6.  He began selling clothing on commission to his friends and family after becoming unemployed three years ago.  Since then his business has changed his life because it allowed him more autonomy and better income for the wellbeing of his family. His dream is to have a large store on its own premises and well situated in the center of Barranquilla, but the big challenge is the financial resources to do so. 

This is the purpose for his credikiva, which is the first funding that he will receive from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it he will buy men's clothing, including sweaters and jeans, because his experience tells him that is what most popular during the December and January period. The financial indicators of his business are as follows: 46% profit margin, 54% contribution margin and 25% operating income. 

Cesar is a hardworking man known by the whole community of the Paz neighborhood, which is why he has achieved this position with his business.  He is also an excellent family member, whose purpose is to improve their income on a daily basis through hard work, so his family can get ahead.

loans.use: To buy men's clothing, including sweaters and jeans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is married and has four children. Her husband is an electrical welder. She smokes fish at Takoradi market for sale.  With the income she makes from her sales, she assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She is asking for a loan to add to her initial income to expand her fish selling business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: To expand smoked fish business

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona A. is currently in the business of selling wax and saddles.  She is requesting a loan to stock more wax from Congo to sell.  Lona is 31 years old and is married.  Her husband is a mechanical engineer. She has 5 children – 3 are going to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more wax to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi O. is a fish seller at Takoradi market. She is married and has one child. She helps her husband provide the basic needs for their family. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of fresh fish to smoke to meet the tastes of her consumers. The additional income accrued as a result of the loan will be saved towards the education of her child.

loans.use: To buy fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Adriana Marcela

texts.es: Adriana Carbò es una joven de 22 años que tiene un negocio de vender frutos secos, aceitunas y aromáticas, en el centro de Barranquilla, una zona donde se moviliza gran parte del comercio del sur de la ciudad. Su negocio surgiò hace tres años, despues de la separaciòn de sus padres, momento en el el cual ella asumiò  su administraciòn.  Hoy su padre radicado en Bogotà, le facilia los contactos con los proveedores, con quienes mantiene muy buenas relaciones. Adriana està estudiando en la universidad Administraciòn de empresas y ella manifiesta que el tener su negocio le ha significado mucho en su crecimiento personal y tambien el estudiar le ha aportado a su desarrollo empresarial. Como su trabajo le apasiona, no pierde la oportunidad de estudiar las caracteristicas y los componenetes de sus productos. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprarà manì, aceitunas, marañon, pistachos, canela y manzanilla. Asi se prepararà para en las navidades vender estos productos que tanto agradan a sus clientes y sirven para acompañar las bebidas  de los brindis navideños.  Su meta es ampliar su negocio creando nuevos  puntos de ventas , mientras tanto trabajarà y estudiarà hasta perfeccionar su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Adriana Carbò is a young woman, 22 years old, who owns a business selling dried fruit, olives and spices in Barranquilla's town center, where much of the commercial activities from the southern part of the city take place. 

Her business has been growing for three years; Adriana began managing it after her parents separated. Today her father lives in Bogotà, where he maintains relationships with their suppliers. 

Adriana is studying business administration at the university. Managing her business has helped her personal growth, and her studies have helped her develop business skills. Her work is her passion and she never misses an opportunity to study the characteristics and components of her products. This is her first loan from Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy peanuts, olives, marañon fruit, pistachio nuts, cinnamon and chamomile. This way she will be prepared for Christmas when these products are in high demand because they are served with drinks to toast the holiday season. Adriana's goal is to expand her business with new store locations, while studying to perfect her entrepreneurial skills.

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts, olives, marañon fruit, pistachio nuts, cinnamon and chamomile.

loans.name: Afansi

texts.fr: Elle est âgée de 63 ans et mariée. Elle a en charge  4 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des boissons en canette et jus. Elle fait cette activité il y a de cela 10 ans et achète les boissons à la Brasserie du bénin  et au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite, elle revend dans une boutique à son domicile à Adakpamé à côté de l’école baptiste.  Elle demande un crédit  pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: She is 63 years old and married. She has four children in her care. She makes a living by selling canned beverages and juices. She has been in this line of business for 10 years. She buys her beverages  from the Brasserie du Bening [a major regional brewery] and at the big market of Lomé. She then resells the beverages in a store located at her home in Adakpame, near a Baptist school. She is seeking a loan in order to   meet the ever increasing demand.

loans.use: Purchasing canned beverages and ingredients for making juices

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. sells kenkey (a type of steamed dumpling) and earrings at Takoradi market. Her husband is a mason. She is married and has four children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to sell and to cook kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to revive her earring business.

In the picture, Maame is standing by the maize which she sells.  She also uses the maize to make kenkey for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize to sell and cook kenkey for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cans of paint

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty T. is currently in the business of selling wax and beans at the market.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Betty is 31 years old and is married.  Her husband is a farmer. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a clinic.

loans.use: To stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Enilda Del Carmen

texts.es: Enilda es una mujer muy cristiana, tiene una Hija de 12 años con quien  vive, ademàs de su madre, hermana y dos adorables sobrinos. Enilda es una profesional que aplica sus conocimientos a sus multiples  negocios, en los cuales se mueve en compañía de su hermana y su madre, como son el de elaborar productos congelados como deditos, empanaditas,  bolitas de carne  y demàs pasabocas , que empaca cuidadosamente y que forman parte de los productos que consumen sus clientes durante eventos como reuniones familiares, de amigos de profesionales y de filiales de su iglesia, en la cual pariticipa activamente. Enilda como es una mujer inquieta, tambien trabaja en una empresa estatal por contrato y de manera estacionaria, haciendo investigaciones estadisticas y asi mismo se dedica a vender mercancia de acuerdo a la temporada;  algunas veces ella y su hermana fabrican calzado y lo venden, otras veces compran perfumes, ropa y otros productos cosmèticos para lograr la sostenibilidad de su negocio, pero  Enilda siempre està en funciòn de mejorar como persona,  como empresaria, como miembro de familia y de su comunidad. Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento comprarà ropa y productos cosmèticos, pero ademàs invertira en harina de trigo y sus componentes, para elaborar productos derivados de esta. Su sueño y gran desafio es que su pequeña hija logre estudiar y ser una profesional exitosa, con conocimientos de muchos idiomas para que la prosperidad siempre la acompañe y tambien tener  un gran almacen, donde los clientes siempre que la busquen , encuentren todo lo que ellos necesitan y deseen. Mientras tanto vive agradecida con Dios por su comunidad cristiana y por su gran familia,  que tambien han sido grandes forjadores de recursos para su hogar compartido con ellas.
texts.en:
Enilda is a very Christian woman.  She has a daughter, 12 years of age, with whom she lives along with her mother, sister and two adorable cousins.  Enilda is a professional who applies her know-how to her multiples businesses, in which she works in company with her sister and their mother.  The businesses include making frozen products such as 'fingers', patties, and pellets of meat and also appetizers, that she packs carefully and that form part of the products that their clients consume during events such as meetings of family, friends, professionals and subsidiaries of their church, in which she is an active participant.  
Enilda is a restless woman.  She also works in a state business on contract and in an office, doing state investigations and at the same time she is dedicated to selling seasonal merchandise.  Sometimes she and her sister manufacture footwear and sell it.  Other times they buy perfumes, clothes and cosmetic products to achieve sustainability for their business.  Enilda is always working to improve herself as a person, a businesswoman, a member of family and of their community.  With this loan, which is her first, she will buy clothing and cosmetics, and also wheat flour and other ingredients to make food products.  Her dream and greatest challenge is that her small daughter manage to study and to be a successful professional, with know-how of many languages so that prosperity always accompanies her.  She would also like to have a well-stocked store, where the clients are provided with whatever they seek and can find everything that they need and desire.  In the meantime she lives thanks to God, her Christian community and her  great family, that have also been great foragers of resources for the home that she shares with them.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and other items such as clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A.  is currently in the business of selling sugar, rice, and beans.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of goods to sell.  Betty is 25 years old and is married.  Her husband is a businessman.  She has 25 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more bags of goods to sell

loans.name: Miralys Beatriz

texts.es: Miralis Beatriz mejias vive en el barrio ciudad modesto de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allì se dedica a la venta de comidas corrientes y de los famosos “sancochos costeños”. Casada y con 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 23 años iniciò esta actividad, en consecuencia a que su esposo quedò desempleado y fuè su madre quien le ofreciò el dinero para que iniciara y tambien la idea emprendedora, con  la que hoy se encuentra satisfecha y en post de crecimiento. Asì empezaron en la esquina de su casa y con utensilios de cocina propios y de su madre. Hoy ha perfeccionado el arte y con este su primer crediKiva comprarà una bateria de cocina, como platos, cucharas, ollas, juegos de mesa y viveres y verduras , provisionandose para la gran època de Diciembre, que se viende con muchas ventas y ella està dispuesta a no dejar perder  ni un solo peso ($) , teniendo todo disponible para cocinar lo que su cliente quiere. Sueña con establecer su restaurante en un local comercial ubicado en su sector, mientras tanto està trabajando para poder lograr sus objetivos
texts.en:
Miralis Beatriz M. lives in a modest city neighborhood in Barranquilla city, where she works selling fresh food and her famous "sancochos costeños" (a type of stew).  She is married with 3 children aged 16 to 23 years old.  She started this activity because her husband became unemployed.  Her mother gave her the money to start, and she also had the entrepreneurial idea.  It gives her satisfaction today and is in growth mode. 

She began in the corner of her home with her own kitchen utensils and those of her mother. Today she has perfected her art and with this, her first Kiva loan, she will buy cookware such as plates, spoons, pots, table items, groceries and vegetables.  These supplies will be for the busy time in December, where she sees a lot of sales and she isn't willing to let a single peso be lost, so she will have everything available to cook whatever her customer wants. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in a commercial area in her neighborhood, in the meantime she is working to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Cookware such as plates, spoons, pots, table items, groceries and vegetables

loans.name: Anselme

texts.en: Anselme owns a salon.  He is 34 years old, single, and has one child. Anselme has been in the business of running his salon for seven years.  His loan will be used to purchase more salon equipment and hair products.  He hopes to use the new profits from his business to expand his salon and continue to grow.

loans.use: To add equipment in the salon for business purpose

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 60 years old and is a widow with eight children. Currently, eight of her children attend school.  Jennifer sells fruits such as yellow bananas and avocados.  Besides this business, she also sells charcoal and firewood.  She has been doing this business for 12 years.  Jennifer will use the loan to purchase more charcoal and firewood.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Jennifer plans to build her savings.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 50 years old.  She is a widow and has eleven children between eighteen and thirty years old. Two of her children attend school, while the others have their own homes. Riziki sells various items such as rice, potatoes, cassava flour, and wheat flour.  She has been doing this for 15 years. 

Riziki will use the loan to purchase more items for sale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Riziki plans to pay school fees for her children.  She has a dream of owning a big shop to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: Clara Luz C. es una mujer de 46 años y se dedica al negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, actividad muy bien desarrollada porque ayuda mucho a las mujeres que, como ella en algun tiempo pasado, no cuentan con esta maquina y se les hace muy pesada la tarea de lavar y a Clara Luz le genera unos importantes ingresos que le sirven para su hogar. Asì fuè como Clara Luz inspirada, por cuanto ella ofrecia el servivio de lavado y planchado a mano que era tan pesado, se diò a la tarea de faciliarla para ella y para los demas. Asì fuè como compro varias lavadoras con los que hasta hoy apoya la gestiòn de su hogar, fortalecida con el trabajo de su conyuge en beneficio de sus 5 hijos que hoy estan en las edades de 10 a 26 años , estudian y por los cuales ha estructurado su negocio, para que puedan seguir aprovechando sus  ingresos por mucho tiempo. Este es su primer credikiva y con el comprarà dos lavadora, para aumentar sus ingresos y responder mas oportunamente a sus clientes. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y se preparen para el futuro, asì como tener una vivienda propia y aumentar cada dia su infraestructura, por lo cual debe seguir esforzandose. Con su negocio Clara obtiene  un75 % de utilidades y el èxito de esta inversiòn se espera porque tiene una buena demanda del servicio, una clientela fija y unas permaente ganas de trabajar constante para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Clara Luz C. is a 46 year old woman and she  works in the business of renting out washing machines. This is a very well developed activity because it really helps women, who like her not long ago, don't have this appliance and the task of washing becomes very difficult for them. It generates important income for Clara Luz that she uses for her home. Clara Luz was inspired when she offered a laundry and pressing service by hand and it was so difficult she decided to make it easier for her and for everyone else.  Thus she bought several washing machines that to this day help her household, fortified by her spouse' work for their 5 children, aged 10 to 26 years old. They go to school and she has structured her business around them so that they can keep making the most of it the income for a long time. This is her first Kiva loan and with it she will buy two washing machines to increase her income and respond more quickly to her customers.  Her dream s for her children to go to school and prepare for the future, as well as to have her own home and increase her infrastructure ever day.  This is why she keeps on striving. With her business Clara gets 75 % profit and success is expected with this investment because she has a good demand for her service, regular customers and a permanent wish to work constantly to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: Two washing machines

loans.name: Costique

texts.en:
Costique is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Currently, one of his children attends school. Costique sells utensils, which he has been doing for 6 years. 

Costique will use this loan to purchase and add more utensils to his business. With the new profits, Costique plans to increase the volume of his stock.  He anticipates having a car in the future.

loans.use: To buy utensils for sale

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 35 years old, married, and has five children between two and fifteen years old. Currently, four of her children attend school. Claudine sells vegetables, which she has been doing for 5 years. Her husband is a motorcyclist.  Claudine requested this loan to purchase more vegetables,  especially tomatoes.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Claudine plans to build a rental house and a residential house in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 34 years old, married, and has five children between 2 and 13 years old. Presently, three of her children attend school. Esperance sells goats and sheep, which she has done for nine years. Her husband sells palm oil.  

Esperance will use the loan to purchase more goats and sheep to sell. With the new profits from her growing business, Esperance hopes to buy more houses for commercial purposes. In the future, she would like to own a truck for animal transportation, which should increase the profitability of her business.

loans.use: To buy more livestock

loans.name: Aurora Maria

texts.es: Aurora C. confeccionista D. ajuares para bebe,  es una mujer sumamente delicada en su trabajo, el cual inició en Ciénaga, Municipio del  departamento del Magdalena,  cuando por vocación fabricó vestidos para muñecas desD. muy pequeña y con el pasar del tiempo ha ido perfeccionando el arte, con estudios especialmente en lo relacionado con diseño D. modas y confección.  Aurora tiene 62 años y vive en el barrio las Palmas D. Barranquilla, es madre D. 4 hijos en las edades D. 38 a 46 años D. edad  y su desempeño en este oficio ha sido tan bueno que lo ha convertido  en su negocio, con el cual ha generado las principales fuentes D. ingreso para su hogar. DesD. el año 1998 está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha logrado un crecimiento personal y empresarial,  porque ha aprovechado todo lo que le ofrece, así ha recibido seis financiamientos, se ha capacitado y ha cambiado su visión D. negocio.Su credikiva es su septimo financiamiento, con él comprará en encajes, velo, guata, hilo, cinta y aplicaciones varias. Aurora en el año 1991 tenia 63 empleados y quiere nuevamente llevar a su negocio en ese mismo sentido, por eso diariamente se esmera por darle un enfoque muy empresarial, para cumplir este su gran sueño.   Su negocio se torna próspero, tiene clientes fijos  todo el año, sus productos circulan en el centro, una zona muy comercial en Barranquilla, posee una rotación D. cuentas por cobrar D. 26 días , mientras su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es del  53%, su endeudamiento es del 30%, tiene una capacidad D. pago del 70% y su liquidez es del 2.3%. Aurora es una mujer feliz goza del cariño D. sus hijos y nietos con quien sostiene excelentes relaciones.
texts.en: Aurora C. makes layettes for babies.  She is very dedicated to her work -work that she began in Ciénaga, a town in Magdalena Department. From the time she was very young, she used to make dresses for dolls and as she got older, she perfected the art.  She took courses that were related to fashion design and dressmaking.  Aurora is 62 and lives in Las Palmas D. Barranquilla neighborhood.  She is the mother of 4, ages 38-46, and the result of her performance in the traD. has been so good that it became a business.  It has generated the main source of income for her family.  Since 1998 she has worked with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped her grow personally and business-wise because she has taken advantage of everything they offer.  She has received 6 loans.  She has received training in the business and changed her vision of what the business is capable of doing.  The Kivacredit is her 7th loan, and she will use it to buy lace, tulle, padding, thread, tape and other items.  In 1991 Aurora had 63 workers and she would like to take her business to this level again.  That is why she strives to give it an enterpreneurial focus every day so as to fulfill her dream.  Her business is prosperous and she has regular customers all year.  Her products are sold in the center, a very commercial zone of Barranquilla.  She has day sales outstanding of 26 days, while her gross profit on the sales is 53%, her debt is 30%, she has an ability to pay up to 70%, and her liquid assets are 2.3%.  Aurora is a happy woman who enjoys the love of her children and grandchildren with whom she has excellent relations.

loans.use: To buy lace, tulle, padding, thread, tape and other items

loans.name: Gidrap

texts.en: Gidrap is 44 years old, married, and has three children. To earn a living, he runs a cafeteria. He has been in this business for ten years. He dreams of opening other cafeterias in the future. He also rents out houses for extra income. Gidrap joined Faulu Kenya in order to get loans more easily. He became a member of Baraka group, whose members guarantee each other's loans. He has requested 80,000 KES to expand the cafeteria and open a shop.

loans.use: To expand the cafeteria and open a shop

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina sells vegetables for a living. She is 35 years old and is a widow with five children. Safina has been selling vegetables for fifteen years. Her loan will be used to purchase more vegetables, such as tomatoes, to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business for her family's expenses and to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of having either a big shop or a motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth owns a business selling vegetables. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are 5 and 9 years old. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Elizabeth has been selling vegetables for four years. She plans to use her loan to buy more vegetables, specifically tomatoes, which give her a larger return on her investment. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to keep her store strong. She believes that she will have a booming business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as tomatoes

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is 40 years old.  She is a widow with three children. Currently, all three of her children attend school. Consolee sells foodstuffs and has a retail shop with a variety of items.  She has been in this business for eleven years. 

Consolee will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs such as beans, rice, and cooking oil.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Consolee plans to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Malka Irina

texts.es: Malka en Villa del Carmen tiene un negocio llamado Ferreterìa Malka, donde vende materiales para construcciòn,  bloques y calados fabricados en la misma ferreterìa, la cual iniciò 3 años atrás, en un local familiar y con lo producido por su negocio,  adquiriò el lote, construyò su vivienda y logrò ampliar el volumen de ventas, hasta generar cuatro empleos directos: dos bloqueros y dos transportadores. Malka  ademàs tiene ademàs dos carrertllas  que se encargan del domicilio, de los materiales para construcciòn que compran sus clientes. Su crediKiva es su primer financiamiento, con la fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con èl comprarà cemento, arena, para la venta y elaboracion de bloques y calados que tiene encargados. Su negocio maneja ventas promedias de $220.000 COP diarios, un margen de ganacias del 10%. Malka es una emprendedora y valiente mujer  que  vive con un hijo menor de edad (5 años) y una sobrina,  ya que es madre jefe de familia, por eso su sueño es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirla en la mejor ferreteria de su sector ,  pues quiere ayudar mucho en la superaciòn de su familia especialmente de su pequeño; aunque tiene un gran desafio pues en èpocas de lluvias se retrasan los pedidos no duda que vendran tiempos mejores  de prosperidad para su negocio y su familia.
texts.en: Malka has a business in Villa del Carmen called "Ferreteria Malka" (hardware store), she sells building materials, concrete blocks made at the store, which started three years ago as a family business selling what was produced, she bought the land, built a house and was able to increase sales volumes and create four job opportunities for two block makers and two handlers.  Malka also has 2 wheelbarrows that help transport the materials her clients buy.  This credit is her first loan with Kiva, through "fundacion Mario Santo Domingo", with it she will buy cement, sand and make blocks for pending orders.  Her business has daily average sales of $115 USD (220,000 Colombian pesos) with a gross margin of 10%.  Malka is a brave entrepreneur that lives with her five year old son and a niece, she is the head of the family and her dream is to expand the business until it becomes the best hardware store in the area, she wants to help her family get ahead, particularly her son, she has a big challenge ahead because during raining season orders get behind but she knows better times will come for her and her family.

loans.use: Buy cement and sand to make and sell concrete blocks.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
La señora Emma vive en casa de su suegra en a zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz , esta casada y el esposo es rentista jubilado.

Emma, para ayudar en la casa a la familia, vende productos Avon, Essika, Yambal donde percibe un ingreso que le ayuda para solventar algunos gastos en el hogar.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital por la época de Navidad y tener más disponibilidad de productos para sus ventas de fin de año. Para esta actividad utilizará $us 200 y los restantes $us 400 los usará para pagar la matrícula y pensión en la Universidad UNIVALLE para su hijo.

Esta es la primera vez que se aproxima a  Impro para solicitar un crédito, pero por la actividad califica para obtener uno.
texts.en:
Ms. Emma lives in her mother-in-law's house in the Alto Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz.  She is married and her husband is a retired pensioner.

In order to help her family, she sells products from Avon, Essika, and Yanbal.  She earns income that helps cover their household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase her capital going into the Christmas season and to have more products available for her year-end sales. She will use $200 USD for this purpose and will use the remaining $400 USD to pay her son's tuition, room and board at the Univalle University.

This is her first time coming to Impro to request a loan, but she qualifies to obtain one for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her beauty products business and to pay her son's university tuition

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en: Tobias is a 38-year-old member of Faulu Kenya.  He does welding for machine and motor vehicle parts.  In his business, he has employed three people.  He has been running the business for twelve years and hopes to grow it.  He has benefited from being a member of Faulu Kenya because he has been able to access loans easily.  He has requested another loan of 60,000 Kes to buy copper wire and iron sheet.

loans.use: To buy copper wire and iron sheet

loans.name: Josè Ricardo

texts.es:
Josè Ricardo M. , hace unos meses terminò su crediKiva y estaba esperando la època de Diciembre para volver a acceder a uno nuevo;  Porque con este segundo financiamiento de Kiva complementarà la compra de licores y bebidas que tiene una gran demanda de sus clientes en las fiestas familiares de Diciembre. Èl envia un mensaje a sus fondeadores que dice textualmente lo siguiente:  ”Gracias a todos por apoyarme en esta solicitud, ya que he pasado momentos muy apremiantes con los multiples pedidos, que con esta inversiòn podrè darles curso” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Josè Ricardo ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/175142
texts.en: Josè Ricardo M. paid off his previous Kiva loan a few months ago.  He has been waiting for December to arrive to request another loan since the demand for liquor and beverages during this season is much higher because of family parties and he will use the loan to supplement his purchases.  He would like to send the following message to his supporters: "Thank you to everyone for supporting me in this request as I have had multiple orders that have created some pressing moments for me and this loan will help me to process them". This is Jose Ricardo M.'s 2nd Kiva loan and 6th loan from FMSD.  If you would like to read José Ricardo's story follow this link:  http://kiva.org/lend/175142.

loans.use: To purchase liquor and beverages for his business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos de 44 años llegò a Barranquilla, procedente de Bucaramanga con sus padres y hermanos y se instalaron en un barrio popular, a la edad de 14 años empezò trabajado como auxiliar de un almacen y al terminar sus estudiso, se vinculò al negocio de su hermana y cuando quiso regresar a su natal ciudad, ya era tarde se habia enamorado de Barranquilla , y esto atrajo su interès de trabajar empleado en el sector comercial, para quedarse  asì  fue que estuvo por 5 años como dependiente y una vez ahorrò , a lo largo del 2007 comprò el negocio de comercializacion de videojuegos ,  que hasta el dia de hoy ha sostenido con mucho esfuerzo disciplina y permanencia . El negocio de Juan Maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 15% y una utilidad bruta del 24.2% y el sigue soñado con hacer de su negocio una gran empresa para genera muchos empleos y servir a la sociedad colombiana. Su crediKiva  es el primer finaciamiento y con el comprarà modernos videojuegos para surtir su negocio en la època navideña , pues  por tradiciòn Santa Claus trae regalos a los niños en las familias y justamente en esta  temporada  se da el  repunte de sus ventas y esto facilita el èxito de la inversiòn
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 44 years old, came to Barranquilla from Bucaramanga, along with his parents and siblings.  They settled into a popular neighborhood and at the age of 14, he started working as a helper in a grocery store.  After finishing his studies, he got involved with his sister's business.  By the time he wanted to return to his hometown, it was already too late because he'd fallen in love with Barranquilla.  This is what attracted him to the idea of finding employment in the commercial sector.  To get there, he worked underneath someone else for five years until, at long last, he had saved enough money and bought his own video game sales business in 2007. To this day, he has maintained his business through much effort, discipline, and steadfastness.  Juan's business makes a 15% profit on sales, with a gross profit of 24.2%.  He continues to dream of turning his business into a great company that would employ many people and serve the Colombian society.

This "crediKiva" is his first loan and he will buy new video games with it in order to stock up his store for the Christmas season.  Because the legend of Santa Claus says that he brings Christmas gifts to children, Juan Carlos' sales surge in this season, fueling the success of his investment.

loans.use: to buy new video games in order to stock his business for the Christmas season

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is 37 years old, married, and has two children.  He makes and sells handbags to earn a living.  He has been running this business for ten years and has managed to employ ten people.  Being a father of two, he works hard in his business so he can provide for his family.  He hopes to open other businesses in the future.  He needs a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy raw materials to make handbags.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make handbags

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en: Ndunge is a 37-year-old lady who sells clothes.  She started this business seventeen years ago.  She is blessed with four children who are in school.  Therefore, she works hard in her business so she can provide for her family.  Ndunge hopes to grow her business into a wholesale business in the future.  With the loan of 50,000 Kes, she will buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Isika

texts.en: Isika is a member of Faulu Kenya under Faraja Yetu group.  She joined the group so that she can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya.  She sells milk to earn a living.  To boost her income, she also sells food.  Being a single mother of two, she works hard in her business so she can provide for her family.  She dreams of expanding her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy milk.

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: Edwige est née le 17 Octobre 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à un informaticien nommé Séïdou, Edwige est mère de trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Edwige s'est installée au quartier Dandji à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Edwige a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et mène depuis cinq ans comme activité la vente de produits GSM (téléphones portables, etc.) dans sa boutique à son domicile. Edwige s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C'est la troisième fois que Edwige sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue d'agrandir son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Edwige was born on October 17, 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Seidou, a computer specialist, Edwige is the mother of three children, some of whom are in school. About a dozen years ago, Edwige settled in the Dadji district in Cotonou. The spouses jointly take care of the family needs. Edwige stopped her studies at the high school level. Since about five years ago, she has been selling  GSM mobility products (handsets etc) in a store located in her home. Edwige stocks up in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. It is the third time that Edwige is seeking a loan from ALIDe, with the goal of expanding her business and increasing her sales volume and revenues. The first two loans have been well repaid

loans.use: Purchasing mobile phones

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Guillermo; el tiene 70 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de empleado en el sector educación, el por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere terminar de construir su casa una. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower, Mr. Guillermo, belongs to the "Maquimanta Purisun" communal bank.  The bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Mr. Guillermo is 70 years old, married, and has five children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his work as an employee in the education sector.  Through this job, he was able to help his children get ahead.  Now, Mr. Guillermo would like to finish building his house.  He is requesting this loan to buy construction materials.

Mr. Guillermo is happy to receive this loan and he promises to comply with the terms of his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Guillermina Blandina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina Blandina; ella tiene 65 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carro, ella tiene una tienda donde vende repuestos de carro y atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de repuestos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  repuestos para los carros al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower, Ms. Guillermina Blandina, belongs to the "Maquimanta Purisun" communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Ms. Guillermina is 65 years old, married, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling spare auto parts.  She has a store where she sells the car parts, which she tends from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm.  She would like to expand and improve her spare parts business.  Ms. Guillermina is requesting this loan to buy spare car parts wholesale.

She is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts wholesale

loans.name: Abadia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Abadia; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería, ella hace diferentes trabajos como mesas, sillas, ventanas y puertas, ella quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  madera al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower, Ms. Abadia, is a member of the "Maquimanta Purisun" communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Ms. Abadia is 37 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her carpentry business.  She makes different pieces like tables, chairs, windows, and doors.  Abadia would like to expand her furniture-making business.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy wood wholesale.

Abadia is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en: Gerry is 25 years old and single.  He operates a studio and does printing for a fee.  He started the business two years ago and has managed to employ one person.  He was previously working in a music shop before he opened his own business.  He dreams of opening more outlets for his business in the future.  He has requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy a computer and CDs.

loans.use: To buy a computer and CDs

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Regina; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de granos secos y también ella trabaja en el área de limpieza en el restaurant turístico, los granos secos lo vende en el mercado de Viniocanchon que queda ubicado en San Jeronimo,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos como trigo, quinua y maíz.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "MAQUIMANTA PURISUN". The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco. The member's name is Regina. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling dried grains and also works cleaning a tourist restaurant. 

She sells the dried grains in the Viniocanchon market which is located in San Jeronimo. She wants to increase her business and requests a loan to buy dried grains such as wheat, quinoa and corn.

Regina is happy about getting the loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: This member requests a loan to buy dried grains such as wheat, quinoa, and corn.

loans.name: Nayrrut

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nayrrut; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos para carro, la socia atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia vende diferentes repuestos, ella quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para carros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Maquimanta Purisun"; the bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Her name is Nayrrut, she is 32 years old, has a partner and 2 children; the member alternates her daily activities with the business of selling spare parts for cars, she sells from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., and sells different kinds of spare parts, she wants to expand the business.  She requests a loan to buy spare auto parts.

She is happy about the loan and commits to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Buy spare auto parts.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Margarita; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de archivos y productos de limpieza, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en unas de las calles de de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "maquimanta purisun"; the bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

The member is Maria Margarita, she is 35, has a partner and two children; she combines her daily activities with the business of selling cleaning products in the streets of the city of Cusco, she wants to have a store where to sell the products.  The member requests a loan to buy wholesale merchandise.

The member is happy about the loan and commits to make all the credit repayments.

loans.use: Buy wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 29 years old.  He is married and is blessed with a 4-year-old child.  For ten years, he has been selling shoes.  He also does farming to supplement his family’s income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money.  He dreams of acquiring his own business premise in the future instead of renting. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he will buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Viridiana

texts.es:
La señora Viridiana O. Tello, es originaria de la localidad llamada San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, muy conocido por sus aguas termales. Doña Viri como es conocida por sus amistades tiene 23 años de edad, estudio hasta el primer año de preparatoria por que se casó y ya no pudo seguir estudiando por que se embarazo, ella se dedica a la venta de bisutería en plata y pedrería, ella lleva con este negocio mas de 2 años, ella surte sus accesorios en Zitacuaro y en Tuxpan Michoacán ya que le dan buen precio, ella empezó con este tipo de negocio ya que le gusta la decoración y le gusta armar y hacer sus propios diseños y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella vende su bisutería con las maestras de la escuela y con sus conocidas, con gente que sea segura de pagar como dice ella. 
Doña Viri quiere un préstamo para comprar los materiales necesarios para la bisutería, piedrería, plata fina, swarovskies,etc.
La Señora Viridiana esta casada con el señor Miguel el cual es Taxista, ellos tienen dos hijos de nombres Guadalupe de 4 años de edad y Andrea de 3 años las cuales estudian el jardín de niños. La meta que tiene para su negocio es tener mas clientes y mas adelante poner un negocio de bisutería fina y también invertir en zapatos por catalogo, ropa para dama y niños.
texts.en:
Viridiana O. Tello is from San Jose Purua, located in the state of Michoacan, well known for its hot springs. Viri (how friends call her) is 23, went to first year of high school, got married and was not able to continue her studies because she got pregnant, she sells silver and stone jewelry, has done this for more than two years, she buys them in Zitacuaro and Tuxpan, Michoacan, she is given good prices there.  She started this business because she likes to decorate, create and make her own designs, also because she could help her husband with the home expenses.  She sells jewelry to the school teachers and acquaintances,  and to people that she considers will pay for sure.

Viri wants a loan to buy the necessary materials for jewelry, such as stones, fine silver, swarovskies, etc.  Viridiana is married to Miguel, a taxi driver, they have two children named Guadalupe, 4 and Andrea, 3, they go to preschool.  The goal for her business is to have more clients and later on open a store and also invest in catalog sold shoes, kids and women clothing.

loans.use: Buy fine silver jewelry and stone jewelry

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 28-year-old dairy farmer.  He also sells animal manure to boost his income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money.  He is looking forward to operating a large-scale farm in the future.  He needs a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy animal feeds.  He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia  solicito 1000 $us; se dedica a la  crianza de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina, planta procesadora de leche.
Vive en la comunidad de Chojasivi, de la provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz. Está casada y sus hijos ya son mayores de edad.
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca , así aumentar su producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos. Es el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Eusebia requested a $1,000 USD loan, she has cows and sells the milk they produce to Pil Andina, a milk processing plant.

She lives in the community of Chojasivi, province of Los Andes department of La Paz.  She is married and her children are now adults.

The loan will be used to purchase a cow and this way increase milk production and this way increase income.  This is the first loan with impro and through  Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a good quality milking cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José vive en la zona de villa copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es empleado en las fuerzas armadas, y también realiza trabajos de diseño grafico
Es soltero y no tiene hijos.
El crédito será destinado para el pago de pensiones en Diseño grafico en un instituto especializado, como también en la compra de computadora y que le servirá para sus estudios y también pueda realizar trabajos independientes.
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Jose lives in the area villa copacabana in the city of La Paz. 
He is employed by the army but also does graphic design projects.
He is single and has no children.
The loan will be used to pay for tuition at a specialized institute of graphic design, as well as purchasing a computer that he will use for his studies and to make independent work projects.
This is the sixth time that he requests a loan to Impro and the second time through Kiva.  His record qualifies him as client type 1 which means good repayment of his loan.

loans.use: Make payments to the Graphic Design Institute where he studies and also to purchase a computer

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, vive en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es comerciante, vende ropa en la calle Honda de la ciudad de La Paz, y también envía mercadería a Puerto Suárez, lugar ubicado en el oriente boliviano.
Es casado y tiene un hijo, el negocio es familiar ya que su esposa le ayuda en la comercialización de su mercadería..
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de poleras, chompas, camisas y otros).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito el cliente podrá mejorar su negocio e incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Roberto lives in the Pampahasi area of the city of La Paz.
He is a merchant, sells clothing in the street of Honda in the city of La Paz, he also sends merchandise to the Suarez Port, located in Western Bolivia.
He is married and has a son, it's a family business because his wife helps him sell the merchandise.
The loan will be used for working capital (buy t-shirts, sweaters, shirts and other).
This is the first time he requests a loan with Impro, with this loan his client will be able to improve his business and have more merchandise.

loans.use: Buy clothing such as t-shirts, sweaters and shirts to sell them at his stand in La Paz and Suarez Port.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel Ángeles H. tiene 23 años y estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria y la carrera de cultura de belleza, es casada con el señor Giovanni desde hace 8 años, ellos tienen dos niños llamados Miguel de 8 años y Jasón de 6 años. Ella se dedica a vender zapatos y ropa por catalogo, también comenta que vende un poco de bisutería que ella  misma diseña, sus clientes la conocen como una mujer muy trabajadora ya que le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, y una buena vendedora ya que les da buenos precios. Doña Isabel solicito su préstamo para aumentar el negocio de los zapatos y ropa de diferentes colores y tallas para cuando le pidan ya tener en existencia en su casa y ya no mandarlos pedir, también para comprar pedrería y plata para diseñar su joyería, con sus ganancias en un futuro ella quiere tener un local estable en su casa para estar al pendiente de la educación y cuidado de sus niños.
texts.en:
Isabel Ángeles H. is 23 years old. She completed her second year of high school and studied cosmetology. She has been married to Giovanni for 8 years and they have two sons named Miguel who is eight years old and Jasón who is six. 

She sells shoes and clothing by catalog. She also sells some jewelry that she designs herself. Her clients know her as a very hard working woman because she helps her husband with the household expenses. Also because she is a good saleswoman and gives them good prices. 

Mrs. Isabel requests the loan to increase her shoe business and to buy clothing in different sizes and colors so that she will have them in stock in her home without having to order them. She also wants to buy stones and silver to design her jewelry. With her future earnings she wants to have a stable place to run her business from home so that she can attend to her children and their education.

loans.use: To invest in catalog shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
La señora Jessica vive en casa propia con su mama y sus dos hijos en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; es madre soltera, trabaja en una empresa como secretaria donde percibe sus ingresos para mantener a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar las pensiones de su hijo mayor que tiene 8 años de edad y esta en tercero básico, para poder inscribirlo al siguiente curso para el próximo año.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro, pero por el carácter social califica para obtener el mismo.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica lives with her mother and two children in a house that they own in the San Pedro neighborhood of La Paz.  Jessica is a single mother.  She works as a secretary and her income supports the family.

Jessica is applying for a loan to pay the school fees for her older child for the coming year.  He is 8 years old and will be starting third grade in the fall.

This is Jessica's first Impro loan.  The purpose of the loan serves the social objectives of our institution.

loans.use: Pay school fees.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina  es un cliente que esta desde la gestión 2006,  la cancelación de sus créditos fue buena y puntual, es una cliente con buena actitud, ella se dedica a la venta muebles  junto a su esposo, ellos fabrican los muebles en su mismo domicilio se encuentra la carpintería, la señora cristina no solo vende los muebles sino también los elabora , ella trabaja junto a su esposo en la carpintería lijando y barnizando. En la ciudad de la Paz Bolivia una de las características de la mujer es el empuje en el trabajo, las mujeres trabajan desde choferes hasta albañiles. Hace algun tiempo la señora Cristina se sintió mal y tuvieron que realizarle una operación ahora se recupera favorablemente, la pareja no tiene hijos porque la señora cristina tuvo problemas de salud y recién se esta recuperando, pero en un futuro su deseo es poder recuperarse por completo y tener hijos el crédito será invertido en la compra de herramientas, esta agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sra. Cristina has been a customer since 2006.  She has a record of repaying her loans on time and she is a popular customer of the bank.  Cristina operates a furniture business with her husband. She not only builds furniture but sells it too.  They make the furniture in a workshop at their house. She works with her husband in the shop, polishing and waxing.  One of the characteristics of women in La Paz is their dedication to finding work.  They do everything from driving cabs to construction work.  Cristina was ill a few years ago and had to have an operation.  She's mostly recovered now but the couple has been unable to have children because of her health problems.  She hopes that she will completely recover soon so that she can have children.  Cristina will use this loan to buy tools for her workshop.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: Buy tools for furniture business.

loans.name: Iveth Azucena

texts.es: La señora Ivet Azucena Pérez Orizaba es originaria de la localidad llamada San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, un lugar hermoso donde sus aguas son conocidas como termales o aguas de azufre. Doña Ivet tiene 24 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria por que se caso muy joven y tuvo que dedicarse al hogar y también su marido no la dejo estudiar ya que tenía que cuidar de su casa y de su hijo. Doña Ivet como le gusta que le digan, está pidiendo un crédito para invertir en una tienda de celulares, ya que comprara equipos de telefonía celular, accesorios para estos, tiempo aire etc. Ella tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 3 años, el local donde vende sus teléfonos es prestado por sus familiares. Comenta que compra sus teléfonos en una distribuidora autorizada en Zitacuaro Michoacán, donde comenta que le dan precios de mayoreo y así ella les puede ganar algo. A ella le gusta mucho su negocio ya que esta al pendiente de sus hijos, la señora Ivet esta casada con el señor Enrique el cual es comerciante en esta temporada el vende Flor de Noche Buena, ellos tienen dos hijos Daniela de 5 años la cual estudia el jardín de niños y José Pablo de 4 meses. La meta que tiene para su negocio la señora Ivet es seguir invirtiendo en sus celulares y poner en el mismo negocio una copiadora ya que cerca de su localidad no hay copiadoras y una papelería, comenta que con las ganancias que saque de la venta de sus celulares les comprara a sus pequeños hijos algún regalo de navidad.
texts.en: Sra. Ivet Azucena P. Orizaba lives in a town called San Jose Purua in the Mexican state of Michoacan.  It's a beautiful place known for its hot springs and sulfur baths.  Dona Ivet, 24, married very young, in her third year of high school, and has worked at caring for her house and family since then.  Her husband didn't let her study because he wanted her to take care of their son.  Dona Ivet, as she likes to be called, is applying for a loan to invest in her cellular phone shop.  She wants to buy cell phones, accessories and telephone minutes to resell.  She has operated the business for approximately 3 year in a space that she borrowed from relatives.  She says that she buys her merchandise from an authorized dealer in Zitacuaro because she pays less there and can earn more when she resells the merchandise.  She likes the business very much because it allows her to keep an eye on her children.  Sra. Ivet is married to Sr. Enrique who sells seasonal flowers.  They have two children: Daniela, 5, who is in kindergarten and a 4-month old baby named Jose Pablo.  Sra. Ivet's goal is to continue investing in her business.  She wants to buy a copier in the future because there are none nearby and sell other paper and office products.  She says that she plans to buy her young children Christmas gifts with part of the earnings from her business.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen M. Ruiz es originaria de la población de San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán,  donde es conocido por sus balnearios de aguas de azufre. Doña Carmen tiene 35 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria por que emigro a la cuidad de Mexicali Baja California Norte, donde vivió 10 años, comenta que ya no siguió estudiando porque no le llamo la atención estudiar a ella le gusto trabajar desde muy pequeña, comenta que empezó a trabajar como jornalera en Mexicali. Doña Carmen esta pidiendo su crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa interior para dama y niñas, ella sale a venderlos a las localidades cercas de su población los sábados y domingos ella tiene con su negocio tiene aproximadamente un año y medio, ella también se dedica a limpiar huertas de chayote en su región con esa actividad ya tiene mas de 10 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes para dedicarse también a la venta de la ropa interior, doña Carmen comenta que es un trabajo  muy pesado pero tiene que salir adelante ya que en estos tiempos  todo es muy caro y que le esta echando ganas para hacer su casa de tabique ya que donde vive es de madera. Doña Carmen esta casada con el señor Miguel el cual es jornalero, ellos tienen 3 hijos pero nada mas viven con ellos dos  Ismael de 14 años el no estudia ya que trabaja con su mama de jornalero y Maria Isabel de 12 años estudiante de secundaria. La meta que tiene doña Carmen es poder rentar un local y establecer su negocio de ropa interior ya que el trabajo de jornalero es muy pesado.
texts.en: Sra. Maria del Carmen M. Ruiz lives in a town called San Jose Purua in the Mexican state of Michoacan. It's a beautiful place known for its hot springs and sulfur baths. Dona Carmen, 35, left school in the sixth grade when she moved to the city of Mexicali in Baja California Norte, where she lived for 10 years.  She says that she never returned to school because she wasn't a good student and preferred working.  In Mexicali, she worked as a day laborer doing casual work.  Dona Carmen is applying for a loan to buy underwear for women and children that she will sell at local markets on weekends.  She has operated the business for about a year and a half.  She sells underwear during the week, as well, and operates a business clearing fields of prickly pear.  She says that it's a hard life, but she has to work hard to support herself because everything is so expensive.  She also wants to save to build a new house, one of brick, not wood like the one where she lives now.  Dona Carmen is married to Sr. Miguel, a day laborer, and they have 3 children, none of whom live at home.  Ismael, 14, has left school and works with her mother as a day laborer and Maria Isabel, 12, is in school.  Dona Carmen's goal is to rent a shop and establish a fixed place of business because day labor is very difficult.

loans.use: para la compra de ropa interior para dama y niños

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El sr. Alberto vive en la zona del plan 3000, es casa propia, es casado y  desde hace unos 2 años, el se dedica al transporte publico hace 20 años, en su casa tiene una venta de abarrotes la cual es atendida por su esposa, el crédito que esta solicitando es para construir un cuarto ya que el que tienen es de madera y  solicito el crédito para la compra de material de construcción. El sr. Alberto es cliente antiguo de la institución y ha demostrado buen comportamiento de pago. El es muy trabajador y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sr. Alberto and his wife live in a house they own in the Plan 3000 neighborhood.  He has operated a taxi business for 20 years.  His wife manages a corner shop that they have set up in a room at their house.  Alberto is applying for a loan to add a room to the house.  He needs the loan to buy lumber and other construction materials.  Alberto is a long-standing customer of the bank and he has a good record of repaying his loans.  He works hard and has his wife's support. He is grateful to the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: Buy construction materials for improvements to house.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: La señora Guillermina C., tiene 42 años de edad y es originaria de la localidad de San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, un lugar donde es muy conocido por sus aguas de azufre y por sus balnearios de aguas termales. Doña Guille,como la conocen en su comunidad, estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria por que sus padres no tenían el dinero suficiente para apoyarla con los gastos de la escuela, aunque dice que su hija la que estudia la secundaria le esta enseñando a leer y a escribir y que muy pronto ella quiere seguir estudiando para obtener el certificado de primaria ya que poco a poco se quiere superar. La señora Guille esta pidiendo un crédito para invertir en un puesto que tiene de ropa interior, chanclas de baño, calcetines, aretes, diademas, y accesorios y pinturas para dama, anteriormente ella vendía frutas y verduras pero que ese tipo de negocio no le gusto porque a veces no vendía toda la fruta y se le echaba a perder y tenia perdidas con ese tipo de negocio y por eso ahora vende productos que le dejan mas ganancias y no tiene perdidas, ella surte en México y otra parte compra en Zitacuaro Michoacán. Ella tiene con este tipo de negocio hace 2 años, y saca a vender sus artículos en el tianguis de su localidad y en las localidades cercas de su poblado, también dice que trabaja en una casa como trabajadora domestica ya que ella tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos y nietos. La señora Guillermina es madre soltera y tubo 9 hijos pero 4 viven con ella Gerardo de 18 años de edad el nada mas estudio hasta 6 de primaria ya que se quedo sin vista y ya no pudo seguir adelante, Yuriccia de 16 años, Edwin de 14 años ellos dos estudiantes de secundaria, Alfonso de 12 años estudiante de primaria y también viven con ella 3 nietos ya que hace tres meses el padre de los niños falleció debido a un tumor cerebral, y la mamá de ellos tubo que emigrar a los Estados Unidos para trabajar y mandarles dinero para sus gastos. Doña Guillermina tiene una meta con su negocio que es comprar un puesto de fierro ya que sus artículos los pone en el suelo. Ella esta muy contenta por que gracias al préstamo esta creciendo poco a poco su negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermina C. is 42 years old and originally from the town of San José Purua, located in the state of Michoacán, which is known for its sulfur waters and hot springs.  Guille, as she is known in her community, studied until her third year of primary school because her parents didn't have enough money to pay her school costs.  She says that her daughter, who is in high school, is teaching her to read and write so that she can study for a primary school certificate and improve herself.  

Guille is asking for this loan to invest in her business that sells underwear, bathroom slippers, socks, earrings, hair bands, and women's accessories and makeup.  She used to sell fruits and vegetables but she didn't like that type of business because if all of the fruit is not sold, it will go bad and she would lose money.  For that reason, now she sells products that earn more money and don't go bad.  She buys some of her merchandise in México and other parts in Zitacuaro Michoacán.  She has had this business for two years, and she sells products at the flea market in her area and in the towns close to her.  She also works as a maid because she has to help her children and grandchildren get ahead.

Guillermina is a single mother with nine children, but only four live with her.  Gerardo is 18 years old and stopped going to school after 6th grade, so he doesn't have a plan for the future and can't improve himself.  Yuriccia, 16, and Edwin, 14, are high school students.  Alfonso is 12 and is in primary school.  She also cares for three of her grandchildren.  Three months ago, their father died from a brain tumor and their mother had to emigrate to the United States to work.  She sends money for their expenses.  

Guillermina's goal for her business is to purchase a fixed location since she currently lays out her articles on the floor.  She is very happy because thanks to her loan, her business is slowly growing.

loans.use: Purchase women's, men's and children's underwear, socks and accessories

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: La señora Georgina T. Cruz, es originaria de la localidad llamada San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, un lugar hermoso donde sus aguas son conocidas como termales o aguas de azufre. Doña Georgina tiene 33 años de edad, terminó la secundaria y ya no siguió estudiando por que sus padres no tenían el dinero suficiente para apoyarla con los gastos de la escuela, también dice que en su localidad en ese entonces no había preparatoria y que tenían que trasladarse a otra comunidad para estudiar y salían muy caros los pasajes. La señora Georgina esta pidiendo un crédito para invertir en una tienda que tiene dentro de la telésecundaria de su localidad, ella tiene con ese negocio 6 meses con lo que le prestarán ella comprara dulces, ingredientes para comida como masa, carne de pollo, carne de res, lechuga, jitomate, y muchos ingredientes mas, también comprara jugos, refrescos, galletas, etc. Ella esta casada con el señor Mauro el trabaja en la central de abastos en la ciudad de México como cargador, ellos tienen dos hijos de nombres Adriana de 11 años de edad estudiante de primaria y Luís Ángel de 5 años de edad el cual estudia el jardín de niños. Comenta que la meta que tiene es tener otro negocio de venta de colchas, sabanas por catálogo y tener un negocio estable en su casa.
texts.en:
Georgina T. Cruz is from a place called San José Purua, which is located in the state of Michoacán.  It's a beautiful place known for its hot springs and sulfur baths.  Georgina is 33 years old, and she has a middle school education.  She did not continue with her education because her parents did not have enough money to support her with the school expenses.  Also, in those days there was no high school in her area.  You had to travel to another community to attend a high school, and the trips were very expensive.

Georgina is requesting a loan to invest in a store that she has in the distance learning by television site in her area.  She has had the business for six months.  She will use the loan to buy sweets and ingredients to prepare food.  She will buy ingredients like dough, chicken, beef, lettuce, tomatoes, and many more.  She will also buy juice, soft drinks, and cookies, etc.

She is married to Mauro, who works as a loader in the supply center in the city of Mexico.  They have two children.  Adriana is 11 years old, and she is in elementary school.  Luís Ángel is five years old, and he attends kindergarten.  Her goals are to have another business selling bedspreads and sheets by catalog and to have a stable business in her house.

loans.use: To invest in food and drinks for an educational cooperative

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen C. Albino, es originaria de la localidad llamada San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, conocido por las aguas termales. Doña Carmen como es conocida en su localidad tiene 67 años de edad, comenta que sus papás nada mas le dieron estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria ya que antes los papás decían: “las mujeres no les sirve el estudio ya que es una perdida de tiempo, las mujeres tienen que aprender las labores del hogar ya que todas se casan y no trabajaban, tienen que estar al pendiente del esposo y de los hijos” es por eso que a ella ya no le dieron estudio. Dice que esta pidiendo un crédito para invertir en una tienda de abarrotes que tiene en su casa, ella tiene con su tienda mas de 15 años y que se dedicó a esta actividad para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que tenían muchos hijos, ella comprará pasta dental, papel higiénico, crema, shampoo, jabón, azúcar, huevo, leche, chiles enlatados, sopas instantáneas etc. Doña Carmen es viuda ella tubo 12 hijos ya todos casados, comenta que nada mas una de sus hijas vive con ella y es la que le ayuda económicamente y con el aseo de su casa. La meta que tiene para su negocio de abarrotes es remodelar el local donde vende ya que es muy pequeño y ya no le caben las cosas, también quiere vender verdura fresca ya que sus vecinas a veces le piden.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen C. Albino is from a place called San José Purua, which is located in the state of Michoacán.  It's a beautiful place known for its hot springs and sulfur baths.  Carmen, as she is known is her area, is 67 years old.  

She says that her parents only gave her a third grade education.  At that time parents said, “An education is not for women, it is a waste of time.  Women have to learn how to do housework.  They all marry and do not work.  They have to look after their husbands and their children.”  That is why her parents did not give her an education. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in the grocery store that she has in her house.  She has had the store for over 15 years.  She devoted herself to this business activity in order to help her husband with the household expenses because they had a lot of children.

She will buy toothpaste, toilet paper, cream, shampoo, soap, sugar, eggs, milk, canned hot peppers, and instant soup, etc.

Carmen is a widow, and she had 12 children.  They are all married, and only one of her daughters lives with her.  She helps her financially and with the housecleaning.  

Carmen’s goal is for her grocery business.  She wants to remodel the place where she sells because is it very small, and there is not enough room for everything.  Also, she wants to sell fresh vegetables because her neighbors sometimes ask for them.

loans.use: Invest in her grocery store

loans.name: H. Julienne

texts.fr: H. Julienne est mariée à un électricien et est mère d'un enfant, scolarisé. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en dehors de leur enfant. Il y a cinq ans que la famille s'est installée à Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Julienne n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs quatre ans, afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Julienne mène comme activité la vente de boissons (alcoolisées et non alcoolisées) à Sèkandji. Parallèlement à cette activité, Julienne fait de la restauration (vente du riz). Julienne se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Julienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant obtenu trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Afin d'élever le niveau de son activité en cette période de fête de fin d'année et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Julienne sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: H.Julienne is married to an electrician and has one child, who goes to school. In addition to their own child, they also have another child in their care. Five years ago, the family settled in Agblangadnadan, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. The spouses jointly take care of various family needs. Julienne never attended school. About four years ago, in order to support herself, Julienne has been selling beverages (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic in Sèkandji. In addition, Julienne cooks food for sale (rice). Julienne stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. Julienne is an old-time client of ALIDé, having had three prior loans, all duly repaid. In order to expand her business in this holiday season at the end of the year and to better meet her clients’ needs, Julienne is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing beverages (canned and bottled) and rice

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia Pérez Orizaba es nueva cliente de FRAC, éste es el primer préstamo que pide, dice que a ella la invito una sobrina, que le pareció muy interesante la forma en que trabaja la Fundación, además que son muy bajo los intereses y eso le agrado más. 
Doña Ofelia es originaria de la población de San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán,  donde es conocido por sus balnearios de aguas de azufre. Doña Ofelia tiene 55 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria porque sus papas no tenían recursos para mandarla a estudiar ya que eran 15 hermanos y a veces no tenían dinero para comer, comenta que desde muy pequeña salio a trabajar como trabajadora domestica en Tuxpan Michoacán. La señora Ofe como es conocida en su localidad esta requiriendo de un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de bisutería fina y joyería de plata ya que a ella le llama la atención hacer diseños, ella surtirá su joyería en Taxco Guerrero, lugar donde la plata es muy barata y de buena calidad. Doña Ofelia es madre soltera ella tuvo 3 hijos ya todos casados, la meta que tiene para su negocio de bisutería es tener muchos clientes y rentar un local para la venta de su joyería.
texts.en:
Ofelia Pérez Orizaba is a new FRAC client.  This is the first loan she has requested.  She says that a niece invited her, and the way that the Fundación works seemed very interesting to her.  Also, the interest is very low, and this pleases her even more.

Ofelia is from a place called San José Purua, which is located in the state of Michoacán. It's a beautiful place known for its hot springs and sulfur baths.  Ofelia is 55 years old, and she has a third grade education.  Her parents did not have the resources to send her for more schooling because there were 15 brothers and sisters.  Sometimes they did not have money for food.  

Ever since she was very small she went to work as a domestic worker in Tuxpan Michoacán.  Ofe, as she is known in the area, needs a loan to start a fine jewelry and silver jewelry business.  Creating designs is what interests her the most.  She will stock her jewelry business in Taxco Guerrero, a place where silver is of good quality and cheaper.

Ofelia is a single mother.  She had three children, and they are all married now.

The goal that she has for her jewelry business is to have a lot of customers and to rent a place to sell her jewelry.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El señor Víctor Hugo C. Michel, comenta que su cuñada fue quien lo invito a formar parte de FRAC, el dice “me siento muy contento y muy dichoso de pertenecer a FRAC todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras y también me ciento bendito entre tanta mujer" (riendo).
