Él es originario de la localidad de San José Purua estado de Michoacán,  el tiene 35 años de edad estudio hasta la preparatoria, comenta que ya no siguió estudiando porque no le gusto la escuela y decidió mejor ayudarle con el negocio a sus padres. Don Hugo como es conocido en su localidad decidió pedir su préstamo para invertir en su tienda de abarrotes el surtirá huevo, aceite, jabón, papel higiénico y otros productos de primera necesidad, el tiene con el negocio aproximadamente 15 años, comenta que primero era de sus papas y después le pasaron el negocio a el. Don Hugo dice que se surte en tiendas de Zitacuaro Michoacán, ya que es cliente de estas y le dan buen precio. El señor Hugo esta casado con la señora Isabel la cual le ayuda a atender la tienda de abarrotes, ellos tiene 3 hijos Hugo de 9 años y Julián de 6 años de edad ambos estudiantes de primaria y el menor de nombre Kevin de 4 años de edad el cual estudia el jardín de niños, la meta que tiene don Hugo para su negocio de abarrotes es hacer mas grande el local además de remodelarlo ya que esta en obra negra y surtir productos que no vende como lácteos y carnes frías.
texts.en: Mr. Víctor Hugo C. Michel relates that his sister in law was the one who invited him to be a part of FRAC. He says "I feel very happy and lucky to belong to  FRAC. All of the women are very hardworking and enterprising, I also feel blessed to be among so many women [laughing]."  He is from the community of San José Purua, state of Michoacán. He is 35 years old and went to high school. He remarks that he didn't continue his studies because he didn't like school and he decided it would be better to help his parents in business.  Don Hugo, as he is known in the area, decided to ask for a loan to invest in his grocery store. He will procure eggs, oil, soap, toilet paper and other basic necessity products. He has had his business for approximately 15 years. He remarks that it belonged to his parents first and later they passed the business on to him. Don Hugo says that he gets his supplies in the stores of Zitacuaro Michoacán, since he is their customer and they give him a good price. Hugo is married to Isabel, who helps him run the grocery store. They have 3 children: Hugo, 9, Julian, 6, both in elementary school, and the youngest, Kevin, 4. He is in nursery school. Hugo's goal for his grocery store is to make the locale bigger and remodel it, since construction has just begun. He would also like to offer products that he doesn't sell, like dairy and refrigerated meats.

loans.use: He will invest in a grocery store.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr: Moises; el tiene 34 años. el socio es conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos  el socio  es albañil y trabaja en construcción civil el socio compro una mezcladora para que le facilite su trabajo cuando él es independiente y pueda mezclar el cemento con la arena y así poder terminar poniendo mayólicas, el socio hace todo tipo de vaciados, el socio también alquila su máquina para poder tener un ingreso más. El socio desea el préstamo para comprar herramientas y accesorios para baños y de este modo tener a la mano cuando le soliciten sus servicios. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas y accesorios para baños.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Moises is a member of the community bank Qorichuspa, located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.

Moises is 34 years old, married, and has four children.  He is a builder and works on civil construction.  He bought a mixer to facilitate his work when he works alone.  He can mix cement with sand and finish by installing tiles.  He does all types of casts.  He also rents the machine to have more income.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase tools and bathroom accessories so he can have them on hand when people hire him.  He is happy with the loan provided and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase tools and accessories to build bathrooms

loans.name: Huberte

texts.fr: Huberte est née en 1982 et est mariée à un chauffeur. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Il y a cinq ans que Huberte s'est installée au quartier Irédé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec sa famille. Huberte assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Huberte n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Huberte vend depuis cinq ans environs de la friperie à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est aussi dans le même marché que Huberte achète ses produits. Huberte est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu antérieurement trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son profit, Huberte sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Huberte was born in 1982. She is married to a driver. They have two children, one of whom goes to school. Five years ago Huberte and her family settled in the Irédé district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Huberte and her husband jointly provide for the family needs. Huberte did not go to school. To support herself and her family, Hubert has been selling used clothing in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin, for about five years. She also purchases her wares at that market. Huberte is an old-time client of ALIDé and obtained three prior loans, all well repaid. With the goal of expanding her business and increasing her sales volume and profits, Huberte is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing second-hand clothing

loans.name: Arnold Renzo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr: Arnold; el tiene 27 años. el socio es casado tiene 1 hijo  el socio  el socio es guía de turismo y a su vez el tiene un pequeño locutorio en alquiler y su esposa trabaja con el, ellos dan el servicio de llamadas telefónicas  nacionales y al extranjero, también cuentan con internet y tiene sus módulos, el socio cuando no tiene pasajeros, está a cargo de su locutorio situado en la calle Garcilaso, el socio es una persona muy trabajadora y desea tener su agencia de viajes y turismo en un corto tiempo, el socio desea comprar accesorios parea las máquinas y también invertir en su locutorio. El socio comprara accesorios para las máquinas y algunas pequeñas cosas que siempre faltan para su locutorio.

  El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “QORICHUSPA”. This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cuzco.  

The member is Arnold. He is 27 years old. He is married and has one son. He is a tour guide and he also rents a small studio. His wife works with him. They offer a service for making domestic and international phone calls. They also have internet and have modules. When he doesn't have any passengers, he runs his studio located on Garcilaso street. Arnold is a hardworking person and he wants to have a travel and tourism agency after a short time. He wants to buy accessories for his equipment and also invest in his studio.  He will by accessories for his equipment and also some small items that his studio always needs.  

Arnold is happy with the loan he has been given and committed to making his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member will buy accessories for his equipment and some small items that his studio needs.

loans.name: Johana Rosalia

texts.es:
Johana de 29 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas) en donde empezó a vender en las escuelas papelería (En Ecuador se los llama “bazar”) y varios accesorio a los niños. 

Con los ingresos que fue obteniendo pudo comenzar con una vitrina y varios accesorios. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ahora tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa vende bebidas, papelería, cuadernos. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, bebidas y vitrinas para su papelería y así darles un mejor futuro a sus cuatro hijos y su esposo que es operador de maquinas.   

Uno de sus objetivos es tener su negocio bien establecido y darles un futuro a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Johana is 29 years old and lives in the Fort of Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads and hills).  She started selling paper and other accessories to children in schools (in Ecuador they are called "bazaars").  

With the income she earned, she bought a display case and merchandise.  With effort and dedication, she now has a stationary store in the front part of her house where she sells drinks, stationary, and notebooks.  She works from 7:30am until 8:00pm every day.  

With this loan, she would like to purchase notebooks, drinks, and display cases for her stationary store.  She will be able to give a better future to her four children and her husband, who operates machinery.

One of her goals is to have a well established business and give her children a better future so they can be successful professionals.

loans.use: Purchase beverages, stationary and display cases for her stationary store

loans.name: Jerobia

texts.es:
Jerobia es una pequeña comerciante,  se dedica a la venta de ropa y costura, venta que realiza en la zona de puerto cabeza, en donde las ventas son buenas, muy esforzada para lograr el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y esposo siendo electricista.
Atreves de los financiamiento ha venido logrando hacer su casa, con el crédito anterior comenzó la construcción del muro, el cual seguirá con este  nuevo préstamo ya que le falta la mitad de la construcción. Comprara materiales como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y seguir la obra.
texts.en: Jerobia is a small businesswoman who sells clothes and sews.  She makes her sales in the Puerto Cabeza area where sales are good.  Jerobia is working hard so that she can improve her home.  She has the support of her family and her husband is an electrician.  Through loans, she has been managing to build her home.  She used her last loan to begin building the walls.  She will continue this work with this new loan since the job is only half done.  She will buy materials such as stone, sand, cement and iron to continue the job.

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish building her walls.  The job is half done and her goal is to finish it.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie owns a business selling local drinks like local juice from yellow bananas and sorghum produced from sorghum. She is 52 years old, married, and has twelve children between the ages of seven and thirty-three. Her husband is a businessman. Epiphanie has been selling soft drinks for 33 years.  Her loan will be used to buy more sorghum. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to pay school fees for her children.In the picture those are sorghum sacks which she uses to produce local soft drinks. And those jerrycans is where she uses to pour her drinks.

loans.use: To buy sorghum to produce local drinks to sell

loans.name: Tujijuke Group

texts.en: Olive is 30 years old, married, and has one child aged two. Her husband works as a charcoal seller. Olive is the group leader of a borrowing group known as Tujijuke in Kinyarwanda, which means “Be literate” in English. This group is composed of sixteen members who have different businesses. Olive sells sodas and local beer and has been doing this business for three years. Olive will use the loan to purchase beans, sorghum and drinks.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Olive plans to buy goats for raising and to buy cattle in the future.

loans.use: To buy beans, sorghum and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth D. sells different kinds of soft drinks at Takoradi market. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an electrician. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to restock her fridge for resale. She hopes to reinvest her additional income back into her business.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: El señor Luis Manuel tiene 48 años, El señor Luis es dueño de un negocio de brindar el servicio de taller de soldadura mecánica. Don Luis dio inicio a su negocio hace 24 años, el dio inicio debido a que el tenia problemas pero un amigo lo ayudo para que aprendiera este negocio y así pudiera establecer un negocio y mantenerse ocupado. Por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de un soldador y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes que siempre le solicitan una buena calidad en sus trabajos. El  sueño de Luis es mantenerse en el mercado, debido a que la competencia es bastante grande, además que desea invertir más para de esta manera y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Luis Manuel is 48 years old. He owns a workshop business which offers mechanical welding services. Luis started his business 24 years ago, when he was having problems but a friend helped him learn this trade so that he could set up a business and keep himself in work. He is a very responsible man and enjoys his work. The loan will be invested in the purchase of welding equipment, enabling him to offer a better service to his customers, who always demand work of high quality. Luis's dream is to be able to stay afloat in the market, given that competition is quite fierce. He would also like to invest more in this way and to increase his profits.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame A. is married and has four children. Her husband is a steel bender.  Maame operates a grocery store at Takoradi market, which she has been doing for two years. Maame uses the income she makes from her sales to assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She requests  the loan to purchase more groceries to fill her shop for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to open another shop in a different locality.

loans.use: To buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Herberte S.

texts.fr: Herberte S. est née le 02 Septembre 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Herberte est mariée à un couturier du nom de Félix et est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Herberte n'est pas allée à l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Herberte vend depuis cinq ans environs, des ustensiles de cuisine (glacières, bols en séries, etc.) de façon ambulante et aussi à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Herberte fait de la restauration. Herberte s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la quatrième fois que Herberte sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue d'augmenter son stock de produits pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Herberte S. was born September 2, 1979 in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Herberte is married to a dressmaker named Felix, and she is the mother of two children, one of which attends school. The couple provide together for their family’s needs. 

Herberte never went to school. To support herself and her family, she started selling kitchen equipment (coolers, bowl sets, etc.) door to door and from her home bout five years ago. As a sideline, Herberte also works in the restaurant business. She gets her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

This is Herberte’s fourth time seeking a loan from ALIDé to increase her stock of merchandise and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen equipment

loans.name: Nueva Estrella (New Star) Group

texts.es: Doña Ana Lucía, D. veinte años D. edad es una señora recién casada, doña Ana apoya económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos,  ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa que ella  ha podido  mantener, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. cuatro años, ella venD. en varios municipios y en los días D. plaza del pueblo para mejorar sus venta y tener más clientes, doña Ana se dio cuenta que necesitaba surtir mas su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas, D. esa manera ella pueD. obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desD. hace mas D. cinco años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su comunidad, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, elaboración D. mochilas,  venta D. mercería, entre otros.
texts.en: Ana Lucía is a twenty year old woman and recently married. She sells clothes in order to support her family and proviD. a better future for her children. She has been running this business for over four years, and sells in various districts and on town market days to increase her sales and attract more customers. Ana realised she needed to stock her business in order to sell more and increase her profits. So she gathered together a few friends and neighbours she had known for more than five years, and formed a group. Because she tries to support not only her family but also other people in her community, each woman has a different traD., including selling fruit, rearing livestock, making rucksacks, selling haberdashery items, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nilo Marcio

texts.es: Nilo tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y ha demostrado ser un hombre muy trabajador. Su actividad económica es la venta de hot- dog, hamburguesas, refrescos naturales, además de tener este negocio también se dedica a brindar el servicio de recargas telefónicas. El se hace cargo de la buena administración de su negocio por lo que sabe muy bien cómo utilizar sus recursos.  Inicia este porque no tenía un medio ingreso para sufragar en su hogar. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de recargas, jugos gaseosas, bolsitas y refrescos naturales.
texts.en: Nilo has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and has shown he is a very hardworking man. His earns his living by selling hotdogs, hamburgers and natural juice drinks. In addition to this business, he also offers a phone credit top-up service. He is responsible for the correct administration of his business and is therefore well aware of how to use his resources. He started the business because he didn't have any means of earning income to cover his household costs. The loan he is requesting is to buy phone credit, fizzy drinks, small bags and natural juice drinks.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en: Theresah D. is a baker living in Takoradi. She is married and together with the husband they take care of five dependents. Her husband is a fisherman.  Theresah uses her income to assist her husband to educate, feed and clothe their children.  She will use the loan to buy more ingredients to be able to bake in larger quantity for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresah plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to bake large quantities for sale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy E. sells earrings, children's wear and cosmetics in Takoradi. She makes her sales in the Takoradi community. She is not yet married and hopes to get married soon. She takes care of herself with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy additional goods to expand her business. She plans to build a shop from her additional income as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to expand business

loans.name: Nueva Organización Group

texts.es:
Rafaelita  Sánchez García, vive en la localidad de San Vicente, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera con  dos hijos a su responsabilidad y son: Ángel de Jesús de diecisiete  años y el otro es Carlos Fabián de catorce se años de edad.
Rafaela se dedica a elaborar panes y solicitó el préstamo para apoyarse comprando ingredientes que más le hacen falta para realizarlo, con esta actividad lleva veintiséis años, el cual está contenta porque con ello a sacado adelante a sus dos hijos que son lo mas importante para ella.
Se inspiró en esta actividad ya que su mamá le enseñó y desde el momento que inició lo ha estado practicando ya que le parece que es un trabajo bonito de donde se obtiene buenos ingresos y con estos ingresos ella apoya a sus hijos que están estudiando.
Con lo que va obteniendo de su trabajo compra mas ingredientes para realizar su actividad que tanto le gusta y de los mosmo ingresos ella pagará puntualmente sus pagos con Fundación Realidad.
Su más grande sueño es que con el tiempo logre agrandar su panadería, pues no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie más que la bendición de dios y su trabajo para salir adelante.
Ella formó el grupo pero descanso un ciclo y hoy de nuevo esta en el programa, el grupo se llama "Nueva Organización" ya que es un grupo nuevo en donde se integraron nuevas personas que también ya han estado en el programa.
      Las personas que integran el grupo son:
*Corazón de Jesús Sánchez García: invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, como tambien la compra y venta de pimienta.
*Rafaelita Sánchez García: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar panes.
*Cirila Sánchez M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de productos agrícolas.
*Vivian Ibis S. G.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de ropas que compra en  la mesilla.
*María del Carmen Reyes López: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes.
*Sarita M. López: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pimienta para luego venderlo seco.
texts.en:
Rafaelita Sánchez Garcíá lives in the San Vicente area of the Copainala district, in the Mexican state of Chiapas. She is a single mother with two dependent children: 17-year old Ángel de Jesús and 14-year old Carlos Fabián.
Rafaela earns her living by baking bread and is requesting the loan to help buy the essential ingredients for this activity. She has been making bread for 26 years, and it makes her happy because it has allowed her to provide for her two children, who are the most important thing in the world to her.
She was inspired to take up this trade when her mother taught her it, and she has been doing it ever since. She enjoys the work and says it provides a good income that enables her to support her children, who are in school.
The profits she makes from her work allow her to buy more ingredients, enabling her to do the work she enjoys so much. With that income she will also make punctual repayments to the Fundación Realidad.
Her biggest dream is to expand her bakery over time, since she has nobody to support her except God's blessing and her own hard work to move her forward.
She formed the group but had a break for one cycle and is now back in the programme. The group is called "Nueva Organización" (New Organisation), as it is a new group made up of new people who have also been in the programme.
      The group's members are:
*Corazón de Jesús Sánchez García: is investing the loan in buying goods to stock his grocery shop, and also in the purchase and sale of pepper.
*Rafaelita Sánchez García: will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients for baking bread.
*Cirila Sánchez M.: is investing the loan in the purchase and sale of agricultural products.
*Vivian Ibis S. G.: is investing the loan in the purchase and sale of clothes, which she will buy in La Mesilla.
*María del Carmen Reyes López: will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients for baking bread.
*Sarita M. López: is investing the loan in the purchase of pepper to dry and sell.

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Agossi Donatienne

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Dangbo dans le département de l'Ouémé, Agossi Donatienne est mariée à Grégoire, un revendeur. Agossi Donatienne a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a un an que Agossi Donatienne s'est installée seule au quartier Tchanhounkpamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Agossi Donatienne n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu'elle mène depuis six ans. A côté de cette activité, Agossi Donatienne vend des produits de beauté dans son atelier à Tanto. Agossi Donatienne  s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Agossi Donatienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant obtenu quatre prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle surtout en période de fête de fin d'année, Agossi Donatienne sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Donatienne Agossi was born in 1980 in Ouémé Department, and is married to Grégoire, a retail merchant.  She has three children, some of whom are in school.  A year ago, she began living on her own in the Tchanhounkpamè neighborhood of Cotonou, Bénin's economic capital.  She did not go to school, but learned hairdressing, which she has worked at for six years.  Besides that, she sells beauty products in her shop in Tanto.  She buys the products in Nigeria, the country next to Bénin.  She has had four previous loans from ALIDé, all repaid in full and on time.  To grow her business and better meet her clients' needs during the holidays, she is asking for another loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy beauty products.

loans.name: Mayra Selsa

texts.es: Mayra tiene 42 años, tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de ferretería. Ella es una persona muy luchadora por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida. Tiene 1 hijo de 16 años a su cargo, ella se preocupa por proporcionarle lo más necesario a su hijo la mayoría de sus clientes saben que Mayra proporciona un buen servicio y se siente muy contenta con su negocio. el crédito que solicita es para la compra de clavos, candados, llaves, tubos, cables entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Mayra is 42 years old and has been running a hardware store for over six years. She is is a very determined person and feels very content with this way of life. She has a 16-year old child who she looks after, and takes care of giving him everything he needs. Most of her customers know that Mayra offers a good service and she feels very happy with how her business is going. The loan she is requesting is to buy nails, padlocks, keys, pipes, cables and other items.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells cosmetics in Takoradi by moving from one area to another. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Mary has been selling cosmetics for three years. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Las señora Inés Romana  L. G., vive en Coapilla Estado de Chipas México, es casada con el señor David  Sánchez Cruz, en donde tiene a su responsabilidad a tres hijos y el cuarto que esta por nacer y son: Laura Evangelina de nueve años, la otra es Claudia de ocho años y David de seis años.
Ella ha estado solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de ingredientes para elaborar tamales ya que hay cosas que le hace faltan y por falta de ingresos no lo puede comprar, pero hoy gracias al préstamo lo ha estado logrando.
Inés comenzó con esta actividad ya que su mamá la enseño y desde hace seis años lo viene practicando y le va bien ya que con ellos apoya a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar.
Con las ganancias  que va obteniendo  compra más ingredientes para su actividad, así elaborarlo más días a la semana y vaya obteniendo mejor resulta con su negocio.
Su sueño es tener una casita más grande en donde pueda vivir con su familia cómodamente, así también tener siempre su actividad que es con la que se apoya para salir adelante.
En el grupo se unió ya que la señora Soraida la invitó a que solicitaran un préstamo del cual pudieran pagar y salir adelante. El grupo se llama el "Amanecer" la razón del nombre es porque la firma de contrato se planéo en la mañana.
Lo integrantes del grupo  son las siguientes:
*Brígida Pérez Estrada: invierte el préstamo en la crianza de pollos de rancho para venderlo en pie.
*Candelaria V. H.: invierte el préstamo en  la compra de productos agrícolas como el maíz.
*Inés Romana L. G.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar tamales.
*Soraida Pérez Pérez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de productos naturales, como también veladoras de colores.
texts.en:
Inés Romana L. G. lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas México.  She is married to David Sánchez Cruz.  They have three children (Laura Evangelina, 9, Claudia, 8, and David, 6) and a fourth about to be born. 

She has asked for this loan to purchase ingredients to make tamales since there are things she is missing and a lack of income prevents her from buying them.  Today, thanks to the loan, she is succeeding.

Inés learned how to make tamales from her mother.  Six years ago, she began her business and it is going well since her income helps her husband with the household expenses.  With her earnings, she buys more ingredients to make tamales so she can make them more days a week, and improve her business.  Her dream is to have a bigger house where her family can live comfortably and to always have her business which gives her support to succeed. 

This group was started when Soraida invited them to apply for a loan that they could pay and succeed.  The group is called "Amanecer" [Dawn], because they signed the contract in the morning.  

The members of the group are:

Brígida Pérez Estrada who will invest the loan in raising chickens to sell; Candelaria V. H., who will purchase agricultural products, like corn; Inés Romana L. G. who will purchase ingredients to make tamales; and Soraida Pérez Pérez who will purchase natural products and colored candles.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make tamales, like meat, raisins, and corn flour

loans.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gioconda  es una mujer de recursos económicos pobre, pues ha tenido que trabajar mucho para poder apoyar  a su familia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que labora como mensajero.
Hoy en día su negocio es la venta de enchiladas y buñuelo que lo hace de forma ambulante cada día, teniendo un años en las ventas, ya que anteriormente tenía un trabajo fijo.
Con este nuevo crédito cambiara su techo, en donde comprara láminas de zinc, golosos, perlines. Lo que para ella es de gran satisfacción poder  hacer las mejoras a su casa  con el crédito anterior mejoro un cuarto, y que espera seguir mejorando para una vivienda digna atreves de los financiamientos de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Gioconda is a woman of few economic means.  She has had to work hard to support her family.  She has the support of her husband who works as courier.

Gioconda's business is selling enchiladas and 'buñuelos' (fritters).  She does this every day as an itinerant street vendor.  She has been selling for a few years.  Before she took up selling, she used to have a permanent job.

Gioconda will use this new loan to replace her roof.  She will buy sheets of corrugated metal, roofing beams and bolts.  It is very satisfying for Gioconda to be able to make improvements to her home.  She used her last loan to improve a room and she hopes to continue making improvements, through loans from Afodenic, so that she can have a decent home.

loans.use: To replace her roof.  For this work she will buy sheets of corrugated metal, roofing beams and bolts

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah L. sells cosmetics and shoes in Takoradi. She is married and her husband is a car conductor. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more shoes and cosmetics to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes and cosmeticsfor resale

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: El Señor José de 53 años de edad, estado civil casado, su esposa trabaja como domestica para ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Ya sus hijos son independientes trabajan por su cuenta y le ayudan a sus padres. Como planes principales es seguir apoyando a sus hijos que se sigan preparando profesionalmente. Tiene su propio negocio es un parque mecánicas. El negocio tiene trayectoria en el mercado iniciándolo hace 26 años, manteniéndolo y con proyectos de crecer.  En el tiempo que ha tenido su negocio se ha encontrado con dificultades como es la salud de sus hijos que lo han detenido en poner en práctica sus planes. Inicio su negocio por medio la ayuda de su familia y el conocimiento en el funcionamiento del negocio mismo. Los planes para corto plazo es aumentar estos primeros meses del año sus ingresos y a un largo plazo el expandirse su elenco de maquinas mecánicas para mayor variedad. Agradece a  Afodenic por el apoyo en este ciclo de préstamo ya que gracias a la Institución ha logrado mejor poco a poco su nivel de vida. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales como: zinc, clavos de acero, reglones de madera. Para  cambiar el techo de su casa obteniendo mayor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old.  He is married and his wife works as a cleaner to help with their household expenses.  His children are already living independently, working and helping their parents.  José's main plans are to continue supporting his children so that they can continue preparing themselves professionally.

José has his own business which is an auto repair shop.  His business has been going for 26 years.  He has maintained it and has plans to grow it.  During the time that he has had his business, he has faced a number of problems, such as his children's health, which have prevented him from putting his plans into practice.  He started his business with the help of his family and his knowledge of running the business.  His short term plans are to increase his income over the first few months of the year and, in the long term, he plans to expand the number of machines he has so that he has more variety.

José is grateful to Afodenic for the support that they are giving him in this loan cycle since, thanks to the Institution, he has managed to gradually improve his standard of living.  He will invest this loan in buying materials such as corrugated metal, steel nails and wooden beams.  He will replace the roof of his house which will make his family safer.

loans.use: To replace his roof

loans.name: G.s. El Triangulo Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Triangulo está conformado por Lucia y Tamara tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Lucia tiene 47 años y su actividad es una pulpería, es madre de 5 hijos, pero todos trabajan de manera independiente es una persona muy activa con su negocio. Tamara es una joven emprendedora con todas las ganas de salir adelante, ella tiene 1 hijo menor de edad y su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Son personas muy humildes que buscan la forma de salir adelante. El crédito que solicitan es para invertirlos en sus negocios y aprovechar esta temporada festiva.
texts.en:
The Solidario Triangulo group is made up of Lucia and Tamara, who have different businesses.  Lucia is 47 years old and has a general store.  She has five children, who all work independently.  She is very active in her business.  Tamara is a young entrepreneur with a drive to succeed.  She has one young child and she sells cosmetics.  They are both humble people who are looking for a way to succeed.  

They are asking for this loan to invest in their businesses and take advantage of the holiday season.

loans.use: Working capital for a general store and cosmetics business

loans.name: Piedras De Oro Group

texts.es: Maria Cristina I. Q., D. veintidós años D. edad, es una señorita, que apoya económicamente a su familia para que sus padres puedan darle un mejor futuro a sus cuatro hermanitos pequeños,  ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa que ella  ha podido  mantener esta actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. cuatro años, ella venD. en varios municipios y en los días D. plaza del pueblo para mejorar sus venta y tener más clientes, necesita surtir su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas, D. esa manera pueda obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desD. hace mas D. ocho años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su comunidad, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, elaboración D. mochilas,  venta D. mercería, entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina I. Q. is 22 years old and supports her family financially so that her parents can give her four younger siblings a better future.  She has sold clothing for more than four years.  She sells in many towns and in the town square on market days to improve her sales and have more customers.  She needs to add merchandise to her store to improve sales and earn more money.  

She gathered some friends and neighbors that she has known for more than eight years to form this group, which will support not only her family, but the people of her community.  Each of the woman work in different areas, such as: fruit sales, raising animals, making backpacks, selling notions, and others.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Amigos Unidos 7, 8 Group

texts.en:
Angela is the coordinator of her group Amigos Unidos (United friends) 7, 8 . Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity here is the Free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This is an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Angela makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children.

Angela is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She has a food stand where she sells breakfast and lunch. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing meat, rice, beans, vegetables, oil, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. Her long-term goal is to have an improved business. She wants to live in her old age in a safe house with her family, maybe by returning to Haiti or by living in the Dominican Republic. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, meats, etc.

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Simona es una pequeña comerciante, que se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, zapatos, siendo su medio de ingreso para poder apoyar  a sus hijos ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del papa.
Para ella no ha sido fácil, pero se ha esforzado, lo que ha logrado la captación de clientes. Y a través de los financiamientos  ha venido comprando más productos los cuales los vende en los departamentos en donde se vende más, es por eso sus venta las realiza en el norte.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo su objetivo es comprar ropa nueva para dama, caballero, niños, zapatos, perfumes, logrando aumentar las ventas ya que este mes se comercializa mucha mercadería.
texts.en:
Simona is a small businesswoman who sells clothes and shoes.  This is how she makes income to support her children since she has no support from the children's father.

Life hasn't been easy for Simona but she has worked hard and managed to attract a number of customers.  Through her loans, she has been buying more products.  She sells these in the departments where they sell best.  For this reason, she makes her sales in the north.

Simona's goal with this new loan is to buy new clothes for men, women and children, shoes and perfume.  This will help her to increase her sales as merchandise sells well during this month.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's clothes and different styles of shoes so that she can increase her sales

loans.name: Marta Mayra

texts.es:
Doña Marta mujer emprendedora de oficio comerciante con su propio micro empresa de elaboración de rosquillas, viejitas y otros productos a base de maíz. Siendo los productos horneados una de las mayores tradiciones de Nicaragua. Tiene como planes principales el mejorar el nivel de vida, vive con su mamá, y desde muy pequeña aprendió el oficio de horneadora poniéndolo en práctica desde hace 6 años siendo su medio de trabajo, ha encontrado como dificulta que su mamá se enfermo siendo ella la que asume todo los gastos de medicamentos, bueno superándolo y  siguiendo con su trabajo para cumplir sus planes. 
Con este nuevo financiamiento comprara materias primas como: maíz, queso, manteca, dulce, leña y otros productos. Logrando ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad y obteniendo mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta is an enterprising woman who is a saleswoman by trade.  She has her own small business where she makes 'rosquillas' (a kind of doughnut), 'viejitas' (a traditional Nicaraguan sweet pastry) and other products made from corn.  Baked products are one of Nicaragua's biggest traditions.

Marta's main goal is to improve her standard of living.  She lives with her mom and she learned the trade of baker when she was very small.  She put her knowledge into practice as a job six years ago.  She encountered problems when her mom became sick as Marta is the one who covers the cost of all her medication.  However, she overcame her problems and continues working to achieve her goals.

Marta will use this new loan to buy supplies such as corn, cheese, butter, milk caramel, firewood and other products.  This will enable her to offer more variety to her customers and she will make more profits.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making her products

loans.name: G.s. Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: La señora Brenda Carolina tiene su negocio que es venta de la comercialización de ropa, productos plásticos y de vidrio y otros artículos en general. Un obstáculo que ha tenido últimamente es la falta de movimiento de parte de los clientes. Ella desea continuar invirtiendo en mercadería en general. Su sueño, es establecer una tienda en el mercado. La otra integrante es Cristian Isabel  su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, tal como ropa y calzado de manera ambulante. Ella tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos acaba de graduarse de sexto grado de primaria. Juntas se han unido con el fin de obtener un nuevo financiamiento y poder salir adelante y aprovechar estas festividades.
texts.en:
Señora Brenda Carolina has a business selling clothing, plastic and glass products and other general items. One obstacle that she has come up against lately is her customers' lack of cash flow. She wants to continue investing in general merchandise. Her dream is to set up a retail store in the market. 

The other group member is Cristian Isabel, who has a business selling general merchandise, such as clothing and footwear, as a street vendor. She has two children, one of whom has just graduated from sixth grade. These women have teamed up together to obtain new financing, so that they can make progress and take advantage of this festive period.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Beriakou Ama

texts.fr: Ama a 4 enfants en charge et est âgée de  36ans.  Pour contribuer au foyer, elle fait elle même la préparation   de savons et shampoing  qu’elle vend en gros. Elle cumule 11 ans dans cette activité. Elle achète les produits de préparations au grand marché de Lomé et revend  au marché d’adidogomé. Elle sollicite un prêt pour se réapprovisionner
texts.en: Ama cares for four children and is 36.  To help pay household expenses she makes soaps and shampoos, which she wholesales.  She has been doing this for 11 years.  She buys her raw materials in the big marketplace in Lomé and sells her products in the marketplace in Adidogomé.  She is asking for a loan to build her inventory.

loans.use: Buy products for making soap.

loans.name: Awusi Setsoafia

texts.fr: Awusi a 4 enfants et âgée de 59 ans. Elle est née à Agou et habite quartier Totsi. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait la vente de cartes de recharge et a ouvert à cet effet une cabine téléphonique.  Pour avoir les cartes de recharge, elle les achète à Togo cellulaire, Moov et Togo télécom. L’objet de ce crédit sera  essentiellement destiné à l’achat  40 cartes togocel, 20 cartes  Moov et 10 cartes Illico.
texts.en: Awusi has four children and is 59.  She was born in Agou and lives in the Totsi neighborhood.  To help pay household expenses she sells prepaid mobile phone cards from her telephone cabin.  She buys the cars from Togo Cellulaire, Moov and Togo Télécom.  This loan will enable her to buy 40 cards from Togocel, 20 from Moov et 10 from Illico.

loans.use: Buy prepaid mobile phone cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jewelry

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Mme Akoua est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée. Elle a en charge un enfant.  Elle exerce une activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de boullie et gâteau.   Elle fait cette  activité, il y a de cela 7 ans et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter 8 sacs de mais, 3 sacs de sucre et 2 sacs de farine de blé pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: She is 52 years old and married.  She takes care of one child.   She has a business of selling porridge and cakes.  She has been doing this work for seven years.  She gets her supplies at the main market in Lomé.  She is requesting a loan to buy eight sacks of corn, three sacks of sugar, and two sacks of wheat flour to meet the demands of more clients.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar and flour

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 6 Group

texts.en:
Eliana is the coordinator of her group Canal de Bendicion 6 (Channel of Blessing).  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children, taking care of them as a single mom.

Eliana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fried food, by buying chicken, beef, flour, oil and plantains. She operates a fried food stand where she cooks dinners for sale. She will use the profits to improve her quality of life by building her house out of concrete block, for more security.

loans.use: To buy chicken, beef, flour, oil and plantains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa  a 43 ans et est mariée.  Elle a 3 enfants.  Elle fait le commerce de céréales notamment  le maïs  et  haricot. Elle s’approvisionne à Kpalimé et  à Assahoun  et cumule 5 ans dans cette activité. Dans cette activité, elle a déjà  remboursé plusieurs crédit. Elle espère acheter  10 sacs de Maïs et 8 sacs d’haricot.
texts.en: Kossiwa is 43 years old and married. She has three children. She sells cereals, more specifically corn and beans. She stocks up in Kpalimé and in Assahoun and has five years of experience in this area. She already repaid several prior loans. She hopes to buy ten bags of corn and eight bags of beans.

loans.use: Purchasing corn and beans

loans.name: Tadeo Uber

texts.es:
Tadeo de 36 años, es licenciado en educación desde hace varios años trabaja en un centro de desarrollo en las mañana. El quiere seguir prosperando para darle un buen futuro a su familia (en la foto aparece toda su familia). 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas) vive con su esposa y dos hijos pequeños. Ha trabajado durante dos años en el centro de desarrollo manteniendo a su familia con su sueldo pero uno de sus objetivos siempre ha sido tener su propio negocio. 

El préstamo lo quiere utilizar para construir en la parte delantera de su casa un local dirigido para una papelería ya que quiere que su esposa también tenga la oportunidad de trabajar comprando cemento, bloques, pintura. En el futuro quiere que el negocio que inicie sea conocido y así poderle dar un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tadeo is 36 years old and has a degree in education.  For a few years, he has worked in a development center in the morning.  He would like to continue doing well to provide a good future for his family (who are all in the picture).  

He lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil in Paraíso (a peri-urban area with dirt roads and the houses are located in the mountains) with his wife and two young children.  He has worked for two years at a development center and supported his family with his income, but one of his goals has always been to have his own business.

He would like to use this loan to build a stationary store in the front part of his house so that his wife also has the opportunity to work.  He needs to buy cement, bricks, and paint.  In the future, he would like the business they are started to be well-known so that he can give his children a good future.

loans.use: Purchase cement and bricks to build a stationary store

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es: El señor José Leonel, tiene 49 años tiene 1 hijo. Rafael se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de acarreo. El dio inicio a este medio de vida porque no tenía un medio de ingreso para mantener a su familia ya que siempre ha demostrado ser un padre responsable. El tiene una camioneta en donde traslada todas las cosas que sus clientes necesitan.  El crédito que solicita es para realizar ciertas reparaciones a su camioneta. Su sueño es llegar a aumentar el mercado de oferta, esto con el propósito de incrementar las ganancias percibidas por el señor y de esta manera apoyar más a su familia económicamente.
texts.en: Mr. Jose Leonel, is 49 years old and has one son, Rafael. His work is trucking services. He began doing this work because he had no means of income to maintain his family, and he has always been a responsible parent. He has a truck in which he transports everything his clients' need. He is asking for a loan to take care of various repairs on his truck. His dream is to one day increase his market offerings and with this proposition, increase his potential earnings so that he may support even more his family economically.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
La señora Alberta tiene 35 años, ella está separada de su marido ya que  la abandono y se fue con otra mujer, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8 años, los cuales están a cargo de Alberta, y el padre de los niños des da una asistencia familiar de $us 58 cada mes para los dos niños, monto que no alcanza ni para el material escolar, entonces doña Alberta tiene que trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.

Alberta actualmente vive con su padre ya que la madre acaba de fallecer aproximadamente 6 meses, para ella esa perdía es muy duro ya ella le cuidaba a los niños mientras trabajaba, vive en la comunidad de Chinchilla, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, además Alberta trabaja en las noches de  sereno en una Cooperativa.
El préstamo será destinado para la construcción de comederos (establo) para el ganado, con lo cual estarán más protegidos los ganados en estas temporadas de lluvia. 

Entre sus sueños y metas de Alberta son crecer en su actividad, hasta tener una pequeña granja de por lo menos 20 cabezas de ganado, y lo más importante que sus dos hijos terminen de estudiar una carrera profesional para que de ese modo tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Alberta is 35 years old and is separated from her husband who left her for another woman.  She has two children, ages 14 and 8, who are dependant on her for their livelihood.  The children's father pays a total monthly child support of $58 which does not even cover the cost of school materials.  So Alberta has to work hard to provide an income for her family.

Alberta currently lives with her father since her mother passed away around six months ago.  The loss was very hard since her mother took care of the children while she worked.  She lives in a town in Chinchilla and her main activity is dairy production.  She delivers fresh milk to a company that produces dairy products.  Alberta also works as a security guard at the Co-op.

She plans to use the loan to build a stable for her cattle so they will be protected during the rainy season.

Alberta's goals for the future include growing her business until she can have a small farm of at least 20 cattle.  The most important thing for her is to see her children finish their education and have a profession so they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To build a stable for dairy cattle

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María de 34 años, es comerciante informal de ropa y zapatos en las distintas zonas de Paraíso (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Vive con su esposo y dos hijos en el Paraíso de Guayaquil. María ha sido una mujer trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado tener su propio dinero por eso comenzó con la venta de ropa puerta a puerta. Tiene distintos horarios de trabajo ya que debe atender a sus hijos. Como es tiempo de lluvia se le hace poco dificultoso recorrer las calles. 

Ella quiere seguir trabajando por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y zapatos y así sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar la mercadería. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and sells clothing and shoes in different parts of Paraíso (in the peri-urban areas where there are dirt roads and houses in the mountains).

She lives with her husband and two children in Paraíso in Guayaquil.  María is a hard worker who has always enjoyed having her own money.  She began selling clothing through door-to-door sales and now works different shifts so she can attend to her children.  Since it is now the rainy season it is hard for her to get out into the streets.

She would like to continue working and wants to use the loan to buy clothing and shoes in order to provide more variety to her customers.  Her plans for the future include growing her business and making home improvements.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José tiene 30 años. El señor tiene un negocio de venta de venta de llantas y repuestos para vehículos, tanto nuevos como usados, este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Cabe señalar, el señor tiene ya 3 años de haber empezado con este negocio el cual dio inicio debido a la necesidad de generar un empleo propio y una forma de manutención de su familia, que son quienes lo han estado apoyando todo este tiempo. Su negocio tiene como nombre Multiservicios Jinotepe. El solicita este préstamo para realizar la compra de repuestos para vehículos, buscando como ampliar la distribución de su producto en estos meses. Su sueño, por el momento solo es hacer crecer más su negocio y que siga siendo tan rentable como ha sido hasta el momento.
texts.en:
Francisco José is 30 years old.  He owns a tire and auto repair parts business (for new and used vehicles) which he operates out of his home.  He began the business three years ago as a way to generate income for his family, who have supported him all this time.

His business is known as Multiservicios Jinotepe.  He is requesting the loan to buy more auto repair parts so he can increase business in the coming months.  His dream is to grow his business so that it can stay as profitable as it has been until now.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es: Yolanda del Carmen C. de 63 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, donde vive junto a una nieta mayor de edad, la cual es su única compañía. Ella es una persona muy responsable quien trabaja muy duro para poder sostener su hogar. Desde hace 7 años que Yolanda invirtió sus ahorros en una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual nació con la iniciativa de tener una mejor estabilidad económica, y así mismo brindarle todo lo mejor a su nieta, la cual en la actualidad le ayuda a atender el negocio. Yolanda solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su tienda comprando productos como embutidos, detergentes, pan y otros productos más, esto lo espera lograr  por medio de dicho préstamo, ya que a pesar que cuenta con varios años de poseer la tienda no ha contado con el dinero necesario para invertir más en ella debido a que la mayoría de las ganancias las invierte en los gastos del hogar, por lo que dicho préstamo será de mucho beneficio para ella, ya que le permitirá crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda del Carmen C. is 63 years old and lives in the department of Usulután.  She lives with her eldest granddaughter who is her only companion.  She is a very responsible person and has always worked hard to provide an income.  

For seven years Yolanda has been investing her savings in a fresh produce store which she began as a way of having a steady income in order to provide the best for her granddaughter who helps her out in the business.

Yolanda wants to use the loan to buy products such as cold meats and sausage, detergent, bread and other products.  Even though she has had the store for several years, the earnings she has obtained have always gone toward household expenses.  Therefore the loan will be beneficial for expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 3 Group

texts.en:
Benito is the one of the members of his group Unidas para Triunfar  (Unite to Win) 3. He makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and a child. He says that his most difficult challenge is to work hard to become a business man.  In the meantime, he plans to continue enjoying studying.

Benito is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza. He has had his business for 2 years, starting with some capital he saved. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying salami, cheese, hot dog sausages, etc. He will use the profits to invest in his business and to buy items they need in at home. 

Benito's association with Esperanza began because he wants to improve his business. His  story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.   His group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic.  This area is famous for its tobacco and beef production, but like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, it suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy sausages and cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials to make shoes

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es: María Adela V. D. P. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en el Cantón el Calvario, en el departamento D. Cuscatlán, en donD. vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una cafetería dentro D. una escuela en donD. ha trabajado por 9 años. Ella cuenta con muy buenas ventas diarias, por lo que desea poder incrementar los productos que ya posee como: golosinas, bebidas frías y calientes, pan, entre otros más, lo cual pretenD. alcanzar solicitando un préstamo a Integral. La familia D. María es bastante granD., por lo que tanto ella como su esposo deben esforzarse a diario por lograr salir adelante y D. esta manera brindarles todo lo necesario a sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en: María Adela V. D. P. is 45 years old and lives in the El Calavario canton in the department of Cuscatlán with her husband and four children, who are in school.  María has a cafe insiD. of a school where she has worked for nine years.  She has very good sales every day, so she would like to increase the products that she sells like: snacks, cold and hot beverages, bread and more.  To do this, she has asked for a loan from Integral.  María's family is large, so both she and her husband have to work hard every day to succeed and proviD. everything her children need.

loans.use: Purchase snacks and beverages

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 53 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera vive con uno de sus hijos tiene 27 años de edad y estudia agronomía, doña María posee una tienda y vende tortillas, desde hace 12 años se dedica a este oficio y lo atiende de 7:00am a 9:00pm, su negocio son las tortillas y en la tienda ofrece golosinas y bebidas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio,  comprando jugos, sodas y golosinas, con esta ayuda incrementara el negocio y contara con productos que los clientes le demandan. El sueño de doña María ver a su hijo graduado, poseer casa propia y pagar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Dona Maria is 53 years old and lives in San Miguel, San Miguel state. She is a single mother and lives with one of her children who is 27 years old and studying agriculture. Dona Maria has a store and sells tortillas. She's been doing this work in this location for 12 years. She opens from 7:00 a.m. till 9:00 p.m. Her business is selling tortillas as well as candy and drinks.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to enlarge the stock, buying juices, sodas and candies. With this help, she will increase the business and provide products that her clients are demanding. Her dream is to see her son graduate, own a house of her own and pay her debts.

loans.use: To buy juices, sodas and candies

loans.name: Rubidia Abigail Mejía Bonilla

texts.es: Rubidia Abigail M. B. de 41 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, en el departamento de Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, sus suegros y un hijo. Ella posee una tienda en la cual vende productos alimenticios como cereales, comida enlatada y otros productos más los cuales son de primera necesidad el negocio se encuentra en su casa de habitación. Rubidia es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se dedica por completo a atender su negocio y a cuidar a su hijo  quien se dedica a estudiar.  Rubidia solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos perecederos y de esta manera surtir la tienda lo más posible, ya que de esta forma ella podrá atender a más clientela. Todo eso lo hace ya que espera mejorar su economía familiar y así brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rubidia Abigail M. B. is 41 years old and lives in Cojutepeque in the department of Cuscatlán, with her husband, her in-laws and her son. In the house she has a store from which she sells food products such as cereals, canned goods and other basic food items. 

Rubidia is a very hardworking woman, who is totally dedicated to her business and to taking care of her son who is a student. She is requesting a loan as she really wants to be able to buy larger quantities of perishable goods and thus stock up her store as much as possible, allowing her to satisfy more customers. 

Rubidia is doing all this in the hope that she can improve her household economy and thus provide a better future for her son.

loans.use: To buy perishable goods.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
Walter, tiene 31 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vende ropa y artículos navideños, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 12, 10 y 7, quienes dependen económicamente de él, Walter se creció en el negocio con su madre y al momento de casarse lo hizo con alguien también se creció en el comercio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y artículos navideños, esto pues preparándose para el mes de diciembre que es cuando más demanda presenta estos artículos. Con este préstamo su inventario estará surtido y  preparado para atender a los clientes dándoles un mejor servicio.
Su propósito es aprovechar la temporada para aumentar sus ventas y recibir ingresos para ir ahorrando y en un futuro tener un negocio libre de préstamos.
texts.en:
Walter is 31 years old and lives in San Miguel. He sells clothing and Christmas commodities. He lives with his wife and their three children ages 12, 10 and 7. They depend on him economically.  Walter was raised in the business with his mother and at the time he was wed, he married someone who was also raised in business. 

He is currently asking for a loan to buy clothing and Christmas goods. This will allow him to prepare for the month of December, which is when there is the greatest demand for this kind of merchandise. With the loan, he will invest in increasing his surplus inventory to assist his clients giving them better service.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Denis Danilo

texts.es: Denis Danilo se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo por lo que este es su principal fuente de ingresos para ayudar en los gastos de su familia. Este negocio surgió por la necesidad de trabajar, Por los gastos que tiene como Padre para su hijo. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante y en su vivienda ya que este es el único método que le da resultados pues tiene que levantarse todos los días muy temprano para preparar las cosas que ofrecerá a sus clientes. El solicita este financiamiento para comprar vestidos, trajes, camisas, pantalones entre otros y así ofrecer variedad en esta navidad.
texts.en:
Denis Danilo sells used clothing. He has a son in his care and this business is his main source of income to help with the family expenses. This business came about because of the need to work since he has expenses related to being a father to his child. The location of his business is out on the street and in his home. This sales method is the only one that gives him results so he has to wake up early every day to prepare the things he will offer to his customers.

He is requesting this loan to buy dresses, suits, shirts, pants, and other items so that he can offer variety for Christmas.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more clothes

loans.name: Las Originales Group

texts.es:
Las Originales grupo conformado por tres mujeres esforzadas, emprendedoras y luchadoras una de ellas es la   señora Juana O. comerciante de calzado. Ella es la coordinadora del grupo e  inicio su negocio hace siete años junto con su esposo quien se encarga de la producción de zapatos mientras ella los distribuye en la zona franca.

O. desea ampliar su negocio en especial por las ventas de diciembre que son una de las más grandes del año. 
Las otras dos integrantes del grupo son Darling S. quien desde hace más de tres años vende cosméticos Avon, marca de gran prestigio en Nicaragua y Deyanira H. tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde invertirá en telas e hilos.
texts.en:
The group “Las Originales” (The Originals) consists of three industrious, enterprising, and determined women. One of them is Sra. Juana O., a shoe merchant. She is the group coordinator and started her business seven years ago with her husband, who is in charge of producing the shoes while she sells them in the free trade zone.

Sra. O. wants to expand her business, especially her sales for December since it is one of the busiest times of the year.

The other members of the group are Darling S., who has been selling Avon cosmetics for three years (a well-known brand in Nicaragua), and Deyanira H., who has a small sewing workshop and wants to invest in fabrics and thread.

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for making shoes

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Doña Florinda, una señora dedicada a la venta D. tortillas y leña, tiene 70 años D. edad, y a pesar D. su avanzada edad se encuentra con ánimos para seguir trabajando vive con su esposo, un nieto y una nuera, quienes dependen económicamente D. ella; La necesidad la obligo a aprender a hacer las tortillas y dedicarse a su venta para contar con ingresos para el hogar, así también venD. leña, su horario D. venta es D. 2:30AM a 1:00 pm.  Doña Florinda lleva ya 18 años D. dedicarse a este negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. maíz, leña y ropa para vender en estas fiestas D. fin D. año; La venta D. ropa será un nuevo negocio que administrara como iniciativa propia para ofrecer un producto diferente  y del agrado D. los clientes, aprovechando las fiestas D. fin D. año quiere ganar más ingresos y cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Su propósito es realizar una buena inversión, capaz D. crecer en el comercio y algún día poseer un negocio propio sin necesidad D. financiamiento.
texts.en:
Doña Florinda sells tortillas and firewood. Despite being 70 years of age, she is eager to continue working. She lives with her husband, a grandson, and a daughter-in-law who are financially dependent on her. Necessity forced her to learn how to make and sell tortillas in order to have household income. She also sells firewood. Her schedule for making sales is between 2:30am and 1pm. Doña Florinda has been in this business for eighteen years.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, and clothing to sell for the year-end festivities. Selling clothes will be a new business venture that she will start because she wants to offer a different product to keep her customers happy as well as an opportunity to take advantage of the year-end celebrations in order to earn more income to cover the household needs.

Her goals are to make good on this investment, grow in her business, and someday be able to have her own business without the need for loans.

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, and clothing

loans.name: Confianza Y Dignidad 2 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is one of the members of the Confianza y Dignidad 2 (Trust and dignity) Group, located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic, where there are often drinking-water and electricity shortages. The population of this area is comprised of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. Carmen's primary activity is to sell fruit and vegetables.

Carmen is the mother of four children, who live with her and their father. She tells us that she wants to build an additional room in her house. Her favorite activity is to take care of her children and be at her home.

Carmen is very excited to receive her 11th loan through Esperanza International. She has had her business for fifteen years, which she started with a small amount of savings she had and with her initiative to generate income and be useful. She plans to invest this new loan into purchasing fruits, cassava, plantain, banana, sweet potatoes. She will use the profits to save so she can finish building her home.

loans.use: to buy fruits: cassaba, plantain, banana, sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Yoisy Feliciana

texts.es:
Yoisy de 33 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura de ropa. Viviendo con su hijo de 10 años en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Comenzó haciendo cursos de confección porque siempre le gusto esta actividad y decidió tener su propio taller de costura. En la actualidad trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm en su casa confeccionando pantalones, vestidos, blusas a sus clientes y así tener ingresos suficientes para darle una mejor vida a su hijo de 10 años. Tiene muchas aspiración con su negocio por eso quiere continuar para su taller de confección telas, hilos  por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y máquina de coser. 

 En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio de confección y poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Yoisy is 33 years old and manages a sewing and dressmaking shop. She lives with her ten year old son in an urban area called Orquídeas de Guayaquil, which is named after the many orchids that existed when it was discovered.

Yoisy began making clothes because she always enjoyed sewing, so she decided to open her own shop. She currently works every day from 7am to 8pm at home making trousers, dresses, and blouses for her customers so that she can earn enough income to give her ten year old son a better life. Yoisy has many aspirations, so she wants to continue her sewing business with this loan by purchasing fabrics and thread so that she will able to produce clothes and acquire a sewing machine.

In the future, she wants to continue with her dressmaking business and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar, reside en San Miguel donde vive con su esposa, se dedican a la venta de ropa, al taller de sastrería, venden agua en garrafas y también venden sandalias, la sastrería la aprendió joven, el comercio también lo aprendió hace 13 años, esta es la labor que junto a su esposa realizan diariamente.
Actualmente quieren comprar ropa nueva  para vender en esta fiesta navideña que ya se acercan, Su propósito es estar preparados para la venta ya que no quieren pasar una navidad sin ingresos; su proyección es ser un comerciante de éxito, tener mucha clientela y ofrecer los mejores productos y ropa fina.
texts.en:
Cesar lives in San Miguel with his wife. He manages a clothing stand, operates a tailoring shop, and sells bottled water and sandals. Cesar learned tailoring as a young man and how to run a business thirteen years ago. He and his wife work together every day.

Cesar currently wants to buy new clothing to sell for the approaching Christmas season. His goal is to be prepared for making sales because he does not want Christmas to pass by without any income. He has aspirations to become a successful merchant, have many customers, and offer the best products and fine clothing.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: La Gata Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Gata está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Agustina Ángela F. Obando  de 36 años  quien inicio vendiendo tortillas actualmente tiene una pequeña venta donde oferta maíz, queso, huevo, chicharron, cuajadas, leche agria etc. 
Su meta principal es la venta de verdura en lo cual invertira el crédito y llegar a tener una miscelánea. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Sandi Salomé S. Gómez de 20 años  quien tiene una pequeña tortillería y Hessel Raquel S. Alegría comercializa productos Avon.
texts.en:
The group “La Gata” consists of three hardworking, industrious, and enterprising women. One of them is Agustina Ángela F. Obando, age 36, who started selling tortillas. She currently has a small shop where she offers corn, cheese, eggs, pork, cheese curds, sour milk, and other products. Her main goal is selling vegetables for which she will use this loan. She wants to have a general store.

The other group members are Sandi Salomé S. Gómez (age 20) who has a small tortilla shop and Hessel Raquel S. Alegría who sells Avon products.

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 68 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel donde vive junto a dos hijos de 25 y 28 años y cuatro nietos, ella posee casa propia, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, este negocio nació por la necesidad de tener ingresos y lo comenzó hace ocho años con un horario de 7:00am a 6:00pm, de lunes a viernes o depende de cómo este el mercado y la demanda de los clientes.
Ella necesita comprar ropa nueva para mujer por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir, con esta ayuda ella espera aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y atraer a nuevos clientes que le ayuden a reconocerse entre otras personas.
El objetivo de Doña María es estar siempre activa en el trabajo, buscando la manera de ganar dinero para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y cubrir las necesidades importantes.
texts.en:
Doña María is 68 years old and lives in the City of San Miguel with her two children (ages 25 and 28) and four grandchildren. She has her own home and sells new clothing. This business was started out of necessity eight years ago so that she could have income. She works Monday through Friday from 7am to 6pm, or according to the demands of the market and her customers.

She needs to buy new women’s clothing, so she is requesting a loan to acquire outfits. With this assistance she hopes to increase her sales volume and attract new customers to help refer her to other people.

Doña María’s goals are to always be active in her work, find ways to earn money to support the daily needs of her family, and cover the important necessities.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Milagro lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas, ellas son  Margarita del Carmen Gómez de 38 años, Ana María L. L. de 35 años y Brígida de la Concepción Mejía Vasquez de 23 años.
La señora Ana L. es la coordinadora del grupo quien es comerciante de productos Avon, Arabella, Zermat y comercializa bisutería. Ella inició con su mamá en la empresa Oriflame con la que trabajo dos años y luego empezó a trabajar con las otras empresas y como vio que necesitaba capital para poder sobre vivir de eso decidió empezar a trabajar con ayuda de los préstamos.
 Ella invertirá el préstamo en encargos de productos como cosméticos, perfumes, bisutería, cremas etc. L.  tiene dos hijos y tres hijos de crianza, y su mayor anelo es mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Margarita del Carmen Gómez madre de dos hijos se dedica al  comercializo ropa y productos Avon y Zermat y  Brígida M. de 23 años quien tiene una pequeña y espera su segundo hijo también  vende productos vía catálogo de la Avón y Zermat.
texts.en:
The group “Milagro” (Miracle) consists of three hardworking and strong women. They are Margarita del Carmen Gómez (age 38), Ana María L. L. (age 35), and Brígida de la Concepción Mejía Vasquez (age 23).

Sra. Ana L. is the group coordinator who earns her living as a merchant of Avon, Arabella, and Zermat products. She also sells trinkets. Ana and her mother started a business selling Oriflame products two years ago and later began working with other companies. Seeing that they needed capital in order to continue working, they began seeking assistance with the loans. Ana will invest the loan in products on order such as cosmetics, perfumes, trinkets, crèmes, and other items.
