texts.es: Néstor Jacobo, tiene 31 años es casado y tiene un hijo que es menor de edad. el se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos pues ha sido una gran experiencia. El inicio hace 10 años, pues con el paso del tiempo fue que el decidió quedarse con este medio de vida y salir adelante. Ahora solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en medicamentos ya que tiene ciertos encargos pendientes.
texts.en:
Néstor Jacobo, 31, is married and has a minor son.  He sells medicines.  This isn’t his first time asking for a loan because it’s been a great experience.

He started out 10 years ago and with the passage of time decided to stay in this way of life and get ahead.

He is asking for a loan now to invest in medicines since he has several pending orders.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Elsa; ella tiene 53 años. La socia es casada, y tiene 3 hijos;  La socia se dedica a la agricultura, como principal actividad, la socia también tiene su restaurante y ella desea ahora implementar su restaurante y un poco decorar su casa, la socia siembra maíz y coca en Yanatile, Calca; La socia comprará mesas y sillas, para su restaurante y cubiertos, para su casa ella tiene previsto comprar un mueble para poner el televisor y la radio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mesas, sillas, mueble para la televisión y otros.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elsa, 53, is a member of the “QORICHUSPA” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province and department.

She is married and has three children.  She is primarily a farmer but she also has a restaurant that she wants to equip and she also wants to decorate her house.  She plants corn and coca leaf in Yanatile, Calca.  

She will buy tables, chairs and cutlery for the restaurant and for her house she intends to buy a piece of furniture for the television set and the radio.

She is asking for a loan to buy tables, chairs and a piece of furniture for the television set and others.

She is happy with the granted loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, a piece of furniture for the television set and others.

loans.name: America Y Nadamas Group

texts.es: LA FOTO FUE TOMADA EN CASA DE LA SEÑORA MARÍA DE LOS ÁNGELES, UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO AMERICA Y NADAMAS QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA CIUDAD DE NOGALES ESTADO DE VERACRUZ EN MEXICO,SE VE A LAS INTEGRANTES ALREDEDOR DE LA MERCANCIA.LA SEÑORA MARÍA DE LOS ÁNGELES SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MANUALIDADES DE ESTAMBRE QUE INICIÓ HACE 10 AÑOS,SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA,SUS GANANCIAS AUMENTARON.AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE CONTENTA,ELLA TIENE 51 AÑOS,ESTUDIO HASTA SEGUNDO DE PRIMARIA,ES VIUDA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS: 2 MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE. QUIERE ESTE CREDITO PARA PODER HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO.TAMBIEN ESPERA OBTENER UNA BUENA UTILIDAD.EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE SOLICITA UN CREDITO A CREDICOMUN.
texts.en: The photo was taken at María de los Ángeles' house.  She is a member of the group America y Nadamas, which is located in the city of Nogales in the state of Veracruz, Mexico.  The members are pictured around the merchandise.  María de los Ángeles has sold handmade wool items for the last 10 years.  She is asking for the loan in order to buy raw materials, since her sales increased.  When she applied for this loan, she felt happy.  She is 51 years old and attended school through the second grade.  She is a widow and has 3 children: 2 women and a man.  She wants this loan in order to grow her business.  She also hopes to earn a good profit.  The group is made up of 9 members and this is the first time it is applying for a loan with Credicomun.

loans.use: For the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is sixty seven years old. He owns his home which he shares with his wife and their youngest daughter in the district of Tambogrande in northen Peru, a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers many of whom own small fruit plantations or raise animals.

Perdo is a farmer who owns two and one-half hectares of land near his home. The land is currently planted with a crop of late-harvest rice. In addition, Pedro and his wife raise animals, including sheep, in corrals near their home. Pedro’s wife runs a small general store out of their home.

Pedro has not worked with Edpyme Alternativa before. He appreciates the access to credit and lower interest rate that is provided as a result of Kiva funding. He plans to use the loan to hirer laborers to help take care of the rice crop and later, in the harvest.

loans.use: To hire laborers to help take care of the rice crop and its harvest

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old.  He lives in the district of Tambogrande in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone which is primarily populated by small farmers, many of which own small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Jose maintains a stable home along with his wife.  They have one young daughter.

Jose has a hectare of agricultural land near his home on which he has a crop of rice maturing.  He plants different crops on the land depending on the season.  In addition to agriculture, he and his wife raise animals in corrals behind their home.  They raise sheep and goats.  Their herd currently consists of 20 sheep and 12 goats.  They sell the animals in local markets when they reach the appropriate size.

The loan will be used to support the family’s income-earning activities.  They hope the investment will help them to expand their businesses and improve their income so that they can provide a better future for their child.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Maria Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 27 years old.  She lives in the district of Tambogrande in northen Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers, many of whom own small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Lily owns her home, which she shares with her husband and their two children.

Lily raises animals in corrals behind her home.  She raises cattle and sheep.  She raises the sheep for their meat and the cattle for milk.  She sells six liters of milk on a daily basis.  In addition to these activities, Lily is a beauty products saleswoman, working with the brand AVON.  She generally makes two purchases each month, taking requests from her clients.

This will be Lily’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the funds to purchase additional feed for her animals, repair her corrals and provide additional capital for purchases during the holiday season.  She is a hardworking woman with many dreams for the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her animals, repair her corrals and provide additional capital for purchases during the holiday season

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin is 47 years old.  He lives in the district of Tambogrande in northen Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers, many of whom own small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Agustin owns his home, which he shares with his wife.  They have two children.

Agustin raises animals in corrals behind his home.  He has 6 cows and 30 head of sheep.  He raises the animals for milk and for their meat.  In addition to animals, Agustin works a small plot of land the family owns.  He has the property planted with mature lime trees, from which he harvests fruit each week.  Given the extended growing season in the region, he is able to maintain relatively stable income levels in accordance with local prices.

Agustin has not worked with Edpyme Alternativa before. He appreciates the access to credit and a lower interest rate that is provided as a result of Kiva funding.  He plans to use the loan to purchase additional balanced feed for his animals and make various improvements to his corrals.  He expects that the investment will improve the animals' health and productivity.  From these improvements, he hopes to be able to improve his family’s lifestyle and provide greater opportunities to his children.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for his animals and make improvements to his corrals

loans.name: Rovinson

texts.en:
Rovinson is 46 years old.  He lives near the city of Reque, which is 15 minutes south of the major northern city of Chiclayo, located in the vast costal desert of northern Peru.  The area is located along a river and the pan-American Highway, which provides significant trade and agricultural opportunities.  Rovinson lives alone and has no children.

Rovinson operates a mototaxi, providing transport services to locals and for cargo as necessary.  He owns the mototaxi.  In addition, Rovinson is a member of the neighborhood security force and acts as a coordinator for the region.  He is proud of his work and community service, assisting his neighbors in meeting their needs and protecting their persons and property.

This will be his first experience with a financial institution.  He has good personal and business references.  Rovinson plans to use the loan funds to continue growing within the realm of transport and potentially change his mototaxi.

loans.use: To continue growing within the realm of transport and potentially change his mototaxi.

loans.name: Teodoro Arcangel

texts.en:
Teodoro is 23 years old.  He lives near the town of Reque, which is located approximately 15 minutes south of the city of Chiclayo.  It is a region that has both a river and significant ground water and is crossed by the pan-American Highway.  These factors provide significant opportunity to complete agricultural and commercial activities.  Teodoro has a two-month-old child and lives with his wife in a home they own.

Teodoro has consistent work as a farm hand and harvester on a large local farm.  He works on a daily basis harvesting tomatoes, peppers, carrots, and other vegetables.  In addition to this activity, the family raises animals in corrals behind their home.  They raise hogs, ducks, guinea pigs and other animals.  These animals they sell for their meat in local markets or to neighbors.

This will be Teodoro’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He appreciates the access to a reduced interest rate, which is provided due to the funding from Kiva.  He plans to use the loan to purchase additional feed for the animals and improve the corrals.  He hopes this will improve animal health and productivity so that he can improve his family’s wellbeing and begin to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for the animals and improve the corrals.

loans.name: Segundo Cristobal

texts.en:
Segundo is 28 years old.  He lives in the region of Oyotun, which is located in northern Peru.  Oyotun is an agricultural region located in a large valley that feeds out into the costal desert of northern Peru.  It has a river that passes through the area and a relatively high water table providing good agricultural opportunities.  It is fairly isolated, located approximately one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Segundo lives with his partner and their one child in a family home.

For the last two years, Segundo has driven a mototaxi in the zone.  He carries workers and residents to work and/or to complete shopping trips.  He also at times carries cargo such as building supplies or crops as needed by his clients.

Segundo has not worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past.  He has good references from the community.  He plans to use the loan proceeds to complete repairs and general maintenance on his mototaxi.  He hopes this action will reduce his ongoing expenses and ensure that the vehicle is available to continue earning income for his family.  He dreams of expanding the business and owning his own property so that his family can grow independently.

loans.use: To complete repairs and general maintenance on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Kumari

texts.en:
Kumari is passionate about helping others discover, plan for, and achieve what they want in their lives. By starting her own small business, ‘A Coach for Success,’ Kumari has found a way to turn that passion into a career. 

Kumari has been coaching individuals for over 30 years. Her unique coaching style, now embodied in A Coach for Success, draws on Kumari’s education in Holistic Heath Education, experiences working with social service agencies, and lessons from her own process of self-discovery. A Coach for Success has been Kumari’s side project while working a full-time job with a nonprofit organization in Richmond, CA, but she is now ready to take the plunge and invest herself fulltime in her business. 

Kumari currently coaches 20 clients, teaches workshops in the community, and speaks at events. Being her own boss – with full control of her own schedule – will allow her to be a more effective coach, as well as reach out to more individuals. She has found over the past few years that her workshop and coaching style are particularly timely. Perhaps due to the economic recession, Kumari explains that, “People feel like they need to look at their life right now. I ask them: What do you want? Why? What’s stopping you?” 

Even so, Kumari explains that marketing is the most challenging part of owning her own business; “Transformation isn’t often something that people want to go through.” To help promote her business she needs products – such as stories, greeting cards, tapes, and more workbooks- to accompany her workshops and speaking engagements. With a $2,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, Kumari will be able to develop these products, increase other advertising efforts, and at last take her business to the next level. 

To learn more about A Coach for Success, visit: http://acoachforsuccess.com

loans.use: To develop products such as cards, tapes, and workbooks to accompany her workshops; other advertising costs

loans.name: Los Heraldos De Motupe Group

texts.es:
HERALDOS D. MOTUPE

Yarma pertenece a L. Alcancía  Comunal  “HERALDOS D. MOTUPE” tiene el cargo D. presidenta, este grupo tiene ya 2 años trabajando con Edaprospo-prosperidad  esta conformado por 10 personas que decidieron todos ponerle ese nombre a su Alcancía Comunal por que en L. zona en  L. que viven lleva ese nombre.
Yarma tiene 31 años D. edad es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos que aun son dependientes trabaja vendiendo gelatinas (ambulante) y tanbien compra cabello para hacer pelucas  y asta el momento con el ingreso D. sus negocios a logrado construir su casa y comprar artefactos par el hogar L. señora con el préstamo que le estamos otorgando lo invertirá en su casa para seguir construyendo su sueño D. Yarma es poner un negocio D. comida (RESTAURENTE) en su vivienda y con L. ayuda D. Edaprospo-prosperidad en el futuro podrá realizar su sueño.
texts.en:
MOTUPE HERALDS

Yarma is a member of the “HERALDOS D. MOTUPE” (Motupe Heralds) communal bank; she is the President.  The group has been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for two years now.  It has 10 members who decided to name it thus because that’s the name of the area they live in.

Yarma is 31 years old and a single mother of two children who are still dependent. She works as a street vendor selling gelatin.  She also buys hair to make wigs and to date her income has allowed her to build her house and buy home appliances.

She will use the loan we are granting to invest in her house and continue with its construction.  Yarma’s dream is to set up a food business (RESTAURANT) in her home and with future help from Edaprospo-Prosperidad she will be able to realize her dream.

loans.use: To build her house.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y reside en casa de su madre, su vivienda se encuentra situada en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como ayudante en una peluquería ubicada en la zona donde reside, el brinda todo tipo de servicios a sus clientes: cortes de cabello, peinados, entre otros, el negocio es su única fuente de ingreso y siempre da lo mejor de si para obtener más clientes. Con algunas de sus ganancias ayuda a su madre a mejorar su calidad de vida.

José es una persona bastante responsable y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente desea adquirir algunos implementos para sacar adelante su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old.  He is single and lives in his mother's house in Chepén district.  This is an agricultural area, with quite a lot of commercial activity, which is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo

José works as an assistant in a hairdressing salon in his area.  He provides all kinds of services for his customers: haircuts, hairdos, etc.  The business is his only source of income and he always provides the best of himself in order to attract more customers.  José uses some of his profits to help his mother to improve her quality of life.

José is quite a responsible person who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  He would currently like to acquire some tools to keep his business going.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire some tools to keep his business going

loans.name: Karin Soledad

texts.es:
Karín tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Guadalupe, una zona comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Pacasmayo y que se encuentra situada en la región de La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y golosinas en una bodega instalada en su domicilio desde hace un año. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos y al público en general todo tipo de productos de consumo diario, siempre brindando una buena atención, con lo cual siempre se garantiza una buena acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo, que es transportista, a sacar adelante a su familia.

Karín desea adquirir más mercadería para poder ampliar su nivel de ventas y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Karín is 32 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and two children in Guadalupe district, a commercial area in Pacasmayo province, in La Libertad region, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Karín has been selling essentials, groceries and candy in a grocery store located in her home for one year.  She offers her neighbors and the general public all kinds of convenience store items, providing them with good customer service, which is why her store is always so popular.  She uses the profits she makes from this activity to help her husband, who is a taxi driver, get their family ahead.

Karín would like to acquire more merchandise so that she can expand her sales and profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more merchandise so that she can expand her sales and profits

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el sector Sialupe Huamantanga del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría aves de corral cerca a su domicilio y las alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estas se desarrollan completamente se encarga de ofrecerlas en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general.

Lucila desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más alimento para mejorar la crianza de sus pavos. Con esta acción ella planea percibir mayores ingresos por la venta de sus animales, sobretodo durante esta temporada en la cual la demanda suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucila, 45, is married living with her family in Sialupe Huamantanga in Lambayeque region, a rural zone located over twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works in farming related activities, especially raising small farm animals for sale.  She raises barnyard fowl in a corral near her house that she feeds on grains and natural grasses.  When they develop completely she sells them to merchants in the area and to the general public.

Lucila wants to expand the business buying more feed to improve turkey raising.  With this action she plans to receive higher income from the sale of her animals, especially during this season when demand tends to increase.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan she plans to use to reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy more feed to improve her turkey raising.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 22 años y reside junto a su familia en el sector Los A. , uno de los anexos que conforman el caserío Punto 9 del distrito de Mochumí, una localidad dedicada principalmente a la agricultura que se encuentra situada en la localidad de Lambayeque, a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo de productos de consumo diario, siempre brindando una buena atención, con lo cual siempre se garantiza una buena acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante a su familia y progresar juntos poco a poco.

Victoria desea adquirir más mercadería para poder ampliar su nivel de venta y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Victoria, 22, lives with her family in Los A. one of the annexes that make up Mochumí district’s Punto 9 settlement, a location dedicated principally to agriculture located in Lambayeque over half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic needs items and groceries in a store installed in her house.  She offers her neighbors all kinds of products that are used daily always with good customer service which guarantees her a good reception.  Income from this activity is used to support the family and to progress together little by little.

Victoria wants to acquire more merchandise to expand her sales and profit level.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Túcume,una zona conocida por su atractivo turístico, ya que cuenta con varias ruinas que datan de tiempos pre – incaicos. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de fotografía y grabación de actividades sociales y especiales. El cuenta con una cámara la cual utiliza para realizar esta actividad en la zona. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para solventar sus gastos y sacar adelante a su familia. El es bastante conocido en la zona y siempre cuenta con una clientela estable, que suele solicitar sus servicios siempre.

Victor Manuel desea adquirir una cámara adicional que le permita brindar mejor servicio y de esa manera recibir mas ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is 33 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in Túcume district.  This is an area that is known for its tourist charm as it has several ruins that date from pre-Incan times.  It is located in Lambayeque province, more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Victor Manuel provides photography services and recording services for social activities and special activities.  He has a camera which he uses in his business.  The profits that he makes cover his expenses and help him to get his family ahead in life.  He is quite well known in the area and has a stable number of customers who always use his services.

Victor Manuel would like to acquire an additional camera that will allow him to provide a better service.  This way, he will be able to make more profits.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy an additional camera which will enable him to provide a better service

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Evelia es una madre D. familia D. 57 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito D. Lambayeque, una zona D. bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a más D. veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización D. productos D. primera necesidad, abarrotes y golosinas en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos y al público en general todo tipo D. productos D. consumo diario, siempre brindando una buena atención, con lo cual siempre se garantiza una buena acogida. Los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante a su familia.

Evelia desea adquirir más mercadería para poder ampliar su nivel D. venta y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Evelia, 57, is a mother living with her husband and children in Lambayeque district, an area with quite a bit of commercial activity located over twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic need items, groceries and snacks in a store installed in her home.  She offers her neighbors and the public in general items of daily consumption always with good customer service that guarantees a warm reception.  Income from this activity is used to support the family.

Evelia wants to get more merchandise to expand her sales and profits so has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan that will help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Keymin Elizabeth

texts.es:
Keymin tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la venta de frutas en un puesto ambulante situado en el mercado de su localidad, ella ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos frescos a buen precio y brindándoles un buen trato, estas prácticas le han valido obtener siempre una buena clientela. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia y solventar sus gastos personales.

Keymin desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más frutas de temporada, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Keymin, 24, is single and lives with her parents in Lambayeque district, an area with regular commercial activity located over twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells fruit from a vending stand in her local market.  She offers various fresh products to her customers at a good price and with good customer service.  These practices have led to her always having a good customer base.  Income from this activity is used to pay for her personal expenses and support her family.

Keymin wants to expand the business acquiring more seasonal fruit so has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that she plans to use to reach her objective.

loans.use: To get more seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Voeur

texts.en: Mr. Voeur U. is a 51-year-old married man who now lives with his wife and the other seven children. Mr. Voeur U. currently sells natural medicines, including medicines made from root trees. He normally goes to forests far from their home to dig the root. He subsequently mixes the medicines and sells them to patients. He has a life partner in his wife who is a groceries seller in front of her house. Currently, Mr. Voeur U. is not comfortable, because his kitchen is getting old and a few parts of it are broken. He wants to repair it, but he is lack some funds to mend it. Therefore, Mr. Voeur U. would like a loan to repair the part of his broken kitchen.

loans.use: To repair the part of his broken kitchen.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de tipeos, copias, escaneados y grabación de CD's en su domicilio. Ella ofrece este servicio a los estudiantes de la zona y al público en general, el público suele preferir su negocio y durante las temporadas escolares cuenta con bastante acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

María desea mejorar su negocio con la compra de más material y brindándole mantenimiento a sus equipos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is 51 years old.  She is married and lives with her family in Olmos district, an agricultural area with a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, one hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

María provides typing, copying, scanning and CD recording services from her home.  She offers this service to the students in her area and to the general public.  The public is usually loyal to her business and, during term time, her business is quite popular.  She uses the profits that she makes from this activity to help her family get ahead financially.

María would like to improve her business, buying more material and having her equipment serviced.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy material and have her equipment serviced

loans.name: Doul

texts.en: Doul P., 44 years old, owns a small shop located along a major road where she sells soft drinks, fast food, sweets for kids and some cooking supplies. She typically makes around $2 per day to support her family. She has been married for many years to Chea Thet, 44, a construction worker, and they have three children, all of whom are single. Doul P. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. Currently, Doul P. wishes to have more funds to buy some soft drinks, fast food and cooking supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, fast food, and some cooking supplies

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 34 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a sus cuatro hijos en una casa de familiares, situada en el sector Callanca del distrito de Monsefú, una zona agrícola situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a trabajar en la venta de verduras en un puesto ambulante situado en el mercado de su localidad, ella ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos frescos a buen precio y brindándoles un buen trato, estas prácticas le han valido obtener siempre una buena clientela. Su mercadería la compra en el mercado Moshoqueque y en el mercado Los Pathos (mercados mayoristas). Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante a sus menores hijos.

María Teresa desea realizar algunas implementaciones previas para instalar una vivienda en un terreno que tiene en la localidad, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Teresa, 34, is separated and lives together with her four children in a house belonging to relatives located in Callanca, Monsefú district, a farming zone located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the last three years she has been selling vegetables from a stand in her local market.  She offers fresh produce at good prices and with good customer service.  These practices have led to her having a regular customer base.  She buys her merchandise at the Moshoqueque and Los Pathos markets (wholesale markets).  Income from this activity helps her support her minor children.

María Teresa wants to do some preliminary work leading up to building a house on a piece of property she has in the location.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that she plans to use to reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem L., age 52, is the widowed mother of four children. Three of her children are single and the other one is married and lives separateL.. Two of her single daughters are on the staff of a private restaurant. 

Kem L. is famous for making delicious desserts. She has been in this business since 2005. Kem L. is looking for a loan of $500. She will use the loan, her income, and her daughter’s salaries to renovate her house so that it is more comfortable.

loans.use: To renovate her house so that it is more comfortable.

loans.name: Vendors Group

texts.en: These members belong to the Star Center loan group. They live in the village of Sebucao in Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur, They engage in many businesses, but their main business is selling foods that children like, such as puto cuchinta, a very sweet dessert made with flour and sugar and topped with coconut. They just need additional capital to purchase ingredients to use in their business.

loans.use: Ingredients for their food business

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: Patricia del Carmen A. D. M. D. 29 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Guadalupe en el departamento D. San Vicente, en donD. vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 10 y 4 años D. edad. Patricia es una madre soltera, muy responsable, quien posee un depósito D. bebidas gaseosas, y jugos enlatados. DesD. hace 2 años que ella trabaja D. esta manera, lo cual le ha traído varios beneficios como trabajar al mismo tiempo que se dedica a su hogar, ya que el negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación. Patricia desea mucho poder darles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, por esta razón solicita n préstamo a través del cual, tenga la capacidad económica D. invertir en el negocio comprando mayor cantidad D. sodas y jugos y D. esta forma atender a más clientes lo cual le permita contar con más ingresos.
texts.en:
Patricia del Carmen A. D. M., 29, lives in Guadalupe, San Vicente department, with her two children who are 10 and 4 years of age.  Patricia is a very responsible single mother who has a soft drink and canned fruit juices warehouse.  For the last two years she has worked like this creating several benefits such as working while tending to her home since the business is located in her home.

Patricia would very much like to proviD. all the best for her children and for this reason is asking for a loan that will give her the economic capacity to invest in the business buying larger amounts of soft drinks and juices so that she can take care of more customers thus leading to higher income.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and juices to sell.

loans.name: Felipe Antonio

texts.es: Felipe Antonio
texts.en: Felipe Antonio

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread

location.town: El Santuario, departamento de San Vicente

loans.name: Claritza Fidelina

texts.es: Claritza Fidelina M. H. de 39 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Con el deseo de poder brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo, Claritza inicio su propio negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, en donde comercializa recargar electrónicas a celulares y así mismo vende perfumes para hombres y mujeres, las que incluso vende de forma ambulante. Claritza solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de perfumes y así mismo un monto mayor de recargas electrónicas, este ultimo negocio es bastante rentable ya que las ganancias son diarias, lo que es muy positivo para ella.
texts.en:
Claritza Fidelina M. H., 39, lives in Ilopango with her husband and two minor children.  With the desire to provide all necessary help to her husband, Claritza started her own home-based business.  She sells cell phone time recharge cards as well as perfumes for men and women which she also sells door-to-door.

Claritza is asking for a loan to have money to buy larger amounts of perfume as well as a larger amount of electronic recharge cards.  This latter business is quite profitable because profits are daily which is very positive for her.

loans.use: To buy cell phone time recharge cards.

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es: Ana Delia G. D. C. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad. La señora Ana, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, cremas para el cuerpo y rostro, negocio con el cual logra percibir ganancias las cuales le proveen D. todo lo necesario para seguir adelante. Cada día Ana ofrece sus productos D. manera ambulante por las calles D. Ilopango, con la esperanza D. poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le beneficien. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar cosméticos y cremas para cuerpo, y rostro, así mismo invertir en nueva mercadería como perfumes para hombre y mujeres. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien debe esforzarse a diario por su sustento y el D. su familia, por lo cual espera mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Delia G. D. C., 42, lives in Ilopango, San Salvador department, with her husband and two minor children.  Ana sells cosmetics, body and face creams, a business that produces profits that proviD. everything necessary to continue forward.

Ana offers her products daily throughout Ilopango’s streets hoping to obtain higher profits which are of benefit to her.

She is asking for a loan through which she can buy cosmetics and body and face creams as well as invest in new products like perfumes for men and women.

Ana is a very hard working woman who must strive daily for her and her family’s support.  She hopes thus to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Zion 1 Group

texts.en:
These five women are some of the 100 members of the  Zion Center, They are all neighbors. Analyn A. and Evangeline S. have a livestock business, and their husbands are working in construction. Lilian E. and Emma Fe M. have a sari store and Mila D. has a food business.
These members have a good record in the center - they paid their previous loan cycle with no problems.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Vilma Gloria Esmeralda

texts.es: Vilma Gloria Esmeralda C. de 50 años de edad, es una madre de familia muy responsable, la cual se esfuerza a diario por darles todo lo mejor a sus hijos. Ella es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad, junto a quienes reside en Armenia en el departamento de Usulután. Vilma posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, así mismo cuenta con un molino, los cuales están en su casa de habitación. Vilma solicita un préstamo a Integral con el gran deseo de poder mejorar su economía familiar, razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda incrementar los productos de la tienda, y así mismo incluir otros nuevos, con los que tenga la capacidad de atender más pedidos por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vilma Gloria Esmeralda C. is 50 years old.  She is a very responsible mother who works hard every day to give all of the best to her children.  She is a single mother, and she has two minor age children.  They live together in Armenia in the Usulután department.

Vilma has a store selling perishable products and basic needs items.  She also has a mill.  Both her store and her mill are in her house.

Vilma is requesting a loan from Integral with the great desire to be able to improve her family finances.  The reason she is requesting a loan is to be able to increase the products in her store.  She will also include new products, which will give her the ability to take care of more orders from her customers.

loans.use: To buy perishable products and to pay for maintenance on the grinder

loans.name: Marina Estela

texts.es: Marina Estela C. de 64 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en donde vive junto a dos hijos mayores de edad quienes se dedican a trabajar. Marina es una mujer muy emprendedora, la cual trabaja muy duro comercializando películas a las afueras de su hogar, así mismo comercializa ropa, cortinas y sabanas, lo que le permite contar con otras fuentes de ingreso para su sostén. Ambos negocios son de mucha importancia para ella, por lo que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en sus ventas, comprando mayor cantidad de artículos para el hogar, así mismo para invertir en más películas, por medio de esto Marina espera mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Marina Estela C., 64, lives in Ahuachapán department with her two adult children who work.   Marina is a very enterprising woman.  She works hard selling movies outside her house.  She also sells clothing, curtains and sheets which allows her to have an additional source of income for her support.  

Both businesses are very important for her so she is asking for a loan to invest in her sales buying larger amounts of items for the home as well as more movies.  Marina hopes to improve her economy this way.

loans.use: To buy curtains, sheets and movies to sell.

loans.name: Griselda Margarita

texts.es: Griselda Margarita M. D. A. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en Perulapía en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Ella vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos D. 9, 7 y 1 año D. edad. Griselda posee una tienda en la cual venD. productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar y para las personas tales como: jabón, shampoo, pan, leche, golosinas, y otros productos más los cuales son básicos en este tipo D. negocios. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos y amigos, ya que tanto Griselda como su esposo son personas muy trabajadoras, las cuales se dedican por completo al bienestar D. su hogar. Griselda solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con todo lo necesario para aumentar su inventario y D. esta manera ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias y poder salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en: Griselda Margarita M. D. A. is 32 years old.  She lives in Perulapía, in Cuscatlán department.  She lives with her husband and three children aged 9, 7 and 1 year old.  Griselda owns a store in which she sells convenience store items such as: soap, shampoo, bread, milk, candy and other products which are basic in this kind of business.  She has very good references from her neighbors and friends since both Griselda and her husband are very hard-working people who are totally committed to the well-being of their household.  Griselda is requesting a loan so that she can stock her business with everything she needs to increase her inventory, offer more products to her customers, improve her profits and thereby get her family ahead.

loans.use: To buy essentials

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza O. D. P. D. 61 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín, mismo lugar en el cual se dedica a su trabajo. Ella vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y un nieto. María se dedica a la venta D. ropa para bebés y niños, la cual comercializa D. forma ambulante, a pesar que su trabajo es muy duro ya que tiene que caminar por mucho tiempo para vender gran parte D. sus productos, ella siempre sale con la mejor disposición D. aumentar sus ventas cada día. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más ropa, en diferentes colores y tallas, y D. esta forma aprovechar las fiestas D. fin D. año, lo cual es la ilusión D. todos los comerciantes, ya que para esta época las ventas suben considerablemente.
texts.en:
María Esperanza O. D. P., 61, lives in San Martín where she also works.  She lives with her husband, two children and a grandson.

María sells infant and children’s clothing.  Despite her work being very hard because she has to walk long distances to sell most of her products, she always sets out with the best disposition to increase sales every day.

María is asking for a loan to buy more clothes in a variety of colors and sizes to take advantage of the end of year festivities, which are every merchant’s dream, because during this time of year sales spike considerably.

loans.use: To buy infant wear.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel G. D. J. D. 64 años D. edad, vive junto a su compañera D. vida en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad. Miguel posee una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, el cual esta ubicado sobre calle principal, así mismo es la única tienda que se encuentra en los alrededores, por lo que cuenta con mucha clientela fija, la cual compra a diario. Esto es D. mucho beneficio para Miguel, ya que el negocio es bastante estable, es por esta razón que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos alimenticios como pan, café, pollo, huevos, ya que en la actualidad con lo que más cuenta es con golosinas y bebidas. Poder mejorar el negocio es D. mucha importancia para Miguel debido a que es la única fuente D. ingresos que posee, razón por la cual él desea mucho mejorarlo para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Miguel Ángel G. D. J. is 64 years old.  He lives together with his life partner in Ciudad Arce, in La Libertad department.  Miguel owns a grocery store that sells essentials.  His store is located on a main street and is the only store in the surrounding area which means that he has a large number of regular customers who buy from him every day.  This is of great benefit to Miguel since his business is quite stable.  He is requesting a loan to buy food products such as bread, coffee, chicken and eggs since at the moment the only products he has are candy and drinks. Being able to improve his business is very important to Miguel because it is his only source of income.  This is why he would very much like to improve it, so that he can make more income.

loans.use: To buy food products and convenience store items

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mónica Vanessa

texts.es: Mónica Vanessa G. G. de 19 años de edad, es una joven muy responsable, y trabajadora, la cual le brinda toda la ayuda posible a su madre para poder salir adelante, ella reside en el municipio de Santa Tecla, en donde vive junto a su madre y dos hermanos menores de edad. Desde hace 3 años que Mónica posee una granja en la cual se dedica a criar pollos, los cuales posteriormente se encarga de vender, desde hace un tiempo atrás que ella le ayuda a su madre, y a tomado las riendas del negocio. Es por esto que con la visión de mejorar sus ingresos, Mónica solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más pollos, así mismo comprar concentrado, vitaminas y antibióticos para el cuidado de ellos. Mónica cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que es una persona muy responsable quien desempeña su trabajo de la mejor manera, brindando un excelente producto.
texts.en:
Mónica Vanessa G. G. is 19 years old.  She is a very responsible and hard-working young woman who provides all the help she can to her mother so that she can get ahead.  She lives in the town of Santa Tecla together with her mother and two siblings who are still dependent.

For three years Monica has owned a farm where she raises chicks which she then sells.  She had been helping her mother in this business for some time and she has now taken over running the business.  With a view to improving her income, Mónica is requesting a loan that will give the money she needs to buy more chicks, as well as concentrate, vitamins and antibiotics to care for them.  Mónica has many customers since she is a very responsible person who does her work very well, providing an excellent product.

loans.use: To buy chicks to fatten and to buy feed for them

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Tara

texts.en: This is 22-year-old Tara B.. She is married and has two children, aged 4 and 1. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm. In the future, Tara plans to raise the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. Over 70 percent of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI (microfinance institution), Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates by joining the BPW Kiva lending team.

loans.use: To buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Indira

texts.en: This is 25-year-old Indira T.. She is married and has one child, aged 7. In 2005, she established her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to buy a young, milk-giving cow. In the future, Indira plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI (microfinance institution), Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates by joining the BPW Kiva lending team.

loans.use: To buy a young, milk-giving cow

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Parbati L.. She is married and has two children, aged 14 and 12. In 2004, she established her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent to buy a young, milk-giving cow. In the future, Parbati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI (microfinance institution), Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates by joining the BPW Kiva lending team.

loans.use: To buy a young, milk-giving cow

loans.name: Ziyafat

texts.ru:
Ziyafat G. 24 qoda. Ona ne zamujem i jivet v Absehron regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Ziyafat uje 2 qoda kak okrila kafe , etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyeqo otca kotoriy pomoq yey otkrit eto kafe.

No seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi sdelat remont v svayom kafe i uvelichit yeqo dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Ziyafat G. is 24 years old.  She is married and lives in the Absheron region together with her parents.  Ziyafat has opened a cafe two years ago and has learned this business from her father who helped her open the cafe. 

At this time she needs 2000 AZN to do some repairs and expand the cafe and her business.

loans.use: To do repairs and expansion of the cafe

loans.name: Krishna Maiya

texts.en: This is 55-year-old Krishna Maiya D.. She is married and has two children, ages 35 and 30. In 2004, she established her grocery store. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her shop. In the future, Krishna Maiya plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan is administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Sarvinaz

texts.ru:
Sarvinaz H. 58 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey kotoriye uchatsya v universitete. Ona yavlyayestay IDP personom , pereselenec iz Zengilan i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy.

Servinaz seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya toqo chtobi pomestit bolshe novix tovarov. Ona uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov.
texts.en:
Sarvinaz H. is 58 years old. She is married and has three children who go to the university.  She is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from Zengilan and now lives in the Absheron region together with her family.  

Sarvinaz needs 2000 AZN to expand the space of her store to house more new merchandise.  She has been in the business of selling groceries for seven years.

loans.use: To expand the store space

loans.name: Shova

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Shova L.. She is married and has one child, age 5. In 2005, she established her tea shop. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Shova plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. This loan is administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her tea shop

loans.name: Gunel

texts.ru:
Gunel R. 24 qoda. Ona ne zamujem. Gunel yavlyayetsya IDP personom i ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjara seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Gunel uje pochti dva qoda rabotayet uchitelniccey. Ona seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kompyuter dlya toqo chtobi uchit detey.
texts.en:
Gunel R. is 24 years old. She in not married. Gunel is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from Kalbadjar and now lives in the Absheron region together with her family. 

Gunel has been working as a teacher for almost two years. She now needs 2000 AZN to buy a computer to help her teach children at school.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina R. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old. Victorina is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies like shakoy (or "butsi" - fried dough sprinkled with sugar) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Victorina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
The man shown in the picture is Mr. Sam S., 46, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches around eight kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market.

His wife’s name is Pech Rath; she is 40 years old and works with him in the fishing business. This couple is blessed with nine children and all of them are single.

Mr. Sam S. will use his loan to purchase nets, traps and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mut K., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kompong Tom Province. 

To earn a living, Mut K. sells different types of Khmer cake in her house. Besides this business, Mut K. and her husband are rice traders. They  buy rice in bulk at a reasonable price to mill, and they sell their finished rice to people for income. 

Mut K. thinks that is time to look for extra revenue, which she proposes to do by buying a larger quantity of rice to sell to retailers in the market. But she complains that she doesn’t have a big vehicle to transport more rice. To achieve her goal, Mut K. has decided to seek a loan to purchase a trailer to connect to her motorbike so that she can use it to pick up more rice.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to connect to her motorbike so that she can use it to pick up more rice

She is currently growing a rice crop and a vegetable crop that she planted more than two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizer to get  her crop growing well.

texts.en:

Her vending kiosk is located right next to the market entrance, which has always been a busy spot crowded with potential customers. Silviya has been working as a private entrepreneur for seven years. Presently, she has about 75,000 UAH in inventory. Her income amounts to 6,000 UAH.
Silviya realizes the benefit her business has gained from available lending assistance. She is requesting a 12,000 UAH loan to increase her turnover capital and, as a result, her sales. Silviya realizes there are always needs to be met, especially if you have a family. She is willing to work hard to ensure a decent living for her family. One of her business goals is to open an additional vending location and continue developing her trade in the future.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is single. He lives in Kamenka. Sergey grows early spring tomatoes. He owns eight greenhouses and a separate one for seedlings. 

Sergey plants and grows 8,500 tall-grown tomatoes every year. He has been in agriculture for 10 years. Currently, Sergey has already invested 150,000 Grivnyas in this business. His annual expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 40,000 Grivnyas.  

Sergey is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to construct two more greenhouses on recently-purchased land. He is hoping to plant more tomatoes in additional greenhouses. Profit generated will be invested in further improvement of conditions in his greenhouses. Sergey is planning to install heating units in all of his greenhouses in the next year.

loans.use: To construct two greenhouses.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with a teenage son. Yuryi is a retail vendor. He sells electrical appliances in his hometown of Beregovo, Western Ukraine. 

Yuryi first tried his luck with his startup six years ago. Presently, he has already invested 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Yuryi is seeking a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to purchase newer equipment and restock his merchandise with good-quality modernized electric tools. Additional inventory items will help him attract more potential customers and thus expand his business as a result.

loans.use: To purchase new electrical equipment for resale.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo, where she sells toys in the central market. Oksana’s vending facility is located right in the center of the marketplace which is always busy with potential customers. Oksana launched this small enterprise three years ago. Currently, she has 35,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her income amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Oksana is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital. She wants to purchase a variety of children’s toys and games to restock her merchandise this holiday season and boost her sales as a result of increased customer demand before Christmas and New Year’s. Eventually Oksana is hoping to open one more vending facility in the same market and further develop her business.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital by purchasing a variety of children's toys and games.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora, con un pequeño negocio desde hace más de veinte años una pulpería que inicio con fondos propios y luego con financiamiento de la institución, en donde ha invertido en más productos de consumo, una variedad de cosméticos lo que ha logrado más demanda de clientes.
Con este nuevo crédito comprara productos de cosméticos, golosinas, granos básicos y frutas para hacer refrescos y vender, ya que la idea es invertir más para lograr mejores utilidades, y poder cubrir sus necesidades personales. Y que gracias Afodenic hace posible la mejora para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman.  She has been running a small general store for more than twenty years.  She started her business with her own funds and with financing from the institution.  She invested in more consumer products and a variety of cosmetics for which she has the highest customer demand.  

With this new loan she will buy cosmetics, candy, basic grains and fruits with which to make refreshments to sell.  She wants to invest more in her business in order to increase her profits and be able to cover her personal expenses.  Thanks to Afodenic for making it possible to better her future.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, candy, cosmetics and fruit to make refreshments to sell.

loans.name: Danny Tawil

texts.es: Solicitante, tiene 28 años, es soltera, vive en casa familiar,  se dedica al negocio hace mas de 4 años, señor tiene la meta de tener negocio propio, y cumplir con sus sueños y objetivos, solicita credito para capital de trabajo ya que piensa invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Borrower is 28 years old, single, living in the family house.  Has been in business for over four years and the goal is to have his own business and reach his dreams and objectives.

He’s asking for funds to use as working capital since he plans to invest in the business.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Digna

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Digna C. C. tiene 63 años de edad, ya no tiene nadie que dependa de ella.
Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, a tenido experiencias buenas y malas con su negocio.
ahorita se quedo descapitalizada por vender al credito, ya que no le pagaron y decidio no dar mas creditos solo a los clientes que son de su confianza.
el credito lo utilzara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
doña Maria es una mujer muy humilde pero muy luchadora.
tambien se dedica por las tardes a vender golosinas.
 
su mayor sueño es que sus hijos esten bien y que tenga salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Digna C. C., 63, doesn’t have any dependents anymore.  She sells groceries in a small grocery store she has installed in her house.  She has had both good and bad experiences with her business.

Right now she has been left decapitalized for selling on credit because she was not paid.  She has decided not to sell on credit any more; only to customers who are trustworthy.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise to stock the store.

María is a very humble but very tenacious woman.  In the afternoons she also sells snacks.

Her greatest dream is that her children be well and that she remains healthy to continue working.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, lard, oil, margarine, soups, noodles, sauces, soft drinks, salt, condiment, wheat and corn flour.

loans.name: Greysi

texts.es:
la joven Greisy R. T. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, Greysi se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia y tambien vende golosinas los fines de semanas (sabados y domingos) vende tacos y enchiladas.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
 
su mayor sueño es que su familia este unida para esta epoca de navidad.
texts.en:
Greisy R. T. is 23 years old.  She lives with her common-law partner and has a 7-year-old son.  Greysi sells groceries at her store as well as sweets.  On the weekends (Saturdays and Sundays), she sells tacos and enchiladas.  

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  

Her greatest dream is that her family be together this Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, beans, bread, cookies, coffee, lard, soft drinks, oil, margarine, churros, soups, pastas, batteries, candles, matches, corn and wheat flour, chicken, juices, sardines

loans.name: Adriana Victoria

texts.es:
Adriana de oficio ebanista, madre soltera de dos hijos,  es  una mujer emprendedora que trabaja mucho para lograr dar a su familia un porvenir mejor.
Trabaja en su casa de habitación haciendo muebles, oficio que aprendió en un taller y que ha sido la solución para tener ingresos, y cuidar de sus hijos. Comenzó con poco dinero lo que necesitaba inversión para darse a conocer  con su trabajo, lo que recurre al crédito en donde Afodenic da su primer financiamiento comprando madera y herramientas.
Logrando mejores resultados de ventas. Con este nuevo préstamo será con el objetivo de invertir en madera, esponjas, pega y otros para seguir con sus ventas. Logrando tener más producción.
texts.en:
Adriana is a furniture maker. She is a single mother of two children and an enterprising woman who works hard to be able to give her family a better future. 

She works in her house making furniture, a trade she learned in a workshop and which has enabled her to earn an income and take care of her children. She started with a little money that she needed to get to know her work. She has turned to getting a loan at Afodenic for her first financing to buy wood and tools.  

She hopes to achieve better sales. With this new loan, her objective is to invest in wood, sponges, glue and more to continue with her sales and have more production.

loans.use: She will buy wood, sponges and glue to make more furniture and have better sales.

loans.name: El Cubulero Group

texts.es:
las integrantes del grupo el cubulero son mujeres muy trabajadoras y se conocen muy bien, son vecinas desde hace muchos años. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
 
la señora Evelyn Elizeth J. B. se dedica a la venta de golosinas, tiene muchos clientes, en su negocio fabrica golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, catrachas, burras, baleadas, carne con chismol.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las golosinas.
sus deseos es que en esta navidad reine la paz en todos los hogares del mundo.

   La señora Maria Rosalia B. G. se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en los sectores foraneos de la aldea el cubulero.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva, tiene muchos pedidos por ser la epoca de navidad.

  La señora Maria de Jesus A. se dedica a la venta de pescado blanco, pescado rojo y camaron.el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mariscos y materiales para la fabricacion de una ataraya para pezca.

todas ellas son mujeres con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the El Cubulero group are very hardworking women who know each other very well and have been neighbors for many years.  The different activities they engage in are described below.

Evelyn Elizeth J. B. sells snacks and has many customers.  She makes snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese, catrachas (fried tortillas with fried beans and cheese), burras, baleadas, and meat with chismol (Honduran salsa).

She will use the loan to buy supplies to make the snacks.  Her wish is that peace reign in all homes throughout the world this Christmas.

Maria Rosalia B. G. sells new clothing in the outskirts of the town of El Cubulero.  She will use the loan to buy new clothing.  She has many orders, since it's the Christmas season.

Maria de Jesus A. sells whitefish, redfish, and shrimp.  She will use the loan to purchase seafood and to buy materials to make a fishnet.

They are all women with a great desire to move forward.

loans.use: Purchase of beef, pork, and chicken, corn, oil, lard, soft drinks, fish, new clothing, materials for making fishnets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yanari Patricia

texts.es:
la señora Yanari Patricia S. tiene 28 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Miguel Angel Aguilar.
Yanari se a dedicado desde que su abuelo fallecio a la fabricacion de ladrillos y tejas, trabaja de lunes a sabado y tiene dos operarios que le fabrican tres mil ladrillos a la semana con un un costo por ladrillo de dos lempiras y la venta es de tres lempiras por unidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para fabricar los ladrillos.
desea tener una produccion mayor para enero ya que es la epoca en donde se empiezan mas construciones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yanari Patricia S. is 28 years old. She is in a common law marriage with Mr. Miguel Angel Aguilar.

Since her grandfather died, Yanari has worked in the manufacture of bricks and tiles. She works Monday through Saturday and she has two workers who make three thousand bricks every week. The cost of each brick is two  lempiras and they sell for lempiras a unit.  She will use the loan to buy materials to manufacture the bricks. She wishes to have more production by January since that is the time of year when more construction begins.

loans.use: To buy soil, clay and firewood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Yaquelin

texts.es:
la señora Maria Yaquelin P. tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y es madre de 4 hijos.
recibe ayuda monetaria del papa de sus hijos que se encuentra en los estados unidos.
Maria se dedica a vender golosinas, antes las vendia ambulantemente pero ahora ya tiene un local en donde atiende a sus clientes, su negocio esta ubicado en la aldea corinto por la salinera, ahí vende a los trabajadores de dicha salinera.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos, verduras, carnes, maiz, leña.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Yaquelin P. is 28 years old.  She is single and has four children.  She receives financial help from the children's father who is in the United States.

Maria sells snacks.  She used to sell these as an itinerant street vendor but she now has premises where she serves her customers.  Her business is in the village of Corinto, at the local saltworks.  She sells to the workers at the saltworks.

Maria will use her loan to buy soft drinks, vegetables, meat, corn and firewood.  She needs the profits from her business to get ahead with her children.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes, onion, chilis, lemons, salt, beef, pork, chicken, firewood and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dilcia Marilu

texts.es:
la señora Dilcia Marilu F. M. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Exan Joel Suazo Cruz quien labora como guardia de seguridad. tienen 2 hijos.
Dilcia se dedica a la venta de golosinas, anteriormente trabajo en una empacadora de camaron y hace un año decidio poner su negocio propio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de sus golosinas.
Dilcia es una mujer  muy humilde y trabajdora y su deseo es que su negocio crezca y le genere buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Dilcia Marilu F. M. is 31 years old. She lives with her partner, Exan Joel Suazo Cruz who works as a security guard. They have two children. Dilcia is dedicated to selling confections. Previously, she worked in a shrimp packing factory and a year ago she decided to start her own business. The loan will be used to purchase materials to make her confections. Dilcia is a humble and hard-working woman and her wish is that her business grows and generates good earnings.

loans.use: Purchase pork, beef, chicken, firewood, refreshments, green bananas, butter, oil and condiments.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jacqueline es madre de tres hijos, casada con oficio de costura por más de catorce años apoyando a su familia, su esposo labora como mecánico y soldador siendo muy responsable.
También los fines de semana hacen sopa y nacatamales para ayudarse con más entradas de ingreso, logrando cumplir con sus compromisos de pago.  Contenta en donde Afodenic ha sido una puerta al cambio de mejora en su inversión de venta de ropa. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara tela, bordados, hilos, para su costura a si como materia prima para elaborar mas comida los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Jacqueline has three children.  She is married and works as a dressmaker.  She has been in this business for more than fourteen years, supporting her family.  Her husband works as a mechanic and a welder.  He is very responsible

On weekends, Jacqueline also makes soup and 'nactamales' (Nicaraguan tamales - steamed corn dumplings with a savory filling, wrapped in a plantain leaf) to help make more income.  This way she manages to fulfil her payment commitments.  Jacqueline is happy as Afodenic has been a door to change and improvement, allowing her to invest in her clothes sales business.
