She will use this new loan to buy fabric, embroideries and threads for her sewing as well as supplies so that she can make more food to sell  at weekends.

loans.use: To buy fabric, embroidered items and threads.  To buy supplies for making food to sell at weekends

loans.name: Patricia Elizabeth

texts.es: LA SEÑORA PATRICIA ELIZABETH R. U. SE DEDICA ACTUALEMENTE A LAS VENTAS DE ARTICULOS PARA FIESTAS INFANTILES EN EL MERCADO AYLLU, ANTERIORMENTE SE DEDICABA A LA VENTA DE ROPA PARA DAMAS Y CABALLEROS EN SU CASA, GRACIAS A ELLO PUDO AHORRAR Y ALQULAR UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO PARA INICIAR SU NEGOCIO, ELLA TIENE UN HIJO DE 1 AÑO DE EDAD Y ES MADRE SOLTERA, GRACIAS AL ESFUERZO QUE PONE DIA A DIA ESTA SACANDO SU FAMILA ADELANTE, NECESITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA SU PIÑATERIA.
texts.en:
Patricia Elizabeth R. U. sells children’s party supplies in Ayllu Market.  She used to sell women’s and men’s clothing at home.  Thanks to that she was able to save up enough to rent a stand in the market to start her business.

She has a one year old son and is a single mother.  Thanks to her daily effort she is managing to move her family ahead.  She needs the loan to buy piñata making merchandise.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her piñata shop.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two grown children. She sells bed linens and sheets as well as blankets in the central marketplace of her hometown of Novomoskovsk. Yelena owns a big vending facility in this market, which is located in a busy spot where hundreds of potential customers pass by every day. She has been in this business for three years. Currently, she has 35,000 grivnyas worth of inventory. Her profit amounts to 4,000 grivnyas.

Yelena is requesting a loan of 7,500 grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise she offers for sale. She believes financial assistance will help her grow her business and generate additional income as a result. Yelena's grandson has leukemia and needs expensive medication. Yelena invests a portion of her profit in treatment of her little grandson. She is a great optimist and tries to look on the bright side of life.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika sells bed sheets at Beregovo market. She is married with two children. Monika has been in her business for five years. Her monthly income is about 5,500 hryvnia (UAH), and her working capital is 15,000 UAH. She likes her business because it does not change with the seasons. People are always purchasing bed sheets, most often as a gift. Monika would like to increase her assortment to attract more clients. She is requesting a loan of 6,500 UAH. Monika would like to develop her business further so that she can increase her income and take better care of her family.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Luba

texts.en: Luba, a widow with two children, sells women's clothing, her only source of income, in a small store in Korolyovo town, Western Ukraine. In business for five years, her net profit is 6,000 Grivnas per month. Luba, who lives with her daughter in the house she owns, would like to borrow 14,000 Grivnas to increase her clothing assortment. She hopes to generate additional income to support her household needs.

loans.use: To increase her clothing assortment

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ana ella tiene 54 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad, con ella vive un nieto de 11 años de edad el mismo que está en primer año de colegio.

Se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de carcasas y accesorios de teléfonos celulares, a esta labor se dedica todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 13h00 ya que a esas hora tiene que darle de comer a su nieto, en las tardes se dedica a lavar ropa ajena para ganar algo extra de dinero ya que según nos dice la vida está muy difícil y solo con trabajo va a salir adelante. Sus `productos los va a comprar en Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar carcasas y accesorios para teléfono. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a través de los créditos. Sus sueños son tener su casa de cemento, ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas, and for its happy people.

This is where we find 54 year old Ana.  She is separated, but she had three children from this relationship.  All of the children are adults.  She lives with an 11 year old grandson, who is in his first year of middle school.

She sells cases and accessories for cell phones.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m., which is the time she has to feed her grandson.  In the afternoons she washes other people’s clothes in order to get some extra money.  According to what she tells us, life is very difficult – it is only through work that you will get ahead.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her products.

This loan is to buy telephone cases and accessories.  She has been in the communal bank for ten years.  She likes it for the help that she gets through the loans.  Her dream is to have her house made of cement because the one she has is made from cane.

loans.use: To buy telephone cases and accessories

loans.name: Margarita Agustina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Margarita tiene 70 años de edad, hace varios años quedo viuda pero de esa relación tuvo nueve hijos ya todos son mayores de edad pero seis de ellos aun viven con  ella.

Ella junto a uno de sus hijos  se dedica a la venta de verduras, legumbres y frutas en el mercado de Tarqui en  Manta. Trabaja  los tres últimos días de la semana desde las 04h00 hasta las 15h00 o hasta que haya terminado lo que llevo a vender. En la actualidad piensa poner un negocio de venta de juguetes para aprovechar la temporada navideña ya que la mayoría de las personas compran estos artículos para sus hijos.
  
Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas, legumbres y juguetes para aprovechar la temporada. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 16 ciclos. Su sueño es tener una gran tienda en su casa para no tener que viajar más y que le vaya bien en sus nuevas ventas.
texts.en:
The communal bank, 3 de Mayo, meets every 2 weeks in the Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a well-known commercial area that is also famous for its traditional fiestas of San Pedro, San Pablo, and for the warmth of its people.

Margarita is 70 and a few years ago she was widowed.  She has nine children, all adults, but six still live with her.

She and one of her children sell vegetables, legumes and fruit in the Tarqui en Manta market the last three days of the week from 4 am until 3 pm, or until they have sold everything they brought.  Now she would like to set up a business to take advantage of the Xmas season selling toys since most people buy them for their children.

She will use this new loan to buy fruit, legumes and toys for the season.  She has been with this communal bank for 16 cycles.  Her dream is to have a big store in her house so that she doesn’t have to travel any more and that things would go well with her new sales.

loans.use: To buy fruit, legumes and toys

loans.name: Aidé Esperanza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Aidé esta en el Banco comunal  hace 10 años y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 13, 12,  9 y 4 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio Y los menores en escuela y jardín de infantes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de sus esposo el cual  se dedica al comercio, vende  controles remotos de televisores y otros artefactos eléctricos, carcasas y accesorios de teléfonos celulares, a esta labor se dedica todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00. El recorre las calles de la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, esta labor la viene realizando hace como 6 años en los que ha tenido momentos buenos y malos, pero que sabe llevar con duro trabajo. Sus productos los va a comprar en Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar controles,  carcasas y accesorios para teléfono. Sus sueños son tener su casa de cemento ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The community bank 3 de Mayo [May 3], meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, an area known for its shopping area, the traditional feasts of Saint Peter and Saint Paul, and the happiness of its people.

Aidé has been a member of the community bank for 10 years, and she likes the benefits it provides and that it makes it easy to apply for loans.  She is 33 years old, married, and has four children, who are 4, 9, 12, and 13 years old.  The two oldest are in high school and the younger ones are in primary school and pre-school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife who is applying for this loan for her husband's business, which sells TV remotes, other electronics, cell phone casings, and other cell phone accessories.  He works at this business from 8:00am until 6:00pm.  He travels through the city streets offering his products.  He has been doing this work for six years, and he has had good and bad moments, but he knows how to work hard.  He goes to Guayaquil to purchase his products.

This loan will be used to purchase TV remotes, cell phone casings, and phone accessories.  Their dream is to have a cement house since the one they have now is made of cane.

loans.use: Purchase cell phone casings, cell phone accessories, and TV remotes

loans.name: Ligia Aracely

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Para la señora Ligia este es su séptimo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta ya que los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio. Tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene  5 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero dos de ellos aún viven con ella en su casa. Su marido es comerciante.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior y  camisetas deportivas, ella junto con su esposo atienden su local que tienen en su propia casa, trabajan desde las 8am hasta las 6pm, venden al por mayor a comerciantes de la zona a los cuales les dejan a crédito y a buen precio. La mercadería la adquieren en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viajan una vez al mes y en otros casos solo hacen los pedidos y se los envían, en esta época están vendiendo también juguetes y adornos navideños.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar ropa interior, adornos navideños y juguetes. Sus metas son tener buena salud y comprar un buen carro.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas, and for its happy people.

This is Ligia’s seventh cycle in the communal bank.  She is very happy because the loans have helped her a lot in her business.  She is 55 years old, married, and has five children.  The children are now adults, but two of them still live with her in her house.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a business selling underwear and sport shirts.  She and her husband take care of the business, which is in their own house.  They work from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  They sell wholesale to merchants in the area.  They sell on credit and give a good price.  They get their merchandise in Guayaquil city, where they travel once a month.  On other occasions they only make orders and have them sent.  

During this season they are also selling Christmas decorations and toys.  She will use this new loan to buy underwear, Christmas decorations, and toys.

 Her goals are to have good health and to buy a good car.

loans.use: To buy underwear, Christmas decorations, and toys

loans.name: Gladys De Lourdes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Gladys, ella tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene  dos hijas las mismas que ya son mayores de edad pero que aún viven en su casa y estudian en la Universidad. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen un local en el centro de Picoaza en el cual venden comida rápida como: hamburguesas, hot dog, sanduches, gaseosas, batidos de frutas entre otros, trabajan de martes a domingo desde las 19h00 hasta las 02h00. Nos cuenta que llevan en este negocio por 20 años y que empezaron con algo pequeño y que con el tiempo han ido incrementando poco a poco, nos cuentan que los créditos le han servido de mucho en su crecimiento.

Este crédito lo van a emplear en comprar ingredientes en la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva 8 años en el Banco Comunal y ocupa el cargo de fiscal de reglamentos el cual lo cumple con mucha responsabilidad. Sus sueños es tener un negocio mucho más grande.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo (May Third) Community Bank meets every other week in the Picoaza church in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known to be a very commercial zone, also known for its traditional celebrations for Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the happiness of its people.

It is in this place we find Mrs. Gladys, who is 48 years old and married with two daughters who are now grown but still live at home and study at the University. Her husband is a salesman. She and her husband have a shop downtown in Picoaza where they sell fast food such as hamburgers, hot dogs, sandwiches, sodas, and smoothies, and other items. They work from Tuesday until Sunday from 7:00 pm until 2:00 am. She shares that they have had this business for 20 years and that it started out small but that, with time, it has grown little by little. She tells us that the loans have really helped their business grow.

This loan will be used to buy ingredients to prepare the food. She has been with the Community Bank for 8 years and as its treasurer, shows a lot of responsibility. She dreams of having a much bigger business.

loans.use: To buy groceries like bread, meat, sausages, tomatoes, fruits, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, ella tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene  cuatro hijos, dos de ellos  ya son mayores de edad pero  aún viven en su casa y estudian en la Universidad, los menores están en colegio. Su marido es chofer.

Además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo de nombre “La Economía” vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes,  etc. también vende productos naturales y joyas Lanel. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos, productos naturales, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo y se divierte en las reuniones. Sus metas son viajar a otros países.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo (May Third) Community Bank meets every other week in the Picoaza church in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known to be a very commercial zone, also known for its traditional celebrations for Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the happiness of its people.

In this place we find Mrs. María. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom who are now grown but live at home and study at the University, and the younger two are in high school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

In addition to being a great housewife, she also works in business at her grocery store called La Economía, where she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc. She also sells natural products and Lanel jewelry. She works every day from 6:00 am until 6:00 pm and sometimes later. Her children and her husband help her with her work. She buys the products downtown in Portoviejo and the majority of them are delivered to her store.

She will use this loan to stock her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausage, natural products, and other basic supplies. She has been in the community bank for five years and she likes it because she has made friends in the group and she has fun at the meetings. Her goal is to travel to other countries.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, natural products, and other basic supplies.

loans.name: Doralisa Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Doralisa, tiene 33  años de edad, hace algunos años tuvo una relación de la cual tuvo tres hijos de 15, 11 y 6 años, en la actualidad   mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 1 años, sus hijos estudian unos en escuela y otro en colegio. El marido es comerciante.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  también  se desplaza a otros cantones donde tiene clientes a los que les deja sus productos. Trabaja todos los días en las  tardes y noches y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  se la traen de  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, y ropa de niños. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos en relación a otros Bancos. Sus sueños son que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The 22 de Julio (July 22nd) Community Bank meets every other week in the Picoaza church in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known to be a very commercial zone, also known for its traditional celebrations for Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the happiness of its people.

In this place we find Mrs. Doralisa. She is 33 years old, and has three children from a previous relationship who are 15, 11, and 6 years old. She currently is involved in a relationship and she and her partner have two children who are 4 and 1 year old. Her children study at the school and one is in high school. Her partner is a salesman.

She works selling clothing. Part of her sales are door to door, and she also travels to other places where she sells to other customers. She works every day in the afternoon and night and on the weekends, she works all day. Her customers buy on credit and pay every other week. She brings her merchandise from Guayaquil every other week or every month according to her needs.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in the community bank for three years and she likes it because the interest rates are low when compared to other banks. She dreams that her children will never be in need.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Consuelo Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Consuelo es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 10 años  de edad, los mismos que  estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño local en la calle Chile, que es una calle donde muchos comerciantes venden sus productos en la ciudad, en el vende ropa interior de caballeros, trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Sus productos los compra en Picoaza en una distribuidora que le venden a buen precio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar camisetas e interiores de caballeros. Sus sueños son tener un gran bazar con mucha mercadería.
texts.en:
The 22 de Julio (July 22nd) Community Bank meets every other week in the Picoaza church in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known to be a very commercial zone, also known for its traditional celebrations for Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the happiness of its people.

Mrs. Consuelo was a founding member of the community bank and she likes it for the additional benefits it provides and for the ease of the loan process. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are 18, 15, and 10 years old. Her children study at the University, high school, and primary school. Her husband is a salesman.

She works in sales. She has a small store on Chile Street, where many salespeople sell their products in the city. She sells men's underwear and works from 8:00 am unitl 5:00 pm. She buys her products in Picoaza from a distributor who sells them to her for a good price.

This loan is to buy t-shirts and men's underwear. She dreams of having a big store with a lot of merchandise.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts and men's underwear

loans.name: Betty Robertina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Encontramos a la señora Betty, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos todos ya son mayores de edad, tres  de sus hijos viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante. Está casi desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en las reuniones aprende mucho.

Tienen un negocio familiar en el que venden repuestos de carros, aceites, liquido de frenos, entre otros, trabajan todos los días, de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y los sábados y domingos hasta las 13h00. Los repuestos y productos los compran en Guayaquil y Manta. Sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar repuestos, líquidos de frenos, etc. sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que donde tienen el negocio es arrendado.
texts.en:
The 22 de Julio (July 22nd) Community Bank meets every other week in the Picoaza church in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known to be a very commercial zone, also known for its traditional celebrations for Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the happiness of its people.

Here we find Mrs. Betty. She is 58 years old, married, and has four grown children, three of whom still live with her. Her husband is a salesman. She has been with the community bank almost since it began and enjoys it because she learns a lot at the meetings.

They have a family business where they sell car parts, oil, brake fluid, and other things. They work every day, from Monday to Friday from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm and on Saturdays and Sundays until 1:00 pm. They buy the parts and products in Guayaquil and Manta. Her children help with the business.

This loan is to buy car parts, brake fluid, etc. She dreams of having their own place of business as they currently rent.

loans.use: To buy car parts, brake fluid, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, tiene 58 años de edad, está separada, pero de  una relación que tuvo tiene 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, una hija vive en su casa con el esposo y dos hijos pequeños que son la alegría de nuestra socia.  Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta porque  le han brindado mucha ayuda con los créditos.
 
Tiene un negocio de venta de billetes de lotería el cual lo realiza por las calles de la ciudad de Manta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 18h00. Lleva en esta actividad más de 30 años y dice que le gusta lo que hace ya que con esto pudo sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar al contado sus billetes de lotería ya que así le salen a mejor precio y le quedan mejores ganancias. Sus sueños son llegar a tener un local en el cual poder vender sus billetes de lotería.
texts.en:
The July 22nd Community Bank meets every two weeks in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. It is an area well known for its commerce, for its traditional festivals of St. Pedro and St. Pablo, and for its happy people.

58-year old Señora Rosa lives here. She is separated from her husband but has six children by him. All of them are adults. One daughter lives in her house with her husband and two children who bring Rosa a great deal of joy. She has been with the community bank for three years, and she really likes the bank as it has provided much help with loans.

Rosa runs a business selling lottery tickets in the streets of the town of Manta. She works every day from 9am to 6pm and has been doing this for more than thirty years. She likes the work as it has allowed her to to help her children get ahead. 

Rosa needs this loan to buy lottery tickets with cash and thus get the best price. This in turn generates the most profit. Her dream is to have a permanent location from which to sell tickets

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets

loans.name: Nancy Amparo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Encontramos a la señora Nancy, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años el mismo que estudia en colegio. Su marido esta en el extranjero trabajando.

Se dedica a la venta productos de Avon, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja cuatro días en la semana desde las 8h30 hasta las 12h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido,  cobra semanalmente y dice que le encanta vender. Los productos que mas vende son los perfumes y los maquillajes.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos Avon, perfumes, cremas, maquillajes, entre otros. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro años  y le gusta porque los créditos salen rápido sin tantos trámites. Sus sueños son tener un local donde poner un  negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The July 22nd Community Bank meets every two weeks in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. It is an area well known for its commerce, for its traditional festivals of St. Pedro and St. Pablo, and for its happy people.

32-year old Nancy lives here. She is married and has a 12-year old son who goes to high school. Her husband works overseas.

Nancy sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories). She works four days a week, from 8:30 am to noon. She says that she loves selling things. The best-selling items are perfume and make-up.

The loan will be used to buy more Avon products such as perfume, lotions, and make-up. Nancy has been with the community bank for four years and likes the speed with which the loans are made and the lack of paperwork. Her dream is to have a permanent place where she can open a business selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotions, make-up etc

loans.name: Carmen Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 9 y 3 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
El crédito lo realiza para el negocio del esposo el cual es un vendedor ambulante, vende artículos para el hogar (planchas, ventiladores, licuadoras, tostadoras, ollas, platos, entre otros artículos). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 8pm. Dice que es cansado pero que tiene que hacerlo para ganarse el sustento diario. La mercadería la compra en Portoviejo donde le dan precio para comerciante.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para que su esposo compre planchas, ollas, licuadoras, entre otros artículos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace seis ciclos y está muy agradecida ya que así ella puede ayudar a su esposo a través de los créditos otorgados por la institución. Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The 22 De Julio communal bank meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for being a highly commercial zone, for its traditional celebrations of Saint Pedro and Saint Pablo, and for the joyfulness of its people.

This is where we find Ms. Carmen, who is 33 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage, through which she has had three children, ages 11, 9, and 3 years old, all of whom are in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is taking out this loan to support her husband's business.  He is an itinerant vendor who sells home products (irons, fans, blenders, toasters, pans, plates, and other items).  He works every day from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m.  She says that he is very tired but has to do this in order to meet their daily needs.  He buys the merchandise in Portoviejo, where he is offered the price for merchants.

Carmen will use this loan so that her husband can buy irons, pans, blenders, and other items.  She has been in the communal bank for six cycles and is very grateful for the opportunity because she is able to help her husband through the loans offered by the institution.  Her dream is to have a commercial storefront.

loans.use: to buy irons, pans, blenders, toasters, etc.

loans.name: Mayita Marianela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Mayita, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 21, 19, 15 y 3 años los mismos que estudian en universidad y colegio. El marido es comerciante.
 
Este crédito es para el negocio de su esposo,  él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres por toda la ciudad y también se desplaza hasta sitios alejados de la ciudad,  él todas las madrugadas se dirige en su motocicleta hasta el mercado de la ciudad a comprar los productos a mayoristas para luego salir a recorrer las calles y sitios con sus productos, nos cuenta la socia que su esposo trabaja duro todos los días para que a ellos no les falte nada.

Este crédito que solicito la socia es para ayudar a su esposo con el negocio, va a comprar frutas y legumbres. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 ciclos y le gusta porque así pude contribuir de alguna forma  con los gastos de su familia. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The 22 De Julio communal bank meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for being a highly commercial zone, for its traditional celebrations of Saint Pedro and Saint Pablo, and for the joyfulness of its people.

This is where we find Ms. Mayita, who is 38 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage through which she has had four children (ages 21, 19, 15, and 3 years) who are all in university or school.  Her husband is a merchant.

This loan is for Mayita's husband's business.  He sells fruits and vegetables across the whole city and also visits areas surrounding the city.  Every morning he takes his motorcycle to the city's market to buy products wholesale.  He then goes out through the streets and other areas with his products.  Mayita says that her husband works hard during the days so that they do not lack anything.

Mayita is requesting this loan to help her husband with his business.  He will buy fruits and vegetables with it.  Mayita has been in the communal bank for six cycles and she likes it because it allows her to contribute in some way to her family's expenses.  Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nelly Margarita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Martha.

La señora Nelly  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero el menor de ellos que es soltero y estudia en la universidad en Manta aun viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de pescado en Manta.

Ella se dedica a la cría de aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos, nos cuenta que ella en temporadas compra de cien a doscientos pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, ella cuando ya están listos los pollos los pela y los entrega a algunas tiendas de la localidad y también vende por libras en su casa. Trabaja de tres a cuatro horas al día en la alimentación y cuidado de sus animalitos.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que tengan un mejor desarrollo. Sus sueños son que su hijo termine sus estudios
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the Santa Martha Communal Bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as a type of straw hats that are known both around Ecuador and abroad.

Ms. Nelly is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it for the support it offers and for the ease with which she is able to obtain credit.  She is 48 years old, married, and has five children from her marriage.  Most of them are grownups but the youngest is single, studies at the university in Manta, and still lives with her.  Her husband works at a fish factory in Manta.

Nelly raises caged birds and has a small chicken farm.  She says that at times she buys between 100 and 200 chickens, which she raises for three months, the time it takes for them to be ready for sale.  When her chickens are ready, she skins them and brings them to stores in her area.  She also sells them by the pound from her house.  She works between three and four hours each day feeding and caring for her little animals.

She will use this new loan to buy chickens, as well as feed and medicine for them so that they will develop better.  Her dream is for her youngest son to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy chickens, as well as food and medicine for chickens

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Martha.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 13 y 8 años, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. El marido fabrica ladrillos.

La señora María es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que junto a su marido se dedican a la dura tarea de fabricar ladrillos que son utilizados en el campo de la construcción, trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 7h30 hasta las 17h00, ellos fabrican los ladrillos y luego los entregan  a los comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar a todos los fabricantes de la zona.
 
Este crédito es para comprar materia prima para la fabricación de los ladrillos. La señora es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y por las reuniones ya que en ellas se divierte mucho. Sus sueños son tener una casa más grande.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the Santa Martha Communal Bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as a type of straw hats that are known both around Ecuador and abroad.

This is where we find Ms. María, who is 38 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage, through which she has had three children, ages 15, 13, and 8 years.  The two older children are in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school.  Her husband makes bricks.

Ms. María is a very hard-working woman who, together with her husband, does the difficult work of making bricks to be used for construction.  They work from Monday to Saturday from 7:30 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  They make the bricks and then bring them to a certain place where merchants come to buy from all of the manufacturers in the area.
 
This loan is for buying raw materials for making the bricks.  Ms. María is a founding member of her communal bank and likes it because of the benefits it offers and because she really enjoys herself at the meetings.  Her dream is to have a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bricks

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Martha.

En este lindo lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, ella tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, el menor de ellos tiene 13 años  y estudia en colegio. Su esposo trabaja de forma ocasional cuando hay trabajo. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en Montecristi.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años, se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, lo que más le gusta hacer es ropa de mujer aunque también cose camisas para caballeros. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Además de esto también tiene un negocio de venta de productos de plástico.
 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar materiales para la costura y productos de plástico. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un local donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the Santa Martha Communal Bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as a type of straw hats that are known both around Ecuador and abroad.

This beautiful place is where we find Ms. Rosa, who is 43 years old.  She is married and has three children from her marriage.  Two of her children are grown up and independent, while the youngest is 13 years old and studying in secondary school.  Her husband works sporadically when there is work available.  She has been learning dressmaking in Montecristi for several years.

She has a small sewing workshop where, for several years, she has been making all types of clothing.  She works by taking orders from individuals.  Her favorite thing to make is women's clothing, although she also sews men's shirts.  She works every day from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. and sometimes later.  Along with sewing, she also has a business selling plastic goods.

She is requesting this new loan to buy sewing materials and plastic products.  Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and to have a store where she can sell her plastic products.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc., as well as plastic products

loans.name: Jenny Mercedes

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Martha.

En este lindo lugar encontramos a la señora Jenny, ella tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  6 hijos, cinco de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor tiene 10 años y está en escuela. Su esposo fabrica ladrillos.

Ella es un ama de casa que junto a su esposo se dedican a fabricar ladrillos que son utilizados en el campo de la construcción, trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 8 h 00 hasta las 17 h 00, sus hijos trabajan con ellos a cambio de un sueldo semanal ya que ellos tienen sus propias familias. Fabrican los ladrillos y luego los entregan  a los comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar sus productos. 

Este crédito es para comprar materia prima para la fabricación de los ladrillos como aserrín, leña, agua, entre otros. La señora fue socia fundadora del Banco comunal luego se retiro por un ciclo y regreso hace tres ciclos le  gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Sus sueños son tener un carro para ir a entregar sus productos a los clientes.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of Santa Martha Community Bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city renowned for its diverse regional products, including the straw hats and shawls which are known throughout the country and beyond. 

It is in this beautiful place that we meet Jenny. Jenny is 49 years of age, married and has six children. Five of them are grown up and the youngest is 10 and at school. Her husband makes brick for a living. 

Jenny is a housewife and together with her husband she makes bricks that are then used for construction. They work from Monday to Friday, 8am to 5pm. Their children work for them and are paid a weekly salary since they all have their own families. Once the bricks are made, they are sold to merchants who come to their house to purchase their products. 

This loan will be used to purchase materials to make bricks, including saw dust, wood and water, amongst others. Jenny was the founding member of the Community Bank, and though she left the bank during one loan cycle, she returned to the bank three loan cycles ago and has been with them since. Jenny likes the loans that are offered through the bank because their interest rates are low. Her dream is to have a car so that she can deliver her products to her clients.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make bricks, including water, saw dust, wood, etc.

loans.name: Angela Juana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Martha.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Angela, ella tiene 21 años de edad, está casada hace 4 años pero aun no ha podido tener hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta. Para ella este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que le agrada porque con los créditos ella ha podido financiar su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta bajo pedido y cobra semanalmente, dice que lleva dedicada a esta actividad por tres años y que le encanta ya que se gana muchos premios.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros. Sus sueños es algún dia tener un bebé.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the Santa Martha Community Bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city renowned for its diverse regional products, including the straw hats and shawls that are known throughout the country and beyond.  

It is here that we meet Angela. Angela is 21 and has been married for 4 years but has not had any children yet. Her husband works in a factory in the city of Manta. This is her second loan cycle with the Community Bank and she tells us that she is happy with the loans she has taken out with the bank because it has allowed her to set up her business.

Angela sells Yanbal products, including beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women. She works every day selling door-to-door from 8:30am until 5pm, taking orders and receiving weekly payments. She says she has been working in this field for three years and she loves her work as she has won many awards.  

Angela will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, including perfumes, creams and cosmetics, amongst others. Her dream is to have a baby some day.

loans.use: Purchase creams, perfumes, cosmetics, costume jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Dios Proveera 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Yovany is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products. She will buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics and household products. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. She wants to have a successful, big wholesale store. In the short term, she wants to have a locale for her business. 

Yovany is a member of the group called Dios Proveera 1, 2 ("God Will ProviD."). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding L. Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics

loans.name: Ramona Verónica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Riobamba.

La señora Ramona tiene 40 años de edad,  está divorciada  y fruto de esa relación tiene dos hijas de 23 y 18 años, ambas estudian en la Universidad y viven con ella. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace cuatro ciclos y le agrada por sus facilidades de pago.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa. Trabaja cuatro días en la semana tres horas por dia, ella deja a  crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, lo que más vende es ropa para damas.  Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, pero en especial ropa de mujer. Sus sueños tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Mujeres De Riobamba Community Bank meet in Portoviejo, which has been known as the city of Royal Tamarinds since colonial times. 

Ramona is 40 years old and divorced. She has two daughters from this relationship who are 23 and 18 years of age. They both study at university and live with Ramona. Ramona has been with the Community Bank for four loan cycles and she is happy with the loan terms they offer. 

Ramona sells all types of clothing both from her house and door-to-door. She works for three hours a day, four days a week, selling clothes on credit to her customers and collecting the repayments each fortnight. She mostly sells women clothing which she purchases with the rest of her merchandise in Guayaquil on a fortnightly or monthly basis, depending on what she needs. 

Ramona will use this loan to purchase pants, t-shirts, shirts and especially clothes for women. Her dream is to have her own house, since she is currently renting.

loans.use: Purchase pants, t-shirts, shirts and especially clothes for women.

loans.name: Gregoria Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Riobamba.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Gregoria, tiene 41 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Su esposo se dedica al comercio, compra y vende  ganado vacuno y porcino, el se desplaza de lunes a viernes a los campos a comprar vacas y chanchos para luego llevarlos a los centros de faenamiento,  luego distribuye la carne a comerciantes de los mercados en la ciudad, mientras él se dedica a esto nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de carne  por libra en un local en el mercado de Portoviejo, en la tarde su esposo le ayuda con las ventas.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más vacas y chanchos para la venta diaria. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque en las reuniones se divierte y aprende mucho en las charlas de salud. Su sueño es agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres De Riobamba” (Women from Riobamba) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo.  Since colonial times this city has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

This is where we can find Gregoria.  She is 41 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  She has two children, ages 12 and 7.  Both of them go to school.  Her husband is a merchant; he buys and sells cows and pigs.  From Monday through Thursday he goes to farms to buy cows and pigs.  He later takes them to the slaughtering centers.  Then he distributes the meat to merchants in the city’s markets.  

While he does this, Gregoria sells meat by the pound at a place in the Portoviejo market.  In the afternoon her husband helps her with the sales.

She will use this loan to buy more cows and pigs for daily sales.  She is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because the meetings are fun, and she learns a lot in the health talks.  

Her dream is to make her house bigger.

loans.use: Buy cows and pigs

loans.name: Elsa Ydalinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Riobamba.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Elsa, tiene 56 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos, ya todos son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos vive en su casa. El marido es pintor. Ella es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a otras instituciones financieras.

Trabaja en una boutique, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta. Trabaja todas las noches y los sabados y domingos todo el día, deja a  crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, lo que más vende son jeans tanto de hombres como de mujeres.  Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil o manda a traer desde Quito.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, pero en especial jeans. Sus sueños tener un carro para poder trasladarse y realizar sus ventas de una manera mas cómoda.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres De Riobamba” (Women from Riobamba) meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo.  Since colonial times this city has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

This is where we can find Elsa.  She is 66 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  They have seven children.  All of them are adults, and the youngest child lives in her house.  Her husband is a painter.  She is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because the interest is very low compared to other financial institutions.

She works in a boutique, but she also sells clothes door to door.  She works every night and all day Saturday and Sunday.  She gives her customers credit, and she collects every two weeks.  What she sells the most are jeans for men and women.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil or she sends to Quito for it.

This loan is to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and especially jeans.  Her dream is to have a car to be able to travel and make her sales in a more comfortable manner.

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and jeans

loans.name: Merlis Estrella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Riobamba.

Merlis es socia  fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que la institución brinda tanto a ella como a sus compañeras del grupo. Tiene 30 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Estudio en la Universidad y obtuvo el título de Ing. Comercial.

Trabaja de profesora en un jardín de infantes y en un colegio, pero también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) y ropa de todo tipo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h30 hasta las 12h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, cobra semanalmente. La ropa la compra en Guayaquil.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y productos de Avon. Sus sueños son estudiar Ciencias de la Educación, para tener el titulo de maestra también.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres De Riobamba” (Women from Riobamba) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo.  Since colonial times this city has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Merlis is a founding member of the Communal Bank.  She likes it for the help that the institution offers to her as well as to her colleagues in the group.  She is 30 years old and single.  She lives in her parents’ house.  She attended the University, and she got her degree in Commercial Engineering.

She works as a teacher in a pre-school and in an elementary school.  But, she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories) and all types of clothes.  She works every day from 7:30 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.  She sells door to door and by order.  She collects weekly.  She buys the clothes in Guayaquil.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and Avon products.

She dreams of studying Educational Sciences in order to have her teaching degree as well.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and Avon products

loans.name: Memena's Group

texts.en:
Memena is the coordinator of her group, called Dios Proveera 3, 5 (God will provide). She is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanding her business. She operates a clothing store and is planning to invest in it by buying different types of clothes, for men, women and kids. She will use any profits to reinvest in her business, Christmas time sales are really good, and that's why she wants to have plenty of merchandise. 

Memena's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children. She wants to be strong for work and help her children to have a good education.

The small picture in the lower right corner is the group coordinator, Memena.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 38 years old.  He is single and has no children.  He lives in his father’s home in the district of Tambogrande. Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone which is primarily populated by farmers. Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.

Wilfredo works in a local mango factory earning 12 PEN per week.  In addition to the factory work, Wilfredo raises animals on property near the family home.  He currently has 50 sheep and 30 ducks.  He feeds and cares for these animals until they reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold in local markets. He sells the animals for their meat.

This will be his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to purchase balanced feed for his animals in order to improve their health and productivity. He hopes that the investment will assist him in growing his business and thus, further provide for his family.  He appreciates having access to credit at a reduced interest rate as a result of the funding through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his animals in order to improve their health and productivity

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en:
Maria is 25 years old. She lives in her parents' home and has one child. She is a single mother. The family lives in the district of Las Lomas.  Las Lomas is a semi-tropical zone which is primarily populated by farmers. Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.

Maria works with her parents to raise fowl and maintain a small general store in their home. They raise the birds for their eggs and meat, selling them in local markets. The general store is an important part of the neighborhood, providing easy access for the locals to basic items such as food, dry goods, beverages and hygienic supplies. In addition to helping her parents, Maria sells beauty supplies from the line ESIKA. She makes two major purchases per month and has a good number of loyal clients. She sells the items on request, on credit, and from a small inventory she maintains.

Maria plans to use the funds from this loan to expand her beauty supply inventory and finance purchases of her clients during the holiday season. She hopes this investment will improve her number of clients and lead to greater client loyalty. She is a hardworking, young mother with a strong desire to get ahead and provide opportunities to her child.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and finance purchases of her clients during the holiday season

loans.name: Blanca Betty

texts.en:
Blanca is forty-nine years old.  She lives in the district of Tambogrande.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone that is populated primarily by farmers.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Blanca shares her home with her husband and their two children.

Blanca and her husband own an orchard that they inherited from their parents.  They have mango and maracuya (passion fruit, which is similar to pomegranates and grows on a vine) planted on the land with many mature trees producing fruit.  Blanca cares for the trees and harvests the fruit on a weekly basis given the constant growing season in the area.  Her husband is a professor.  His salary pays for the majority of the family’s expenses, leaving the orchard to provide for additional needs.

Blanca is new to Edpyme Alternativa, and she appreciates the opportunity to access credit at a reduced interest rate as a result of the funding through Kiva.  She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to improve production and protect her crops.  She hopes that the investment will improve ongoing production and thus increase the income of her household.  She is a very hard-working woman with many dreams for the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Juana Elvira

texts.en:
Juana is fifty years old.  She maintains a stable home, living with her husband and their three children.  The family lives in the district of TambogranD..  TambogranD. is a semi-tropical zone which is populated primarily by farmers.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.

Juana raises animals in corrals near her home.  She raises sheep and fowl, specifically ducks and chickens.  She raises the animals for eggs and meat.  She feeds and cares for her herd until the animals reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold in local markets.  The animals play an important role in the nutrition of the local populace and the culinary traditions of the region.  Juana’s husband works outsiD. of the home and spends the entire day in the field.

Juana plans to use her loan to purchase balanced feed for her animals.  She hopes the feed will improve the health of her animals and the productivity of her business.  This will be her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

Juana is a hard-working woman with good references from the community.  She dreams of being able to finance a full education for her children, including college.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.en:
Maria is sixty-five years old.  She lives in the district of TambogranD..  TambogranD. is a semi-tropical zone which is populated primarily by farmers.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Maria lives with her husband and their three children, and the couple maintain a stable home.

Maria raises animals in corrals behind her home.  She cares for and feeds the animals until they reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold for their meat.  The animals serve an important role in the nutrition of the local populace and are an integral part of the local culinary tradition.  Her husband manages a small fruit plantation that the couple owns and that is planted with limes.  He harvests the fruit every fifteen days.  Between the two agricultural businesses, the family is able to maintain a relatively stable income.

This will be Maria’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa, although she has worked with other financial institutions in the past.  She appreciates the access to a reduced interest rate that is provided as a result of the funding through Kiva.  She plans to use her loan to purchase more balanced feed and animals in order to improve productivity and the health of her animals.  She hopes that the investment will increase her family’s income and proviD. a greater opportunity to invest in the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more balanced feed and animals

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.en:
Maria is forty-seven years old.  She lives in the district of Tambogrande.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone which is populated primarily by farmers.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Maria shares her home with her husband, who is a field laborer with permanent work on a large local farm.  Between the two of them, they manage to maintain a stable lifestyle and a happy home.

Maria raises and cares for sheep and cattle.  The cattle are dairy producers; Maria harvests their milk regularly and sells it to her neighbors or for further processing.  The sheep are raised for their meat; Maria cares for the sheep until they reach the appropriate size and weight for sale in local markets.  In total, the family has five dairy cows and sixteen sheep.  The animals play an integral role in the local culinary tradition and nutrition.

This will be Maria’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa, although she has worked with other financial institutions in the past.  She appreciates the access to a reduced interest rate that is provided as a result of the funding through Kiva.  She plans to use the loan to purchase more balanced feed for her animals and hopes that the investment will improve their general health and productivity.  By improving productivity, she expects to further improve and stabilize her family’s income, providing greater opportunity and stability for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more balanced feed

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.en:
Maria is forty-three years old.  She maintains a stable home, living with her husband and their three children.  The family lives in the district of Tambogrande.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone which is populated primarily by farmers.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.

Maria raises sheep in corrals near her home.  She feeds and cares for the animals until they reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold for their meat in local markets.  The animals play an important role in meeting the nutritional needs of local residents and are an integral part of the local culinary tradition.  Maria’s husband manages a small parcel of land the family owns and also works as a farmhand helping local growers with the maintenance and harvest of their crops.

This will be Maria’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the loan to purchase balanced feed for her animals in order to improve their health and productivity.  She hopes to be able to take advantage of bulk discounts.  She has planned this investment to increase the sustainability of her business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed

loans.name: Pedro Hermangol

texts.en:
Pedro is thirty-seven years old. He lives in the district of Tambogrande.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone which is primarily populated by farmers.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals. Pedro maintains a stable home, living with his wife and their three children.

Pedro is a farmer and raises animals. He has forty-two sheep which he raises for their meat. He feeds and protects the animals until the reach the appropriate size and weight, at which point he sells them to neighbors, wholesalers or in local markets.  In addition to the animals, he has one and a quarter hecatares of land on which he currently has a crop of rice planted. His wife raises and cares for chickens and ducks, which are kept in corrals near the family’s home.

This will be Pedro’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to use the funds to purchase additional animals and balanced feed for this sheep.  He expects to be able to improve the productivity of his animal raising operation and through this action improve the income of his family.  He hopes to one day be able to make various improvements to his home and be able to provide his children with greater educational opportunities.

loans.use: Purchase additional animals and balanced feed for these sheep.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con bastante acogida debido al buen trato que brinda y a la calidad de productos que ofrece. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería para poder ampliar su bodega, aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 40 year old mother.  She lives with her children in the Lambayeque district, an area with a lot of commercial activity.  It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small grocery store in her home.  She sells diverse daily consumption products, basic needs products, and groceries to her customers.  The business is very well received due to the good service provided and the quality of the products she sells.  The income she gets from this business activity is to help her husband support her family.

Maria wishes to increase her business.  She will do this by getting more merchandise in order to be able to expand her grocery store, increase sales, and get more income.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This will help her obtain her objective.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to be able to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y tres de sus seis hijos en el centro poblado menor Motupillo, del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde hace más de 30 años, el tiempo que lleva viviendo en la zona, usualmente siembra caña, maíz y yuca. Actualmente planea instalar un cultivo de maíz para solventar la economía de su familia. 

Este negocio no es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta, ya que es consciente de que los ingresos que percibe por agricultura son temporales, por ello también se gana la criando y vendiendo cuyes  para consumo humano, el  cría sus animales en su vivienda para venderlos a los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive.

Tomás desea adquirir financiamiento para instalar su cultivo de maíz, además de brindarle un buen mantenimiento para asegurarse una buena producción. Por ese motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Tomás ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y de su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad también solicitó el crédito para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz y gracias a ello puedo obtener una buena cosecha, motivo por el cual se encuentra bastante agradecido con la comunidad de prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Tomás, age 62, lives with his wife and three of their six children.  They live in center of a small town called Motupillo, in the Pítipo district.  It is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

He has worked in agriculture for more than thirty years, the whole time he has lived in the area.  He usually grows sugar cane, corn and yucca.  He is now planning to plant corn in order to pay the family expenses.

This business is not his only source of income.  He is aware that the income he receives from farming is seasonal, which is why he also raises and sells guinea pigs for human consumption.  He raises his animals at his home in order to sell them to the
businessmen who usually visit the area where he lives.

Tomás wants a loan to plant his corn crop.   He also wants to provide good maintenance in order to assure good production. For this reason he has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 soles to help him achieve his objective. 

Tomás has had a loan from Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and their Capital Semilla (Seed Capital) project.  With that opportunity he also asked for a loan to provide maintenance on his corn crop.  Thanks to the loan, he was able to have a good harvest.  That is why he is very grateful to the community of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expenses to plant and provide maintenance on his corn crop

loans.name: Yesenia Renee

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Tucume, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes, productos comestibles, golosinas y bebidas, para lo cual posee una bodega, la cual funciona en su domicilio. Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario con los cuales trata de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Este negocio es de mucha utilidad para la economía de su familia por lo que Yesenia siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Ella desea comprar abarrotes para satisfacer la demanda que suele aumentar durante la temporada de fiestas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 32 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the district of Tucume, an agricultural area with a considerable amount of commercial activity.  It is located in the province of Lambayeque, one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells groceries, edible goods, candies, and drinks.  She has a bodega set up in her house for this purpose.  She offers her customers a variety of commonly-used products, in an effort to satisfy their demands.  This business has been very useful for her family's economic situation, so Yesenia always tries to keep it running as well as possible.

She would like to buy groceries in order to meet the typical increase in demand during the holiday season.  In order to achieve her goal, she has decided to request a loan of 1500 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy groceries in order to meet the typical increase in demand around the holidays

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar tiene 48 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el sector Diego Ferré, una zona urbano -  marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Una de las ciudades más comerciales del norte peruano, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la elaboración y venta de bebidas como soja y avena, el adquiere sus insumos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo y las vende por litros en los diversos barrios de la ciudad de Chiclayo, para ello se vale de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte de carga y pasajeros).

Julio Cesar desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más insumos de modo que pueda ampliar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 48 years old, single, and lives with his family in Diego Ferré, an urban area on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo.  One of the most commercialized cities in northern Peru, it is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has been making and selling soy- and oat-based drinks for five years.  He buys his ingredients at the main wholesale market in Chiclayo and sells them by the liter in different neighborhoods of Chiclayo.  He does this using a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached for carrying cargo or passengers).

Julio Cesar would like to expand his business by buying more ingredients so that he can increase his level of sales and bring in more profits.  This is why he decided to request a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for expanding his business of selling soy- and oat-based beverages

loans.name: Lucila Jannet

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside junto a sus hijos en casa de sus padres ubicada en el sector Saltur del distrito de Zaña, una zona situada a más de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella ya lleva más de dos años en esta actividad y gracias a ella ha podido agenciarse de ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Usualmente cría patos, gallinas, pavos y cuyes en algunos ambientes ubicados en su domicilio, en donde los ha acondicionado según cada especie.

Lucila vende sus animales una vez que estos ya hayan alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo, sus clientes son los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside y el público en general.

Lucila desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de alimentos para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y de ese modo poder venderlos a un mejor precio durante estas fiestas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lucila is a 31 year-old mother who lives with her children in her parents' house, which is located in the Saltur sector of Zaña district.  This area is situated more than 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works raising young animals.  She has been doing this work for more than two years and thanks to her efforts she has been able to bring in more revenue and to help her children get ahead.  She typically raises ducks, chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs.  She has special environments at her house that she has fashioned for each species.

Lucila sells her animals once they have reached a good level of development.  Her customers are merchants who visit the area where she lives, and the public in general.

Lucila hopes to expand her business by purchasing feed to better care for her animals, so that she can sell them for a better price during the holidays.  This is why she decided to request a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy feed to improve care for the animals she raises

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
María Julia tiene 67 años D. edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos ya independizados. ResiD. junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Picsi, una zona agrícola que s encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. cervezas en su domicilio desD. hace más D. 15 años. Su negocio es bastante conocido en la zona debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad y al buen trato con el que suele atender a sus clientes. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le permiten ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. los gastos familiares.

María desea adquirir más cerveza para satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes durante esta temporada. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Julia is 67 years old, married, and has four adult children.  She lives with her husband in the district of Picsi, an agricultural area located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been selling beer from her house for over 15 years.  Her business is rather well known in the area because of how long she has been doing this work and for the good treatment she shows her customers.  With the income provided by this business, she is able to help her husband with meeting their household expenses.
